                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__setwindowcontexthelpid">CWnd::SetWindowContextHelpId</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Sets the help context identifier.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__setwindowplacement">CWnd::SetWindowPlacement</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Sets the show state and the normal (restored), minimized, and maximized positions for a window.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__setwindowpos">CWnd::SetWindowPos</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Changes the size, position, and ordering of child, pop-up, and top-level windows.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__setwindowrgn">CWnd::SetWindowRgn</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Sets the region of a window.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__setwindowtext">CWnd::SetWindowText</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Sets the window text or caption title (if it has one) to the specified text.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__showcaret">CWnd::ShowCaret</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Shows the caret on the display at the caret's current position. Once shown, the caret begins flashing automatically.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__showownedpopups">CWnd::ShowOwnedPopups</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Shows or hides all pop-up windows owned by the window.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__showscrollbar">CWnd::ShowScrollBar</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Displays or hides a scroll bar.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__showwindow">CWnd::ShowWindow</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Shows or hides the window.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__subclassdlgitem">CWnd::SubclassDlgItem</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Attaches a Windows control to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object and makes it route messages through the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>'s message map.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__subclasswindow">CWnd::SubclassWindow</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Attaches a window to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object and makes it route messages through the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>'s message map.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__unlockwindowupdate">CWnd::UnlockWindowUpdate</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Unlocks a window that was locked with <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::LockWindowUpdate</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__unsubclasswindow">CWnd::UnsubclassWindow</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Detaches a window from a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd </unmanagedCodeEntityReference>object</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__updatedata">CWnd::UpdateData</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Initializes or retrieves data from a dialog box.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__updatedialogcontrols">CWnd::UpdateDialogControls</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Call to update the state of dialog buttons and other controls.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__updatelayeredwindow">CWnd::UpdateLayeredWindow</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Updates the position, size, shape, content, and translucency of a layered window.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__updatewindow">CWnd::UpdateWindow</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Updates the client area.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__validaterect">CWnd::ValidateRect</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Validates the client area within the given rectangle by removing the rectangle from the current update region.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__validatergn">CWnd::ValidateRgn</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Validates the client area within the given region by removing the region from the current update region.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__windowfrompoint">CWnd::WindowFromPoint</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Identifies the window that contains the given point.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__winhelp">CWnd::WinHelp</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called to initiate the WinHelp application.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                        </tbody>
                    </table>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Protected Methods</title>
                <content>
                    <table xmlns:caps="http://schemas.microsoft.com/build/caps/2013/11">
                        <thead>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Name</para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Description</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                        </thead>
                        <tbody>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__default">CWnd::Default</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Calls the default window procedure, which provides default processing for any window messages that an application does not process.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__defwindowproc">CWnd::DefWindowProc</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Calls the default window procedure, which provides default processing for any window messages that an application does not process.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__dodataexchange">CWnd::DoDataExchange</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>For dialog data exchange and validation. Called by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>UpdateData</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__getcurrentmessage">CWnd::GetCurrentMessage</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Returns a pointer to the message this window is currently processing. Should only be called when in an <languageKeyword>On</languageKeyword>
                                        <placeholder>Message</placeholder> message-handler member function.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__initdynamiclayout">CWnd::InitDynamicLayout</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called by the framework to initialize the dynamic layout for the window.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__loaddynamiclayoutresource">CWnd::LoadDynamicLayoutResource</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Loads dynamic layout information from the resource file.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onactivate">CWnd::OnActivate</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is being activated or deactivated.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onactivateapp">CWnd::OnActivateApp</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the application is about to be activated or deactivated.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onappcommand">CWnd::OnAppCommand</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the user generates an application command event.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onaskcbformatname">CWnd::OnAskCbFormatName</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called by a Clipboard viewer application when a Clipboard owner will display the Clipboard contents.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__oncancelmode">CWnd::OnCancelMode</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called to allow <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to cancel any internal modes, such as mouse capture.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__oncapturechanged">CWnd::OnCaptureChanged</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Sends a message to the window that is losing the mouse capture.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onchangecbchain">CWnd::OnChangeCbChain</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Notifies that a specified window is being removed from the chain.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onchangeuistate">CWnd::OnChangeUIState</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the user interface (UI) state should be changed.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onchar">CWnd::OnChar</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when a keystroke translates to a non-system character.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onchartoitem">CWnd::OnCharToItem</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called by a child list box with the <legacyLink xlink:href="3f357b8d-9118-4f41-9e28-02ed92d1e88f">LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT</legacyLink> style in response to a <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onchar">WM_CHAR</legacyLink> message.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onchildactivate">CWnd::OnChildActivate</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called for multiple document interface (MDI) child windows whenever the size or position of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> changes or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is activated.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onchildnotify">CWnd::OnChildNotify</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called by a parent window to give a notifying control a chance to respond to a control notification.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onclipboardupdate">CWnd::OnClipboardUpdate</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the contents of the clipboard have changed.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onclose">CWnd::OnClose</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called as a signal that <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> should be closed.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__oncolorizationcolorchanged">CWnd::OnColorizationColorChanged</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the rendering policy for the non-client area has changed.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__oncommand">CWnd::OnCommand</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the user selects a command.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__oncompacting">CWnd::OnCompacting</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when Windows detects that system memory is low.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__oncompareitem">CWnd::OnCompareItem</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called to determine the relative position of a new item in a child sorted owner-draw combo box or list box.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__oncompositionchanged">CWnd::OnCompositionChanged</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called for all top-level windows when the Desktop Window Manager (DWM) composition is enabled or disabled.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__oncontextmenu">CWnd::OnContextMenu</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the user clicks the right mouse button in the window.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__oncopydata">CWnd::OnCopyData</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Copies data from one application to another.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__oncreate">CWnd::OnCreate</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called as a part of window creation.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onctlcolor">CWnd::OnCtlColor</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called if <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is the parent of a control when the control is about to be drawn.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__ondeadchar">CWnd::OnDeadChar</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when a keystroke translates to a nonsystem dead character (such as accent characters).</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__ondeleteitem">CWnd::OnDeleteItem</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when an owner-draw child list box or combo box is destroyed or when items are removed from the control.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__ondestroy">CWnd::OnDestroy</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is being destroyed.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__ondestroyclipboard">CWnd::OnDestroyClipboard</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the Clipboard is emptied through a call to the Windows                                         <externalLink> <linkText>EmptyClipboard</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms649037</linkUri>
                                        </externalLink> function.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__ondevicechange">CWnd::OnDeviceChange</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Notifies an application or device driver of a change to the hardware configuration of a device or the computer.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__ondevmodechange">CWnd::OnDevModeChange</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called for all top-level windows when the user changes device-mode settings.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__ondrawclipboard">CWnd::OnDrawClipboard</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the contents of the Clipboard change.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__ondrawitem">CWnd::OnDrawItem</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when a visual aspect of an owner-draw child button control, combo-box control, list-box control, or menu needs to be drawn.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__ondropfiles">CWnd::OnDropFiles</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the user releases the left mouse button over a window that has registered itself as the recipient of dropped files.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onenable">CWnd::OnEnable</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is enabled or disabled.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onendsession">CWnd::OnEndSession</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the session is ending.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onenteridle">CWnd::OnEnterIdle</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called to inform an application's main window procedure that a modal dialog box or a menu is entering an idle state.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onentermenuloop">CWnd::OnEnterMenuLoop</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when a menu modal loop has been entered.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onentersizemove">CWnd::OnEnterSizeMove</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called after the affected window enters a moving or sizing modal loop.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onerasebkgnd">CWnd::OnEraseBkgnd</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the window background needs erasing.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onexitmenuloop">CWnd::OnExitMenuLoop</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when a menu modal loop has been exited.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onexitsizemove">CWnd::OnExitSizeMove</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called after the affected window exits a moving or sizing modal loop.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onfontchange">CWnd::OnFontChange</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the pool of font resources changes.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__ongetdlgcode">CWnd::OnGetDlgCode</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called for a control so the control can process arrow-key and TAB-key input itself.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__ongetminmaxinfo">CWnd::OnGetMinMaxInfo</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called whenever Windows needs to know the maximized position or dimensions, or the minimum or maximum tracking size.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onhelpinfo">CWnd::OnHelpInfo</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called by the framework when the user presses the F1 key.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onhotkey">CWnd::OnHotKey</link>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Called when the user presses a system-wide hot key.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <link xlink:href="#cwnd__onhscroll">CWnd::OnHScroll</link>
                                    </para>

    <languageReferenceRemarks>
        <content>
            <para>A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is distinct from a Windows window, but the two are tightly linked. A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is created or destroyed by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> constructor and destructor. The Windows window, on the other hand, is a data structure internal to Windows that is created by a <legacyBold>Create</legacyBold> member function and destroyed by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> virtual destructor. The <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__destroywindow">DestroyWindow</legacyLink> function destroys the Windows window without destroying the object. </para>
            <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> class and the message-map mechanism hide the <legacyBold>WndProc</legacyBold> function. Incoming Windows notification messages are automatically routed through the message map to the proper <legacyBold>On</legacyBold>
                <legacyItalic>Message</legacyItalic> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member functions. You override an <legacyBold>On</legacyBold>
                <legacyItalic>Message</legacyItalic> member function to handle a member's particular message in your derived classes.</para>
            <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> class also lets you create a Windows child window for your application. Derive a class from <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, then add member variables to the derived class to store data specific to your application. Implement message-handler member functions and a message map in the derived class to specify what happens when messages are directed to the window.</para>
            <para>You create a child window in two steps. First, call the constructor <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to construct the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object, then call the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__create">Create</legacyLink> member function to create the child window and attach it to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object. </para>
            <para>When the user terminates your child window, destroy the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object, or call the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DestroyWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function to remove the window and destroy its data structures.</para>
            <para>Within the Microsoft Foundation Class Library, further classes are derived from <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to provide specific window types. Many of these classes, including <legacyLink xlink:href="e2220aba-5bf4-4002-b960-fbcafcad01f1">CFrameWnd</legacyLink>, <legacyLink xlink:href="fa8736e6-511b-4c51-8b4d-eba78378aeb9">CMDIFrameWnd</legacyLink>, <legacyLink xlink:href="6d07f5d4-9a3e-4723-9fa5-e65bb669fdd5">CMDIChildWnd</legacyLink>, <legacyLink xlink:href="9cff3c56-7564-416b-b9a4-71a9254ed755">CView</legacyLink>, and <legacyLink xlink:href="ca64b77e-2cd2-47e3-8eff-c2645ad578f9">CDialog</legacyLink>, are designed for further derivation. The control classes derived from <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, such as <legacyLink xlink:href="cdc76d5b-31da-43c5-bc43-fde4cb39de5b">CButton</legacyLink>, can be used directly or can be used for further derivation of classes.</para>
            <para>For more information on using <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, see <legacyLink xlink:href="40677339-8135-4f5e-aba6-3fced3078077">Frame Windows</legacyLink> and <legacyLink xlink:href="28b33ce2-af05-4617-9d03-1cb9a02be687">Window Objects</legacyLink>.</para>
        </content>
    </languageReferenceRemarks>

    <section address="cwnd__accdodefaultaction">
        <!--af198d5d-ac2b-4041-a85f-a50a4c93ede9-->
        <title>CWnd::accDoDefaultAction</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called by the framework to perform the object's default action.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual HRESULT accDoDefaultAction( VARIANT varChild );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>varChild</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the default action to be invoked is that of the object or one of the object's child elements. This parameter can be either CHILDID_SELF (to perform the object's default action) or a child ID (to perform the default action of one of the object's child elements).</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Returns S_OK on success, a COM error code on failure. See                         <embeddedLabel>Return Values</embeddedLabel> in                         <externalLink> <linkText>IAccessible::accDoDefaultAction</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd318470</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This function is part of MFC's                         <externalLink> <linkText>Active Accessibility</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd373592</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> support.</para>
                    <para>Override this function in your <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>-derived class to perform your object's default action. For more information, see                         <externalLink> <linkText>IAccessible::accDoDefaultAction</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd318470</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>

                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>

See                                 <legacyItalic>pvarID</legacyItalic> in                                 <externalLink> <linkText>IAccessible::accHitTest</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd318471</linkUri>

            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>

                        </externalLink> support.</para>
                    <para>Override this function in your <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>-derived class if you have nonwindowed user interface elements (other than windowless ActiveX controls, which MFC handles).</para>
                    <para>For more information, see                         <externalLink> <linkText>IAccessible::accHitTest</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd318471</linkUri>

                </content>

        <title>CWnd::accLocation</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called by the framework to retrieve the specified object's current screen location.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual HRESULT accLocation(
    long * pxLeft,
    long * pyTop,
    long * pcxWidth,
    long * pcyHeight,
    VARIANT varChild );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pxLeft</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Receives x-coordinate of the object's upper-left corner (in screen units).</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pyTop</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Receives y-coordinate of the object's upper-left corner (in screen units).</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pcxWidth</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Receives width of the object (in screen units).</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pcyHeight</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Receives height of the object (in screen units).</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>varChild</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the location to be retrieved is that of the object or one of the object's child elements. This parameter can be either CHILDID_SELF (to obtain information about the object) or a child ID (to obtain information about the object's child element).</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Returns S_OK on success, a COM error code on failure. See                         <embeddedLabel>Return Values</embeddedLabel> in <legacyBold>IAccessible::accLocation</legacyBold> in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Override this function in your <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>-derived class if you have nonwindowed user interface elements (other than windowless ActiveX controls, which MFC handles).</para>
                    <para>For more information, see <legacyBold>IAccessible::accLocation</legacyBold> in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>

            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>

        <title>CWnd::AnimateWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Produces special effects when showing or hiding windows.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL AnimateWindow(
    DWORD dwTime,
    DWORD dwFlags );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>dwTime</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies how long it takes to play the animation, in milliseconds. Typically, an animation takes 200 milliseconds to play.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the type of animation. For a full list of possible values, see                                 <externalLink> <linkText>AnimateWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632669</linkUri>
                                </externalLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function succeeds; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>AnimateWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632669</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__arrangeiconicwindows">
        <!--4090855b-2436-4cba-9a17-ef4dc7e02973-->
        <title>CWnd::ArrangeIconicWindows</title>
        <content>
            <para>Arranges all the minimized (iconic) child windows.</para>
            <legacySyntax>UINT ArrangeIconicWindows();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The height of one row of icons if the function is successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function also arranges icons on the desktop window, which covers the entire screen. The <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__getdesktopwindow">GetDesktopWindow</legacyLink> member function retrieves a pointer to the desktop window object. </para>
                    <para>To arrange iconic MDI child windows in an MDI client window, call <legacyLink xlink:href="fa8736e6-511b-4c51-8b4d-eba78378aeb9#cmdiframewnd__mdiiconarrange">CMDIFrameWnd::MDIIconArrange</legacyLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#66</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>

    <section address="cwnd__beginpaint">
        <!--c61f03d7-7d43-4da5-8149-7c415e0df109-->
        <title>CWnd::BeginPaint</title>
        <content>
            <para>Prepares <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> for painting and fills a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PAINTSTRUCT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> data structure with information about the painting.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CDC* BeginPaint( LPPAINTSTRUCT lpPaint );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpPaint</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to the <legacyLink xlink:href="81ce4993-3e89-43b2-8c98-7946f1314d24">PAINTSTRUCT</legacyLink> structure that is to receive painting information.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the device context for <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. The pointer may be temporary and should not be stored beyond the scope of <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__endpaint">EndPaint</legacyLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The paint structure contains a <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> data structure that has the smallest rectangle that completely encloses the update region and a flag that specifies whether the background has been erased. </para>
                    <para>The update region is set by the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__invalidate">Invalidate</legacyLink>, <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__invalidaterect">InvalidateRect</legacyLink>, or <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__invalidatergn">InvalidateRgn</legacyLink> member functions and by the system after it sizes, moves, creates, scrolls, or performs any other operation that affects the client area. If the update region is marked for erasing, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BeginPaint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> sends an <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onerasebkgnd">WM_ONERASEBKGND</legacyLink> message.</para>
                    <para>Do not call the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BeginPaint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function except in response to a <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onpaint">WM_PAINT</legacyLink> message. Each call to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BeginPaint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function must have a matching call to the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__endpaint">EndPaint</legacyLink> member function. If the caret is in the area to be painted, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BeginPaint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function automatically hides the caret to prevent it from being erased.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#70</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__binddefaultproperty">
        <!--88e0c87c-837a-4b30-8153-738e0842f27a-->
        <title>CWnd::BindDefaultProperty</title>
        <content>
            <para>Binds the calling object's default simple bound property (such as an edit control), as marked in the type library, to the underlying cursor that is defined by the DataSource, UserName, Password, and SQL properties of the data-source control.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void BindDefaultProperty(
    DISPID dwDispID,
    VARTYPE vtProp,
    LPCTSTR szFieldName,
    CWnd * pDSCWnd );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwDispID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the DISPID of a property on a data-bound control that is to be bound to a data-source control.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>vtProp</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the type of the property to be bound  for example, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>VT_BSTR</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, <legacyBold>VT_VARIANT</legacyBold>, and so on.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>szFieldName</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the name of the column, in the cursor provided by the data-source control, to which the property will be bound.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pDSCWnd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to the window that hosts the data-source control to which the property will be bound. Call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetDlgItem</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with the resource ID of the DCS's host window to retrieve this pointer.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object on which you call this function must be a data-bound control.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BindDefaultProperty</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> might be used in the following context:</para>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFC_AxDataBinding#1,2,3</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__bindproperty">
        <!--bbcdbf16-2158-415a-b121-ee52f1d43366-->
        <title>CWnd::BindProperty</title>
        <content>
            <para>Binds a cursor-bound property on a data-bound control (such as a grid control) to a data-source control and registers that relationship with the MFC binding manager.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void BindProperty(

                <title>Parameters</title>

                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pWndDSC</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to the window that hosts the data-source control to which the property will be bound. Call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetDlgItem</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with the resource ID of the DCS's host window to retrieve this pointer.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>

                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object on which you call this function must be a data-bound control. </para>
                </content>

            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BindProperty</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> might be used in the following context:</para>

    <section address="cwnd__bringwindowtotop">
        <!--677e451f-c08e-44e8-a23d-d848b9bacc91-->
        <title>CWnd::BringWindowToTop</title>
        <content>
            <para>Brings <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to the top of a stack of overlapping windows.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void BringWindowToTop();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>In addition, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BringWindowToTop</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> activates pop-up, top-level, and MDI child windows. The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BringWindowToTop</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function should be used to uncover any window that is partially or completely obscured by any overlapping windows. </para>
                    <para>This function just calls the Win32                         <externalLink> <linkText>BringWindowToTop</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632673(v=vs.85).aspx</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> function. Call the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__setwindowpos">SetWindowPos</legacyLink> function to change a window's position in the Z-order. The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BringWindowToTop</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> function does not change the window style to make it a top-level window. For more information, see                         <externalLink> <linkText>What's the difference between HWND_TOP and HWND_TOPMOST?</linkText> <linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/oldnewthing/archive/2005/11/21/495246.aspx</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>
                    </para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#71</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__calcwindowrect">
        <!--a40592c4-9cd7-4810-9ad0-ea69b98ac1a9-->
        <title>CWnd::CalcWindowRect</title>
        <content>
            <para>Calculates the window rectangle that can contain the specified client rectangle.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual void CalcWindowRect(
    LPRECT lpClientRect,
    UINT nAdjustType = adjustBorder );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>[in, out] <parameterReference>lpClientRect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a rectangle structure. On input, this structure contains the client rectangle. After the method is finished, this structure contains the window rectangle that can contain the specified client rectangle.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>[in] <parameterReference>nAdjustType</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Use <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::adjustBorder</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to calculate window coordinates without the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> style; otherwise, use <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::adjustOutside</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The size of the calculated window rectangle does not include space for a menu bar.</para>
                    <para>For more usage restrictions, see                         <externalLink> <linkText>AdjustWindowRectEx</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632667</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#72</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__canceltooltips">
        <!--55bbf7c6-124d-4f2e-84b6-a183a2897e15-->
        <title>CWnd::CancelToolTips</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to remove a tool tip from the screen if a tool tip is currently displayed.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static void PASCAL CancelToolTips( BOOL bKeys = FALSE  );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>bKeys</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para> <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> to cancel tool tips when a key is pressed and set the status bar text to the default; otherwise <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>. </para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>Using this member function has no effect on tool tips managed by your code. It only affects the tool tip control managed by <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__enabletooltips">CWnd::EnableToolTips</legacyLink>.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#73</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__centerwindow">
        <!--27d0d7d1-374a-4e73-8639-004291b634b9-->
        <title>CWnd::CenterWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Centers a window relative to its parent.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void CenterWindow( CWnd* pAlternateOwner = NULL );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pAlternateOwner</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to an alternate window relative to which it will be centered (other than the parent window).</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Usually called from <legacyLink xlink:href="ca64b77e-2cd2-47e3-8eff-c2645ad578f9#cdialog__oninitdialog">CDialog::OnInitDialog</legacyLink> to center dialog boxes relative to the main window of the application. By default, the function centers child windows relative to their parent window, and pop-up windows relative to their owner. If the pop-up window is not owned, it is centered relative to the screen. To center a window relative to a specific window which is not the owner or parent, the <parameterReference>pAlternateOwner</parameterReference> parameter may be set to a valid window. To force centering relative to the screen, pass the value returned by <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__getdesktopwindow">CWnd::GetDesktopWindow</legacyLink> as <parameterReference>pAlternateOwner</parameterReference>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#74</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__changeclipboardchain">
        <!--350c9f51-ddef-4ae6-9886-db5d96bebf86-->
        <title>CWnd::ChangeClipboardChain</title>
        <content>
            <para>Removes <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> from the chain of Clipboard viewers and makes the window specified by <parameterReference>hWndNext</parameterReference> the descendant of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> ancestor in the chain.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL ChangeClipboardChain( HWND hWndNext );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>hWndNext</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the window that follows <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> in the Clipboard-viewer chain.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__checkdlgbutton">
        <!--9418c960-a7d7-47c0-9090-db4e9c2d92df-->
        <title>CWnd::CheckDlgButton</title>
        <content>
            <para>Selects (places a check mark next to) or clears (removes a check mark from) a button, or it changes the state of a three-state button.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void CheckDlgButton(
    int nIDButton,
    UINT nCheck );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDButton</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the button to be modified.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nCheck</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the action to take. If <parameterReference>nCheck</parameterReference> is nonzero, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CheckDlgButton</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function places a check mark next to the button; if 0, the check mark is removed. For three-state buttons, if <parameterReference>nCheck</parameterReference> is 2, the button state is indeterminate.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CheckDlgButton</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> function sends a                         <externalLink> <linkText>BM_SETCHECK</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb775989</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message to the specified button.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#75</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__checkradiobutton">
        <!--5f82a5ed-f568-4322-a417-e36b2a589417-->
        <title>CWnd::CheckRadioButton</title>
        <content>
            <para>Selects (adds a check mark to) a given radio button in a group and clears (removes a check mark from) all other radio buttons in the group.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void CheckRadioButton(
    int nIDFirstButton,
    int nIDLastButton,
    int nIDCheckButton );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDFirstButton</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the integer identifier of the first radio button in the group.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDLastButton</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the integer identifier of the last radio button in the group.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDCheckButton</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the integer identifier of the radio button to be checked.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CheckRadioButton</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> function sends a                         <externalLink> <linkText>BM_SETCHECK</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb775989</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message to the specified radio button.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#76</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__childwindowfrompoint">
        <!--41cd55e0-ea57-4d0b-bbdd-e56f2dc9db40-->
        <title>CWnd::ChildWindowFromPoint</title>
        <content>
            <para>Determines which, if any, of the child windows belonging to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> contains the specified point.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* ChildWindowFromPoint(
    POINT point ) const;

CWnd* ChildWindowFromPoint(
    POINT point,
    UINT nFlags ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>point</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the client coordinates of the point to be tested.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>nflags</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies which child windows to skip. This parameter can be a combination of the following values:</para>
                            <table xmlns:caps="http://schemas.microsoft.com/build/caps/2013/11">
                                <thead>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Value</para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Meaning</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                </thead>
                                <tbody>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para> <legacyBold>CWP_ALL</legacyBold>
                                            </para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Do not skip any child windows</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para> <legacyBold>CWP_SKIPINVISIBLE</legacyBold>
                                            </para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Skip invisible child windows</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para> <legacyBold>CWP_SKIPDISABLED</legacyBold>
                                            </para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Skip disabled child windows</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                    <tr>
