                                        <TD>
                                            <para> <legacyBold>CWP_SKIPTRANSPARENT</legacyBold>
                                            </para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Skip transparent child windows</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                </tbody>
                            </table>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the child window that contains the point. It is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if the given point lies outside of the client area. If the point is within the client area but is not contained within any child window, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is returned.</para>
                    <para>This member function will return a hidden or disabled child window that contains the specified point. </para>
                    <para>More than one window may contain the given point. However, this function returns only the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>* of the first window encountered that contains the point. </para>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>* that is returned may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#77</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__clienttoscreen">
        <!--0c4a4b3b-48f2-4792-b94a-f34c6f45aee6-->
        <title>CWnd::ClientToScreen</title>
        <content>
            <para>Converts the client coordinates of a given point or rectangle on the display to screen coordinates.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void ClientToScreen( LPPOINT lpPoint ) const;

void ClientToScreen( LPRECT lpRect ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpPoint</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="965736d8-4e53-41b6-9b8b-6961992dd21f">POINT</legacyLink> structure or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CPoint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object that contains the client coordinates to be converted.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object that contains the client coordinates to be converted.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ClientToScreen</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function uses the client coordinates in the <legacyBold>POINT</legacyBold> or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RECT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> structure or the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CPoint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object pointed to by <parameterReference>lpPoint</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference> to compute new screen coordinates; it then replaces the coordinates in the structure with the new coordinates. The new screen coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the system display. </para>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ClientToScreen</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function assumes that the given point or rectangle is in client coordinates.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#78</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__closewindow">
        <!--4c72b57b-7843-4535-9116-d980bf48abb2-->
        <title>CWnd::CloseWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Minimizes the window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void CloseWindow();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>CloseWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632678</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__continuemodal">
        <!--2c215d85-c068-4eb8-b58f-1090b2e8b271-->
        <title>CWnd::ContinueModal</title>
        <content>
            <para>This member function is called by <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__runmodalloop">RunModalLoop</legacyLink> to determine when the modal state should be exited.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual BOOL ContinueModal();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if modal loop is to be continued; 0 when <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__endmodalloop">EndModalLoop</legacyLink> is called.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>By default, it returns non-zero until <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>EndModalLoop</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is called.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__create">
        <!--b922f3eb-429b-4ab8-8045-dd0f24a3c32f-->
        <title>CWnd::Create</title>
        <content>
            <para>Creates the specified child window and attaches it to the <legacyLink xlink:href="49a832ee-bc34-4126-88b3-bc1d9974f6c4">CWnd</legacyLink> object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual BOOL Create(
    LPCTSTR lpszClassName,
    LPCTSTR lpszWindowName,
    DWORD dwStyle,
    Const RECT&amp; rect,
    CWnd* pParentWnd,
    UINT nID,
    CCreateContext* pContext = NULL);</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>[in] <parameterReference>lpszClassName</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the name of a registered system window class; or the name of a predefined system window class.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>[in] <parameterReference>lpszWindowName</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the window display name; otherwise <languageKeyword>NULL</languageKeyword> for no window display name.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>[in] <parameterReference>dwStyle</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Bitwise combination (OR) of <legacyLink xlink:href="c85ffbe4-f4ff-4227-917a-48ec4a411842">window styles</legacyLink>. The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WS_POPUP</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> option is not a valid style.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>[in] <parameterReference>rect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The size and location of the window relative to the top-left corner of the parent window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>[in] <parameterReference>pParentWnd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to the parent window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>[in] <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>ID of the window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>[in] <parameterReference>pContext</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a <legacyLink xlink:href="337a0e44-d910-49a8-afc0-c7207666a9dc">CCreateContext</legacyLink> structure that is used to customize the document-view architecture for the application.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <languageKeyword>TRUE</languageKeyword> if the method was successful; otherwise <languageKeyword>FALSE</languageKeyword>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <alert class="warning">
                        <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::PreCreateWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> now assigns the hMenu member of its <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CREATESTRUCT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> parameter to the <languageKeyword>this</languageKeyword> pointer if the menu is <languageKeyword>NULL</languageKeyword> and the style contains <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WS_CHILD</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. For proper functionality, ensure that your dialog control has an ID that is not <languageKeyword>NULL</languageKeyword>.</para>
                        <para>This change fixes a crash in managed/native interop scenarios. A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>TRACE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> statement in <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::Create</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> alerts the developer of the problem.</para>
                    </alert>
                    <para>Use the <legacyLink xlink:href="62c7d4b1-7a29-4abb-86f7-dec541659db0">AfxRegisterWndClass</legacyLink> function to register window classes. User defined window classes are available in the module where they are registered.</para>
                    <para>The <link xlink:href="#cwnd__oncreate">CWnd::OnCreate</link> method is called before the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Create</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> method returns, and before the window becomes visible.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#79</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__createaccessibleproxy">
        <!--095b0e4f-df94-4005-bb84-35a7e7aa0214-->
        <title>CWnd::CreateAccessibleProxy</title>
        <content>
            <para>Creates an Active Accessibility proxy for the specified object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual HRESULT CreateAccessibleProxy(
    WPARAM wParam,
    LPARAM lParam,
    LRESULT * pResult );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>wParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the object accessed by the Active Accessibility proxy. Can be one of the following values</para>
                            <table xmlns:caps="http://schemas.microsoft.com/build/caps/2013/11">
                                <thead>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Value</para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Meaning</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                </thead>
                                <tbody>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para> <legacyBold>OBJID_CLIENT</legacyBold>
                                            </para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Refers to the window's client area.</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                </tbody>
                            </table>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Provides additional message-dependent information.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pResult</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to an <legacyBold>LRESULT</legacyBold> that stores the result code.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Creates an Active Accessibility proxy for the specified object.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__createcaret">
        <!--2b1f8c38-2280-4bda-9dcb-07edf9186055-->
        <title>CWnd::CreateCaret</title>
        <content>
            <para>Creates a new shape for the system caret and claims ownership of the caret.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void CreateCaret( CBitmap* pBitmap );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pBitmap</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the bitmap that defines the caret shape.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The bitmap must have previously been created by the <legacyLink xlink:href="3980616a-c59d-495a-86e6-62bd3889c84c#cbitmap__createbitmap">CBitmap::CreateBitmap</legacyLink> member function, the                         <externalLink> <linkText>CreateDIBitmap</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd183491</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows function, or the <legacyLink xlink:href="3980616a-c59d-495a-86e6-62bd3889c84c#cbitmap__loadbitmap">CBitmap::LoadBitmap</legacyLink> member function. </para>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CreateCaret</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> automatically destroys the previous caret shape, if any, regardless of which window owns the caret. Once created, the caret is initially hidden. To show the caret, the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__showcaret">ShowCaret</legacyLink> member function must be called.</para>
                    <para>The system caret is a shared resource. <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> should create a caret only when it has the input focus or is active. It should destroy the caret before it loses the input focus or becomes inactive.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#80</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__createcontrol">
        <!--c992b8d3-d824-451f-a094-c71f5e50f622-->
        <title>CWnd::CreateControl</title>
        <content>
            <para>Use this member function to create an ActiveX control that will be represented in the MFC program by a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL CreateControl(
    LPCTSTR pszClass,
    LPCTSTR pszWindowName,
    DWORD dwStyle,
    const RECT&amp; rect,
    CWnd* pParentWnd,
    UINT nID,
    CFile* pPersist = NULL,
    BOOL bStorage = FALSE,
    BSTR bstrLicKey = NULL  );

BOOL CreateControl(
    REFCLSID clsid,
    LPCTSTR pszWindowName,
    DWORD dwStyle,
    const RECT&amp; rect,
    CWnd* pParentWnd,
    UINT nID,
    CFile* pPersist = NULL,
    BOOL bStorage = FALSE,
    BSTR bstrLicKey = NULL  );

BOOL CreateControl(
    REFCLSID clsid,
    LPCTSTR pszWindowName,
    DWORD dwStyle,
    const POINT* ppt,
    const SIZE* psize,
    CWnd* pParentWnd,
    UINT nID,
    CFile* pPersist = NULL,
    BOOL bStorage = FALSE,
     BSTR bstrLicKey = NULL );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pszClass</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>This string may contain the OLE "short name" (ProgID) for the class, e.g., "CIRC3.Circ3Ctrl.1". The name needs to match the same name registered by the control. Alternatively, the string may contain the string form of a <legacyBold>CLSID</legacyBold>, contained in braces, e.g., "{9DBAFCCF-592F-101B-85CE-00608CEC297B}". In either case, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CreateControl</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> converts the string to the corresponding class ID.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pszWindowName</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to the text to be displayed in the control. Sets the value of the control's Caption or Text property (if any). If <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the control's Caption or Text property is not changed.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwStyle</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Windows styles. The available styles are listed under Remarks.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>rect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the control's size and position. It can be either a <legacyLink xlink:href="dee4e752-15d6-4db4-b68f-1ad65b2ed6ca">CRect</legacyLink> object or a <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>ppt</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="965736d8-4e53-41b6-9b8b-6961992dd21f">POINT</legacyLink> structure or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CPoint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object that contains the upper left corner of the control.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pSize</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a                                 <externalLink> <linkText>SIZE</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145106</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> structure or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CSize</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object that contains the control's size</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pParentWnd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the control's parent window. It must not be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the control's ID.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pPersist</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a <legacyLink xlink:href="b2eb5757-d499-4e67-b044-dd7d1abaa0f8">CFile</legacyLink> containing the persistent state for the control. The default value is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, indicating that the control initializes itself without restoring its state from any persistent storage. If not <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, it should be a pointer to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CFile</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>-derived object which contains the control's persistent data, in the form of either a stream or a storage. This data could have been saved in a previous activation of the client. The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CFile</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> can contain other data, but must have its read-write pointer set to the first byte of persistent data at the time of the call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CreateControl</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bStorage</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Indicates whether the data in <parameterReference>pPersist</parameterReference> should be interpreted as IStorage or IStream data. If the data in <parameterReference>pPersist</parameterReference> is a storage, <parameterReference>bStorage</parameterReference> should be <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>. If the data in <parameterReference>pPersist</parameterReference> is a stream, <parameterReference>bStorage</parameterReference> should be <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>. The default value is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>bstrLicKe</legacyItalic>y </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Optional license key data. This data is needed only for creating controls that require a run-time license key. If the control supports licensing, you must provide a license key for the creation of the control to succeed. The default value is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>clsid</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The unique class ID of the control.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CreateControl</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a direct analog of the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__create">CWnd::Create</legacyLink> function, which creates the window for a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CreateControl</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> creates an ActiveX control instead of an ordinary window.</para>
                    <para>Only a subset of the Windows <parameterReference>dwStyle</parameterReference> flags are supported for <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CreateControl</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>:  </para>
                    <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <legacyBold>WS_VISIBLE</legacyBold>Creates a window that is initially visible. Required if you want the control to be visible immediately, like ordinary windows.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <legacyBold>WS_DISABLED</legacyBold>Creates a window that is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. Can be set if the control has an Enabled property.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WS_BORDER</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Creates a window with a thin-line border. Can be set if control has a BorderStyle property.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <legacyBold>WS_GROUP</legacyBold>Specifies the first control of a group of controls. The user can change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next by using the direction keys. All controls defined with the <legacyBold>WS_GROUP</legacyBold> style after the first control belong to the same group. The next control with the <legacyBold>WS_GROUP</legacyBold> style ends the group and starts the next group.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <legacyBold>WS_TABSTOP</legacyBold>Specifies a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control of the <legacyBold>WS_TABSTOP</legacyBold> style.</para>
                        </listItem>
                    </list>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#81</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__createex">
        <!--9c6b7bdd-6ae5-4150-843f-493380a0b266-->
        <title>CWnd::CreateEx</title>
        <content>
            <para>Creates the specified window and attaches it to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual BOOL CreateEx(
    DWORD dwExStyle,
    LPCTSTR lpszClassName,
    LPCTSTR lpszWindowName,
    DWORD dwStyle,
    int x,
    int y,
    int nWidth,
    int nHeight,
    HWND hWndParent,
    HMENU nIDorHMenu,
    LPVOID lpParam = NULL );

virtual BOOL CreateEx(
    DWORD dwExStyle,
    LPCTSTR lpszClassName,
    LPCTSTR lpszWindowName,
    DWORD dwStyle,
    const RECT&amp; rect,
    CWnd* pParentWnd,
    UINT nID,
    LPVOID lpParam = NULL);</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwExStyle</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Bitwise combination (OR) of <legacyLink xlink:href="d18e6c69-0a01-49ed-b58a-55b3802b47c1">extended window styles</legacyLink>; otherwise <languageKeyword>NULL</languageKeyword> for the default extended window style. </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpszClassName</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the name of a registered system window class; or the name of a predefined system window class. </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpszWindowName</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the window display name; otherwise <languageKeyword>NULL</languageKeyword> for no window display name.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwStyle</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Bitwise combination (OR) of <legacyLink xlink:href="c85ffbe4-f4ff-4227-917a-48ec4a411842">window styles</legacyLink>; otherwise <languageKeyword>NULL</languageKeyword> for the default window style.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>x</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The initial horizontal distance of the window from the left side of the screen or the parent window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>y</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The initial vertical distance of the window from the top of the screen or the parent window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nWidth</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The width, in pixels, of the window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nHeight</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The height, in pixels, of the window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>hwndParent</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>For a child window, the handle to the parent window; otherwise, the handle of the owner window if the window has an owner.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDorHMenu</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>For a child window, the window ID; otherwise, the ID of a menu for the window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to user data that is passed to the <link xlink:href="#cwnd__oncreate">CWnd::OnCreate</link> method in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>lpCreateParams</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> field.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>rect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The size and location of the window relative to the screen or the parent window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pParentWnd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>For a child window, pointer to the parent window; otherwise, pointer to the owner window if the window has an owner.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>For a child window, the window ID; otherwise, the ID of a menu for the window.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <languageKeyword>TRUE</languageKeyword> if the method was successful; otherwise <languageKeyword>FALSE</languageKeyword>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <alert class="warning">
                        <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::PreCreateWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> now assigns the hMenu member of its <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CREATESTRUCT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> parameter to the <languageKeyword>this</languageKeyword> pointer if the menu is <languageKeyword>NULL</languageKeyword> and the style contains <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WS_CHILD</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. For proper functionality, ensure that your dialog control has an ID that is not <languageKeyword>NULL</languageKeyword>.</para>
                        <para>This change fixes a crash in managed/native interop scenarios. A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>TRACE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> statement in <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::Create</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> alerts the developer of the problem.</para>
                    </alert>
                    <para>The default extended window style is <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WS_EX_LEFT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. The default window style is <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WS_OVERLAPPED</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                    <para>Use the <legacyLink xlink:href="62c7d4b1-7a29-4abb-86f7-dec541659db0">AfxRegisterWndClass</legacyLink> function to register window classes. User defined window classes are available in the module where they are registered.</para>
                    <para>Dimensions for child windows are relative to the top-left corner of the client area of the parent window. Dimensions for top-level windows are relative to the top-left corner of the screen.</para>
                    <para>The <link xlink:href="#cwnd__oncreate">CWnd::OnCreate</link> method is called before the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CreateEx</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> method returns, and before the window becomes visible.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#82</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__creategraycaret">
        <!--aa2f24f1-9304-4b81-9f6d-222b12f8dbb2-->
        <title>CWnd::CreateGrayCaret</title>
        <content>
            <para>Creates a gray rectangle for the system caret and claims ownership of the caret.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void CreateGrayCaret(
    int nWidth,
    int nHeight );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nWidth</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the width of the caret (in logical units). If this parameter is 0, the width is set to the system-defined window-border width.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nHeight</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the height of the caret (in logical units). If this parameter is 0, the height is set to the system-defined window-border height.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The caret shape can be a line or a block. </para>
                    <para>The parameters <parameterReference>nWidth</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>nHeight</parameterReference> specify the caret's width and height (in logical units); the exact width and height (in pixels) depend on the mapping mode. </para>
                    <para>The system's window-border width or height can be retrieved by the                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetSystemMetrics</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms724385</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows function with the <legacyBold>SM_CXBORDER</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>SM_CYBORDER</legacyBold> indexes. Using the window-border width or height ensures that the caret will be visible on a high-resolution display.</para>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CreateGrayCaret</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function automatically destroys the previous caret shape, if any, regardless of which window owns the caret. Once created, the caret is initially hidden. To show the caret, the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__showcaret">ShowCaret</legacyLink> member function must be called. </para>
                    <para>The system caret is a shared resource. <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> should create a caret only when it has the input focus or is active. It should destroy the caret before it loses the input focus or becomes inactive.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#83</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__createsolidcaret">
        <!--9f857ae4-7612-4c47-8524-07179a5e7e97-->
        <title>CWnd::CreateSolidCaret</title>
        <content>
            <para>Creates a solid rectangle for the system caret and claims ownership of the caret.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void CreateSolidCaret(
    int nWidth,
    int nHeight );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nWidth</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the width of the caret (in logical units). If this parameter is 0, the width is set to the system-defined window-border width.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nHeight</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the height of the caret (in logical units). If this parameter is 0, the height is set to the system-defined window-border height.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The caret shape can be a line or block. </para>
                    <para>The parameters <parameterReference>nWidth</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>nHeight</parameterReference> specify the caret's width and height (in logical units); the exact width and height (in pixels) depend on the mapping mode. </para>
                    <para>The system's window-border width or height can be retrieved by the                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetSystemMetrics</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms724385</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows function with the <legacyBold>SM_CXBORDER</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>SM_CYBORDER</legacyBold> indexes. Using the window-border width or height ensures that the caret will be visible on a high-resolution display.</para>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CreateSolidCaret</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function automatically destroys the previous caret shape, if any, regardless of which window owns the caret. Once created, the caret is initially hidden. To show the caret, the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__showcaret">ShowCaret</legacyLink> member function must be called. </para>
                    <para>The system caret is a shared resource. <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> should create a caret only when it has the input focus or is active. It should destroy the caret before it loses the input focus or becomes inactive.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#84</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__cwnd">
        <!--6d0db8d8-e0e8-48a3-b88e-7a094680975d-->
        <title>CWnd::CWnd</title>
        <content>
            <para>Constructs a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The Windows window is not created and attached until the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__createex">CreateEx</legacyLink> or <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__create">Create</legacyLink> member function is called.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__default">
        <!--6d1914c0-256b-467a-9ddc-1627e87290cf-->
        <title>CWnd::Default</title>
        <content>
            <para>Calls the default window procedure.</para>
            <legacySyntax>LRESULT Default();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Depends on the message sent.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The default window procedure provides default processing for any window message that an application does not process. This member function ensures that every message is processed. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#85</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__defwindowproc">
        <!--4a8b4438-2dad-48d6-bb22-9685f2902c58-->
        <title>CWnd::DefWindowProc</title>
        <content>
            <para>Calls the default window procedure, which provides default processing for any window message that an application does not process.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual LRESULT DefWindowProc(
    UINT message,
    WPARAM wParam,
    LPARAM lParam );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>message</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the Windows message to be processed.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>wParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message-dependent information.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message-dependent information.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Depends on the message sent.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function ensures that every message is processed. It should be called with the same parameters as those received by the window procedure.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__deletetempmap">
        <!--01023c00-c6ad-4133-b584-2f38e043cfbc-->
        <title>CWnd::DeleteTempMap</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called automatically by the idle time handler of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWinApp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static void PASCAL DeleteTempMap();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Deletes any temporary <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> objects created by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>FromHandle</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#86</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__destroywindow">
        <!--31a409ec-8430-4fb2-8895-d16bb5d18bc6-->
        <title>CWnd::DestroyWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Destroys the Windows window attached to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual BOOL DestroyWindow();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the window is destroyed; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DestroyWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function sends appropriate messages to the window to deactivate it and remove the input focus. It also destroys the window's menu, flushes the application queue, destroys outstanding timers, removes Clipboard ownership, and breaks the Clipboard-viewer chain if <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is at the top of the viewer chain. It sends <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__ondestroy">WM_DESTROY</legacyLink> and <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onncdestroy">WM_NCDESTROY</legacyLink> messages to the window. It does not destroy the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DestroyWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a place holder for performing cleanup. Because <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DestroyWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a virtual function, it is shown in any <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>-derived class in Class View. But even if you override this function in your <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>-derived class, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DestroyWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is not necessarily called. If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DestroyWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is not called in the MFC code, then you have to explicitly call it in your own code if you want it to be called.</para>
                    <para>Assume, for example, you have overridden <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DestroyWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> in a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CView</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>-derived class. Since MFC source code does not call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DestroyWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> in any of its <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CFrameWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>-derived classes, your overridden <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DestroyWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> will not be called unless you call it explicitly. </para>
                    <para>If the window is the parent of any windows, these child windows are automatically destroyed when the parent window is destroyed. The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DestroyWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function destroys child windows first and then the window itself. </para>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DestroyWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function also destroys modeless dialog boxes created by <legacyLink xlink:href="ca64b77e-2cd2-47e3-8eff-c2645ad578f9#cdialog__create">CDialog::Create</legacyLink>.</para>
                    <para>If the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> being destroyed is a child window and does not have the <legacyLink xlink:href="d18e6c69-0a01-49ed-b58a-55b3802b47c1">WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY</legacyLink> style set, then the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_PARENTNOTIFY</linkText> <linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms632638.aspx</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message is sent to the parent.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#87</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__detach">
        <!--1f46de3f-b2a5-407d-a416-0ec1b969a671-->
        <title>CWnd::Detach</title>
        <content>
            <para>Detaches a Windows handle from a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object and returns the handle.</para>
            <legacySyntax>HWND Detach();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>HWND</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to the Windows object.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__attach">CWnd::Attach</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__dlgdirlist">
        <!--9aacfdb3-5a23-47e8-b902-03ab1f574b94-->
        <title>CWnd::DlgDirList</title>
        <content>
            <para>Fills a list box with a file or directory listing.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int DlgDirList(
    LPTSTR lpPathSpec,
    int nIDListBox,
    int nIDStaticPath,
    UINT nFileType );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpPathSpec</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a null-terminated string that contains the path or filename. <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirList</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> modifies this string, which should be long enough to contain the modifications. For more information, see the following "Remarks" section.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDListBox</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the identifier of a list box. If <parameterReference>nIDListBox</parameterReference> is 0, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirList</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> assumes that no list box exists and does not attempt to fill one.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDStaticPath</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the identifier of the static-text control used to display the current drive and directory. If <parameterReference>nIDStaticPath</parameterReference> is 0, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirList</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> assumes that no such text control is present.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nFileType</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the attributes of the files to be displayed. It can be any combination of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_READWRITE</legacyBold>Read-write data files with no additional attributes. </para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_READONLY</legacyBold>Read-only files.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_HIDDEN</legacyBold>Hidden files.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_SYSTEM</legacyBold>System files.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_DIRECTORY</legacyBold>Directories.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_ARCHIVE</legacyBold>Archives.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_POSTMSGS</legacyBold> <legacyBold>LB_DIR</legacyBold> flag. If the <legacyBold>LB_DIR</legacyBold> flag is set, Windows places the messages generated by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirList</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> in the application's queue; otherwise, they are sent directly to the dialog-box procedure.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_DRIVES</legacyBold>Drives. If the <legacyBold>DDL_DRIVES</legacyBold> flag is set, the <legacyBold>DDL_EXCLUSIVE</legacyBold> flag is set automatically. Therefore, to create a directory listing that includes drives and files, you must call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirList</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> twice: once with the <legacyBold>DDL_DRIVES</legacyBold> flag set and once with the flags for the rest of the list.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_EXCLUSIVE</legacyBold>Exclusive bit. If the exclusive bit is set, only files of the specified type are listed; otherwise normal files and files of the specified type are listed.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function is successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirList</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> sends                         <externalLink> <linkText>LB_RESETCONTENT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb761325</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> and                         <externalLink> <linkText>LB_DIR</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb775185</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> messages to the list box. It fills the list box specified by <parameterReference>nIDListBox</parameterReference> with the names of all files that match the path given by <parameterReference>lpPathSpec</parameterReference>. </para>
                    <para>The <parameterReference>lpPathSpec</parameterReference> parameter has the following form:</para>
                    <para> <codeInline>[drive:] [ [\u]directory[\idirectory]...\u] [filename]</codeInline>
                    </para>
                    <para>In this example, <parameterReference>drive</parameterReference> is a drive letter, <parameterReference>directory</parameterReference> is a valid directory name, and                         <legacyItalic>filename</legacyItalic> is a valid filename that must contain at least one wildcard. The wildcards are a question mark ( <legacyBold>?</legacyBold>), which means match any character, and an asterisk ( <legacyBold>*</legacyBold>), meaning match any number of characters.</para>
                    <para>If you specify a 0-length string for <parameterReference>lpPathSpec</parameterReference>, or if you specify only a directory name but do not include any file specification, the string will be changed to "*.*". </para>
                    <para>If <parameterReference>lpPathSpec</parameterReference> includes a drive and/or directory name, the current drive and directory are changed to the designated drive and directory before the list box is filled. The text control identified by <parameterReference>nIDStaticPath</parameterReference> is also updated with the new drive and/or directory name. </para>
                    <para>After the list box is filled, <parameterReference>lpPathSpec</parameterReference> is updated by removing the drive and/or directory portion of the path.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#88</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__dlgdirlistcombobox">
        <!--1b0c1f00-8f88-4c99-9cde-8d28e9812940-->
        <title>CWnd::DlgDirListComboBox</title>
        <content>
            <para>Fills the list box of a combo box with a file or directory listing.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int DlgDirListComboBox(
    LPTSTR lpPathSpec,
    int nIDComboBox,
    int nIDStaticPath,
    UINT nFileType );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpPathSpec</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a null-terminated string that contains the path or filename. <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirListComboBox</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> modifies this string, so this data should not be in the form of a string literal. See the following "Remarks" section.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDComboBox</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the identifier of a combo box in a dialog box. If <parameterReference>nIDComboBox</parameterReference> is 0, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirListComboBox</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> assumes that no combo box exists and does not attempt to fill one.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDStaticPath</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the identifier of the static-text control used to display the current drive and directory. If <parameterReference>nIDStaticPath</parameterReference> is 0, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirListComboBox</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> assumes that no such text control is present.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nFileType</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies DOS file attributes of the files to be displayed. It can be any combination of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_READWRITE</legacyBold>Read-write data files with no additional attributes.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_READONLY</legacyBold>Read-only files.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_HIDDEN</legacyBold>Hidden files.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_SYSTEM</legacyBold>System files.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_DIRECTORY</legacyBold>Directories.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_ARCHIVE</legacyBold>Archives.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_POSTMSGS</legacyBold> <legacyBold>CB_DIR</legacyBold> flag. If the <legacyBold>CB_DIR</legacyBold> flag is set, Windows places the messages generated by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirListComboBox</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> in the application's queue; otherwise, they are sent directly to the dialog-box procedure.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_DRIVES</legacyBold>Drives. If the <legacyBold>DDL_DRIVES</legacyBold> flag is set, the <legacyBold>DDL_EXCLUSIVE</legacyBold> flag is set automatically. Therefore, to create a directory listing that includes drives and files, you must call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirListComboBox</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> twice: once with the <legacyBold>DDL_DRIVES</legacyBold> flag set and once with the flags for the rest of the list.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DDL_EXCLUSIVE</legacyBold>Exclusive bit. If the exclusive bit is set, only files of the specified type are listed; otherwise normal files and files of the specified type are listed.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies the outcome of the function. It is nonzero if a listing was made, even an empty listing. A 0 return value implies that the input string did not contain a valid search path.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirListComboBox</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> sends                         <externalLink> <linkText>CB_RESETCONTENT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb775878</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> and                         <externalLink> <linkText>CB_DIR</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb775832</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> messages to the combo box. It fills the list box of the combo box specified by <parameterReference>nIDComboBox</parameterReference> with the names of all files that match the path given by <parameterReference>lpPathSpec</parameterReference>. </para>
                    <para>The <parameterReference>lpPathSpec</parameterReference> parameter has the following form:</para>
                    <para> <codeInline>[drive:] [ [\u]directory[\idirectory]...\u] [filename]</codeInline>
                    </para>
                    <para>In this example, <parameterReference>drive</parameterReference> is a drive letter, <parameterReference>directory</parameterReference> is a valid directory name, and                         <legacyItalic>filename</legacyItalic> is a valid filename that must contain at least one wildcard. The wildcards are a question mark ( <legacyBold>?</legacyBold>), which means match any character, and an asterisk ( <legacyBold>*</legacyBold>), which means match any number of characters.</para>
                    <para>If you specify a zero-length string for <parameterReference>lpPathSpec</parameterReference>, the current directory will be used and <parameterReference>lpPathSpec</parameterReference> will not be modified. If you specify only a directory name but do not include any file specification, the string will be changed to "*". </para>
                    <para>If <parameterReference>lpPathSpec</parameterReference> includes a drive and/or directory name, the current drive and directory are changed to the designated drive and directory before the list box is filled. The text control identified by <parameterReference>nIDStaticPath</parameterReference> is also updated with the new drive and/or directory name. </para>
                    <para>After the combo-box list box is filled, <parameterReference>lpPathSpec</parameterReference> is updated by removing the drive and/or directory portion of the path.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#89</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__dlgdirselect">
        <!--a72d7b0d-74f9-41ef-a101-9709755a3b5f-->
        <title>CWnd::DlgDirSelect</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the current selection from a list box.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL DlgDirSelect(
    LPTSTR lpString,
    int nIDListBox );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpString</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a buffer that is to receive the current selection in the list box.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDListBox</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the integer ID of a list box in the dialog box.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>It assumes that the list box has been filled by the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__dlgdirlist">DlgDirList</legacyLink> member function and that the selection is a drive letter, a file, or a directory name. </para>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirSelect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function copies the selection to the buffer given by <parameterReference>lpString</parameterReference>. If there is no selection, <parameterReference>lpString</parameterReference> does not change.</para>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirSelect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> sends                         <externalLink> <linkText>LB_GETCURSEL</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb775197</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> and                         <externalLink> <linkText>LB_GETTEXT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb761313</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> messages to the list box.</para>
                    <para>It does not allow more than one filename to be returned from a list box. The list box must not be a multiple-selection list box. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__dlgdirselectcombobox">
        <!--7a422a19-88eb-4d8d-87af-ba5eb58ca77b-->
        <title>CWnd::DlgDirSelectComboBox</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the current selection from the list box of a combo box.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL DlgDirSelectComboBox(
    LPTSTR lpString,
    int nIDComboBox );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpString</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a buffer that is to receive the selected path.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDComboBox</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the integer ID of the combo box in the dialog box.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>It assumes that the list box has been filled by the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__dlgdirlistcombobox">DlgDirListComboBox</legacyLink> member function and that the selection is a drive letter, a file, or a directory name. </para>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirSelectComboBox</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function copies the selection to the specified buffer. If there is no selection, the contents of the buffer are not changed.</para>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DlgDirSelectComboBox</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> sends                         <externalLink> <linkText>CB_GETCURSEL</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb775845</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> and                         <externalLink> <linkText>CB_GETLBTEXT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb775862</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> messages to the combo box. </para>
                    <para>It does not allow more than one filename to be returned from a combo box.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__dodataexchange">
        <!--40b0821d-9e57-46ed-9522-b57b367ab08d-->
        <title>CWnd::DoDataExchange</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called by the framework to exchange and validate dialog data.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual void DoDataExchange( CDataExchange* pDX );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pDX</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CDataExchange</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Never call this function directly. It is called by the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__updatedata">UpdateData</legacyLink> member function. Call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>UpdateData</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to initialize a dialog box's controls or retrieve data from a dialog box. </para>
                    <para>When you derive an application-specific dialog class from <legacyLink xlink:href="ca64b77e-2cd2-47e3-8eff-c2645ad578f9">CDialog</legacyLink>, you need to override this member function if you wish to utilize the framework's automatic data exchange and validation. The Add Variable wizard will write an overridden version of this member function for you containing the desired "data map" of dialog data exchange (DDX) and validation (DDV) global function calls. </para>
                    <para>To automatically generate an overridden version of this member function, first create a dialog resource with the dialog editor, then derive an application-specific dialog class. Then use the Add Variable wizard to associate variables, data, and validation ranges with various controls in the new dialog box. The wizard then writes the overridden <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DoDataExchange</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, which contains a data map. The following is an example DDX/DDV code block generated by the Add Variable wizard:</para>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#90</codeReference>
