                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DoDataExchange</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> overridden member function must precede the macro statements in your source file.</para>
                    <para>For more information on dialog data exchange and validation, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c56185c4-12cb-40b1-b499-02b29ea83e3a">Displaying and Manipulating Data in a Form</legacyLink> and <legacyLink xlink:href="7d373554-7330-43ae-abf1-4bb14e437b4a">Dialog Data Exchange and Validation</legacyLink>. For a description of the DDX_ and DDV_ macros generated by the Add Variable wizard, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c2eba87a-4b47-4083-b28b-e2fa77dfb4c4">Technical Note 26</legacyLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__dragacceptfiles">
        <!--d65453da-7271-49c1-b57b-cd326544ab33-->
        <title>CWnd::DragAcceptFiles</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function from within a window, using a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> pointer, in your application's <legacyLink xlink:href="e426a3cd-0d15-40d6-bd55-beaa5feb2343#cwinapp__initinstance">CWinApp::InitInstance</legacyLink> function to indicate that the window accepts dropped files from the Windows File Manager or File Explorer.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void DragAcceptFiles( BOOL bAccept = TRUE  );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>BAccept</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Flag that indicates whether dragged files are accepted.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Only the window that calls <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DragAcceptFiles</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with the <parameterReference>bAccept</parameterReference> parameter set to <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> has identified itself as able to process the Windows message <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_DROPFILES</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. For example, in an MDI application, if the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CMDIFrameWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> window pointer is used in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DragAcceptFiles</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> function call, only the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CMDIFrameWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> window gets the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_DROPFILES</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message. This message is not sent to all open <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CMDIChildWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> windows. For a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CMDIChildWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> window to receive this message, you must call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DragAcceptFiles</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CMDIChildWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> window pointer.</para>
                    <para>To discontinue receiving dragged files, call the member function with <parameterReference>bAccept</parameterReference> set to <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__dragdetect">
        <!--0c94dd3f-3e5d-4467-8210-32104a4ad97a-->
        <title>CWnd::DragDetect</title>
        <content>
            <para>Captures the mouse and tracks its movement until the user releases the left button, presses the ESC key, or moves the mouse outside the drag rectangle around the specified point.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL DragDetect( POINT pt ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pt</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Initial position of the mouse, in screen coordinates. The function determines the coordinates of the drag rectangle by using this point.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the user moved the mouse outside of the drag rectangle while holding down the left button , the return value is nonzero.</para>
                    <para>If the user did not move the mouse outside of the drag rectangle while holding down the left button , the return value is zero.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>DragDetect</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646256</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__drawanimatedrects">
        <!--55d701a7-5667-4fb1-b99a-0f1d5c772cad-->
        <title>CWnd::DrawAnimatedRects</title>
        <content>
            <para>Draws a wire-frame rectangle and animates it to indicate the opening of an icon or the minimizing or maximizing of a window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL DrawAnimatedRects(
    int idAni,
    CONST RECT * lprcFrom,
    CONST RECT * lprcTo );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>idAni</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the type of animation. If you specify <legacyBold>IDANI_CAPTION</legacyBold>, the window caption will animate from the position specified by <parameterReference>lprcFrom</parameterReference> to the position specified by <parameterReference>lprcTo</parameterReference>. The effect is similar to minimizing or maximizing a window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lprcFrom</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a                                 <externalLink> <linkText>RECT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd162897</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> structure specifying the location and size of the icon or minimized window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lprcTo</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a                                 <externalLink> <linkText>RECT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd162897</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> structure specifying the location and size of the restored window</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function succeeds; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>DrawAnimatedRects</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd162475</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__drawcaption">
        <!--360b4094-7ab9-4a4b-9f1a-3a8a05606ac9-->
        <title>CWnd::DrawCaption</title>
        <content>
            <para>Draws a window caption.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL DrawCaption(
    CDC* pDC,
    LPCRECT lprc,
    UINT uFlags );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pDC</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a device context. The function draws the window caption into this device context.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lprc</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a RECT structure that specifies the bounding rectangle for the window caption.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>uFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies drawing options. For a complete list of values, see                                 <externalLink> <linkText>DrawCaption</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd162476</linkUri>
                                </externalLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function succeeds; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>DrawCaption</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd162476</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>

        <content>

        <sections>

                <content>
                    <para>If a menu bar is changed after Windows has created the window, call this function to draw the changed menu bar.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->

    <section address="cwnd__enableactiveaccessibility">
        <!--2e843130-c796-4d90-95c6-c8726eb6b31e-->
        <title>CWnd::EnableActiveAccessibility</title>
        <content>
            <para>Enables user-defined Active Accessibility functions.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void EnableActiveAccessibility();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>MFC's default Active Accessibility support is sufficient for standard windows and controls, including ActiveX controls; however, if your <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>-derived class contains nonwindowed user interface elements, MFC has no way of knowing about them. In that case, you must override the appropriate <legacyLink xlink:href="68af04ac-4eb9-4b7d-b33f-c45512097a74">Active Accessibility member functions</legacyLink> in your class, and you must call <legacyBold>EnableActiveAccessibility </legacyBold>in the class's constructor.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__enabledynamiclayout">
        <!--42d7d663-ea8e-49cf-ba4b-c42c85188f34-->
        <title>CWnd::EnableDynamicLayout</title>
        <content>
            <para>Enables or disables the dynamic layout manager. When dynamic layout is enabled, the position and size of child windows can adjust dynamically when the user resizes the window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void EnableDynamicLayout(
    BOOL bEnable = TRUE);</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bEnable</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>TRUE to enable dynamic layout; FALSE to disable dynamic layout.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If you want to enable dynamic layout, you have to do more than just call this method. You also have to provide dynamic layout information which species how the controls in the window respond to size changes. You can specify this information in the resource editor, or programmatically, for each control. See <link xlink:href="8598cfb2-c8d4-4f5a-bf2b-59dc4653e042">Dynamic Layout</link>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__enabled2dsupport">
        <!--ba908947-5ee6-457c-b447-12c0573fbe57-->
        <title>CWnd::EnableD2DSupport</title>
        <content>
            <para>Enables or disables window D2D support. Call this method before the main window is initialized.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void EnableD2DSupport(
    BOOL bEnable = TRUE,
    BOOL bUseDCRenderTarget = FALSE);</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bEnable</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether to turn on, or off D2D support.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bUseDCRenderTarget</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Species whether to use the Device Context (DC) render target, CDCRenderTarget. If FALSE, CHwndRenderTarget is used.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__enablescrollbar">
        <!--f591cb54-58b2-45cb-9420-cffc010066ef-->
        <title>CWnd::EnableScrollBar</title>
        <content>
            <para>Enables or disables one or both arrows of a scroll bar.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL EnableScrollBar(
    int nSBFlags,
    UINT nArrowFlags = ESB_ENABLE_BOTH );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>nSBFlags</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the scroll-bar type. Can have one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_BOTH</legacyBold>Enables or disables the arrows of the horizontal and vertical scroll bars associated with the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_HORZ</legacyBold>Enables or disables the arrows of the horizontal scroll bar associated with the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_VERT</legacyBold>Enables or disables the arrows of the vertical scroll bar associated with the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nArrowFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the scroll-bar arrows are enabled or disabled and which arrows are enabled or disabled. Can have one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>ESB_ENABLE_BOTH</legacyBold>Enables both arrows of a scroll bar (default).</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>ESB_DISABLE_LTUP</legacyBold>Disables the left arrow of a horizontal scroll bar or the up arrow of a vertical scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>ESB_DISABLE_RTDN</legacyBold>Disables the right arrow of a horizontal scroll bar or the down arrow of a vertical scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>ESB_DISABLE_BOTH</legacyBold>Disables both arrows of a scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the arrows are enabled or disabled as specified. Otherwise it is 0, which indicates that the arrows are already in the requested state or that an error occurred.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__enablescrollbarctrl">
        <!--de90e783-3a79-49d1-8feb-609e434cab3d-->
        <title>CWnd::EnableScrollBarCtrl</title>
        <content>
            <para>Enables or disables the scroll bar for this window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void EnableScrollBarCtrl(
    int nBar,
    BOOL bEnable = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nBar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The scroll-bar identifier.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bEnable</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the scroll bar is to be enabled or disabled.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the window has a sibling scroll-bar control, that scroll bar is used; otherwise the window's own scroll bar is used.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__enabletooltips">
        <!--186b5b14-c000-4492-84f0-9ec83cf5b63f-->
        <title>CWnd::EnableToolTips</title>
        <content>
            <para>Enables tool tips for the given window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL EnableToolTips( BOOL bEnable = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bEnable</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the tool tip control is enabled or disabled. <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> enables the control; <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold> disables the control.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> if tool tips are enabled; otherwise <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Override <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__ontoolhittest">OnToolHitTest</legacyLink> to provide the                         <externalLink> <linkText>TOOLINFO</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb760256</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> struct or structs for the window.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>Some windows, such as <legacyLink xlink:href="e868da26-5e07-4607-9651-e2f863ad9059">CToolBar</legacyLink>, provide a built-in implementation of <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__ontoolhittest">OnToolHitTest</legacyLink>.</para>
                    </alert>
                    <para>See                         <externalLink> <linkText>TOOLINFO</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb760256</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> in the <token>winSDK</token> for more information on this structure.</para>
                    <para>Simply calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>EnableToolTips</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is not enough to display tool tips for your child controls unless the parent window is derived from <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CFrameWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. This is because <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CFrameWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> provides a default handler for the <legacyBold>TTN_NEEDTEXT</legacyBold> notification. If your parent window is not derived from <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CFrameWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, that is, if it is a dialog box or a form view, tool tips for your child controls will not display correctly unless you provide a handler for the <legacyBold>TTN_NEEDTEXT</legacyBold> tool tip notification. See <legacyLink xlink:href="cad5ef0f-02e3-4151-ad0d-3d42e6932b0e">Tool Tips</legacyLink>.</para>
                    <para>The default tool tips provided for your windows by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>EnableToolTips</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> do not have text associated with them. To retrieve text for the tool tip to display, the <legacyBold>TTN_NEEDTEXT</legacyBold> notification is sent to the tool tip control's parent window just before the tool tip window is displayed. If there is no handler for this message to assign some value to the <parameterReference>pszText</parameterReference> member of the <legacyBold>TOOLTIPTEXT</legacyBold> structure, there will be no text displayed for the tool tip.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#91</codeReference>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#92</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__enabletrackingtooltips">
        <!--6c7ab4e9-b50b-4adb-9eb0-209fbb8b9430-->
        <title>CWnd::EnableTrackingToolTips</title>
        <content>
            <para>Enables or disables tracking tooltips.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL EnableTrackingToolTips( BOOL bEnable = TRUE  );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bEnable</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether tracking tool tips are enabled or disabled. If this parameter is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the tracking tool tips will be enabled. If this parameter is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, the tracking tool tips will be disabled.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Indicates the state before the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>EnableWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function was called. The return value is nonzero if the window was previously disabled. The return value is 0 if the window was previously enabled or an error occurred.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Tracking tool tips are tool tip windows that you can dynamically position on the screen. By rapidly updating the position, the tool tip window appears to move smoothly, or "track." This functionality can be useful if you need tool tip text to follow the position of the pointer as it moves.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__enablewindow">
        <!--a0992a84-67dc-40fd-bc71-60db21fd697f-->
        <title>CWnd::EnableWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Enables or disables mouse and keyboard input.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL EnableWindow( BOOL bEnable = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bEnable</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the given window is to be enabled or disabled. If this parameter is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the window will be enabled. If this parameter is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, the window will be disabled.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Indicates the state before the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>EnableWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function was called. The return value is nonzero if the window was previously disabled. The return value is 0 if the window was previously enabled or an error occurred.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>When input is disabled, input such as mouse clicks and keystrokes is ignored. When input is enabled, the window processes all input. </para>
                    <para>If the enabled state is changing, the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onenable">WM_ENABLE</legacyLink> message is sent before this function returns. </para>
                    <para>If disabled, all child windows are implicitly disabled, although they are not sent <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_ENABLE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages.</para>
                    <para>A window must be enabled before it can be activated. For example, if an application is displaying a modeless dialog box and has disabled its main window, the main window must be enabled before the dialog box is destroyed. Otherwise, another window will get the input focus and be activated. If a child window is disabled, it is ignored when Windows tries to determine which window should get mouse messages. </para>
                    <para>By default, a window is enabled when it is created. An application can specify the <legacyBold>WS_DISABLED</legacyBold> style in the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__create">Create</legacyLink> or <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__createex">CreateEx</legacyLink> member function to create a window that is initially disabled. After a window has been created, an application can also use the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>EnableWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function to enable or disable the window. </para>
                    <para>An application can use this function to enable or disable a control in a dialog box. A disabled control cannot receive the input focus, nor can a user access it.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#93</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__endmodalloop">
        <!--e49dc994-550d-4f6e-91df-9781cd3e2567-->
        <title>CWnd::EndModalLoop</title>
        <content>
            <para>Terminates a call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RunModalLoop</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual void EndModalLoop( int nResult );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nResult</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Contains the value to be returned to the caller of <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__runmodalloop">RunModalLoop</legacyLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>

                    <para>The <parameterReference>nResult</parameterReference> parameter is propagated to the return value from <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RunModalLoop</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>

    <section address="cwnd__endpaint">
        <!--9e485268-c9b9-4772-8960-58fe5f502057-->
        <title>CWnd::EndPaint</title>
        <content>
            <para>Marks the end of painting in the given window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void EndPaint( LPPAINTSTRUCT lpPaint );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpPaint</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="81ce4993-3e89-43b2-8c98-7946f1314d24">PAINTSTRUCT</legacyLink> structure that contains the painting information retrieved by the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__beginpaint">BeginPaint</legacyLink> member function.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>EndPaint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function is required for each call to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BeginPaint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function, but only after painting is complete. </para>
                    <para>If the caret was hidden by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BeginPaint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>EndPaint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> restores the caret to the screen.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__beginpaint">CWnd::BeginPaint</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__executedlginit">
        <!--fa400931-7671-4c58-ba23-54e4be3a8f86-->
        <title>CWnd::ExecuteDlgInit</title>
        <content>
            <para>Initiates a dialog resource.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL ExecuteDlgInit( LPCTSTR lpszResourceName );

BOOL ExecuteDlgInit( LPVOID lpResource );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpszResourceName</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a null-terminated string specifying the name of the resource.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpResource</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a resource.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> if a dialog resource is executed; otherwise <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ExecuteDlgInit</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> will use resources bound to the executing module, or resources from other sources. To accomplish this, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ExecuteDlgInit</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> finds a resource handle by calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>AfxFindResourceHandle</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. If your MFC application does not use the shared DLL (MFCx0[U][D].DLL), <legacyBold>AfxFindResourceHandle </legacyBold>calls <legacyLink xlink:href="d0eff6c4-f566-471a-96b7-a5a70a751a92">AfxGetResourceHandle</legacyLink>, which returns the current resource handle for the executable. If your MFC application that uses MFCx0[U][D].DLL, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>AfxFindResourceHandle</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> traverses the <legacyBold>CDynLinkLibrary</legacyBold> object list of shared and extension DLLs looking for the correct resource handle.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__filtertooltipmessage">
        <!--fa9cc51b-307d-4bcc-be0c-33652d9c12eb-->
        <title>CWnd::FilterToolTipMessage</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called by the framework to display tool tip messages.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void FilterToolTipMessage( MSG* pMsg );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pMsg</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to the tool tip message.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>In most MFC applications this method is called by the framework from <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__pretranslatemessage">PreTranslateMessage</legacyLink> and <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__enabletooltips">EnableToolTips</legacyLink>, and you do not need to call it yourself.</para>
                    <para>However, in certain applications, for example some ActiveX controls, these methods might not be invoked by the framework, and you will need to call FilterToolTipMessage yourself. For more information, see <link xlink:href="b015e9f4-ddfb-49a4-a5a6-fa2d45e4d328">Methods of Creating Tool Tips</link>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__findwindow">
        <!--72361c9f-3c21-4a15-b3df-fa91f07d274c-->
        <title>CWnd::FindWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Returns the top-level <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> whose window class is given by <parameterReference>lpszClassName</parameterReference> and whose window name, or title, is given by <parameterReference>lpszWindowName</parameterReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* PASCAL FindWindow(
    LPCTSTR lpszClassName,
    LPCTSTR lpszWindowName );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpszClassName</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a null-terminated string that specifies the window's class name (a <legacyBold>WNDCLASS</legacyBold> structure). If <parameterReference>lpClassName</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, all class names match.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpszWindowName</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a null-terminated string that specifies the window name (the window's title). If <parameterReference>lpWindowName</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, all window names match.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the window that has the specified class name and window name. It is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if no such window is found. </para>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>* may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This function does not search child windows.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#94</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__findwindowex">
        <!--4f63de1b-a280-4958-adf8-b51f02467170-->
        <title>CWnd::FindWindowEx</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the window object whose class name and window name match the specified strings.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* FindWindowEx(
    HWND hwndParent,
    HWND hwndChildAfter,
    LPCTSTR lpszClass,
    LPCTSTR lpszWindow );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>hwndParent</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Handle to the parent window whose child windows are to be searched.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>hwndChildAfter</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Handle to a child window. The search begins with the next child window in the Z order. The child window must be a direct child window of                                 <legacyItalic>hwndParent</legacyItalic>, not just a descendant window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpszClass</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the class name or a class atom created by a previous call to the                                 <externalLink> <linkText>RegisterClass</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633586</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> or                                 <externalLink> <linkText>RegisterClassEx</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633587</linkUri>
                                </externalLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>lpszWindow</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the window name (the window's title). If this parameter is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, all window names match.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the function succeeds, the return value is a pointer to the window object having the specified class and window names. If the function fails, the return value is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>FindWindowEx</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633500</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__flashwindow">
        <!--0da738a9-a458-44d0-9c9b-ac988663254c-->
        <title>CWnd::FlashWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Flashes the given window once.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL FlashWindow( BOOL bInvert );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bInvert</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is to be flashed or returned to its original state. The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is flashed from one state to the other if <parameterReference>bInvert</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>. If <parameterReference>bInvert</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, the window is returned to its original state (either active or inactive).</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the window was active before the call to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>FlashWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>For successive flashing, create a system timer and repeatedly call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>FlashWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. Flashing the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> means changing the appearance of its title bar as if the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> were changing from inactive to active status, or vice versa. (An inactive title bar changes to an active title bar; an active title bar changes to an inactive title bar.) </para>
                    <para>Typically, a window is flashed to inform the user that it requires attention but that it does not currently have the input focus.</para>
                    <para>The <parameterReference>bInvert</parameterReference> parameter should be <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold> only when the window is getting the input focus and will no longer be flashing; it should be <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> on successive calls while waiting to get the input focus. </para>
                    <para>This function always returns nonzero for minimized windows. If the window is minimized, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>FlashWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> will simply flash the window's icon; <parameterReference>bInvert</parameterReference> is ignored for minimized windows.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#95</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__flashwindowex">
        <!--d1071a39-8fdf-4402-b06c-c66f34311f79-->
        <title>CWnd::FlashWindowEx</title>
        <content>
            <para>Flashes the given window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL FlashWindowEx(
    DWORD dwFlags,
    UINT uCount,
    DWORD dwTimeout );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the flash status. For a complete list of values, see the                                 <externalLink> <linkText>FLASHWINFO</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms679348</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> structure.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>uCount</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the number of times to flash the window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwTimeout</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the rate, in milliseconds, at which the window will be flashed. If <parameterReference>dwTimeout</parameterReference> is zero, the function uses the default cursor blink rate.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The return value specifies the window's state before the call to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>FlashWindowEx</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> function. If the window caption was drawn as active before the call, the return value is nonzero. Otherwise, the return value is zero.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This method emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>FlashWindowEx</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms679347</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__fromhandle">
        <!--36f0da28-eb61-4a44-868d-820ebad9e33c-->
        <title>CWnd::FromHandle</title>
        <content>
            <para>Returns a pointer to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object when given a handle to a window. If a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is not attached to the handle, a temporary <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is created and attached.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* PASCAL FromHandle( HWND hWnd );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>hWnd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>An <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>HWND</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> of a Windows window.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Returns a pointer to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object when given a handle to a window. If a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is not attached to the handle, a temporary <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is created and attached. </para>
                    <para>The pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__fromhandlepermanent">
        <!--7daeab1d-405c-45a2-b89c-d2db985375fc-->
        <title>CWnd::FromHandlePermanent</title>
        <content>
            <para>Returns a pointer to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object when given a handle to a window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* PASCAL FromHandlePermanent( HWND hWnd );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>hWnd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>An <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>HWND</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> of a Windows window.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is not attached to the handle, <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> is returned.</para>
                    <para>This function, unlike <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__fromhandle">FromHandle</legacyLink>, does not create temporary objects.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__get_accchild">

        <title>CWnd::get_accChild</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called by the framework to retrieve the address of an <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>IDispatch</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> interface for the specified child.</para>

    VARIANT varChild,
    IDispatch ** ppdispChild );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>varChild</parameterReference>

                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>ppdispChild</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>

            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>

                        </externalLink> support.</para>
                    <para>Override this function in your <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>-derived class if you have nonwindowed user interface elements (other than windowless ActiveX controls, which MFC handles).</para>
                    <para>For more information, see                        <externalLink> <linkText>IAccessible::get_accChild</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd318475</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>

Call the base class version and then add the nonwindowed child elements.</para>

                        </externalLink> in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>

            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This function is part of MFC's                         <externalLink> <linkText>Active Accessibility</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd373592</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> support.</para>
                    <para>Override this function in your <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>-derived class to describe your object's default action. </para>
                    <para>For more information, see                         <externalLink> <linkText>IAccessible::get_accDefaultAction</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd318477</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>

                        </externalLink> support.</para>

                    <para>For more information, see                         <externalLink> <linkText>IAccessible::get_accDescription</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd318478</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>

        <title>CWnd::get_accHelp</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called by the framework to retrieve an object's <legacyBold>Help</legacyBold> property string.</para>

    <section address="cwnd__getactivewindow">
        <!--4117f01b-1cc2-497e-b66a-d4f9e22c9c60-->
        <title>CWnd::GetActiveWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves a pointer to the active window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* PASCAL GetActiveWindow();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The active window or <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if no window was active at the time of the call. The pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The active window is either the window that has the current input focus or the window explicitly made active by the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__setactivewindow">SetActiveWindow</legacyLink> member function.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getancestor">
        <!--ddc84c20-b9bc-4673-a37a-ccca4dcd94e6-->
        <title>CWnd::GetAncestor</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the ancestor window object of the specified window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetAncestor( UINT gaFlags ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>gaFlags</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the ancestor to be retrieved. For a complete list of possible values, see                                 <externalLink> <linkText>GetAncestor</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633502</linkUri>
                                </externalLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the function succeeds, the return value is a pointer to the ancestor window object. If the function fails, the return value is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetAncestor</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633502</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getcapture">
        <!--0131de2e-8859-4339-a44c-f5ea54352311-->
        <title>CWnd::GetCapture</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the window that has the mouse capture.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* PASCAL GetCapture();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the window that has the mouse capture. It is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if no window has the mouse capture. </para>
                    <para>The return value may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Only one window has the mouse capture at any given time. A window receives the mouse capture when the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__setcapture">SetCapture</legacyLink> member function is called. This window receives mouse input whether or not the cursor is within its borders.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getcaretpos">
