        <title>CWnd::GetCaretPos</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the client coordinates of the caret's current position and returns them as a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CPoint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CPoint PASCAL GetCaretPos();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <legacyLink xlink:href="a6d4db93-35cc-444d-9221-c3e160f6edaa">CPoint</legacyLink> object containing the coordinates of the caret's position.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The caret position is given in the client coordinates of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getcheckedradiobutton">
        <!--88202c09-51bd-4ad2-ba6b-31a475291631-->
        <title>CWnd::GetCheckedRadioButton</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the ID of the currently checked radio button in the specified group.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int GetCheckedRadioButton(
    int nIDFirstButton,
    int nIDLastButton );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDFirstButton</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the integer identifier of the first radio button in the group.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDLastButton</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the integer identifier of the last radio button in the group.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>ID of the checked radio button, or 0 if none is selected.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getclientrect">
        <!--fb1284b9-9f58-482a-ae5f-52e263d956cf-->
        <title>CWnd::GetClientRect</title>
        <content>
            <para>Copies the client coordinates of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> client area into the structure pointed to by <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void GetClientRect( LPRECT lpRect ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure or a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object to receive the client coordinates. The <legacyBold>left</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>top</legacyBold> members will be 0. The <legacyBold>right</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>bottom</legacyBold> members will contain the width and height of the window.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The client coordinates specify the upper-left and lower-right corners of the client area. Since client coordinates are relative to the upper-left corners of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> client area, the coordinates of the upper-left corner are (0,0).</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__isiconic">CWnd::IsIconic</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getclipboardowner">
        <!--58687b5e-0ec9-4491-8bb4-3ee324879205-->
        <title>CWnd::GetClipboardOwner</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the current owner of the Clipboard.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* PASCAL GetClipboardOwner();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the window that owns the Clipboard if the function is successful. Otherwise, it is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>. </para>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The Clipboard can still contain data even if it is not currently owned.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getclipboardviewer">
        <!--56e84705-2961-4797-91a8-5b0f19c3d1db-->
        <title>CWnd::GetClipboardViewer</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the first window in the Clipboard-viewer chain.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* PASCAL GetClipboardViewer();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the window currently responsible for displaying the Clipboard if successful; otherwise <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> (for example, if there is no viewer). </para>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getcontrolunknown">
        <!--0adf8cf1-11c3-4a79-9b0c-0194a01d9164-->
        <title>CWnd::GetControlUnknown</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to retrieve a pointer to an unknown OLE control.</para>
            <legacySyntax>LPUNKNOWN GetControlUnknown();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to the                         <externalLink> <linkText>IUnknown</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms680509</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> interface of the OLE control represented by this <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object. If this object does not represent an OLE control, the return value is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>You should not release this <legacyBold>IUnknown</legacyBold> pointer. Typically, you would use to obtain a specific interface of the control.</para>
                    <para>The interface pointer returned by <legacyBold>GetControlUnknown </legacyBold>is not reference-counted. Do not call                         <externalLink> <linkText>IUnknown::Release</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms682317</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> on the pointer unless you have previously called                         <externalLink> <linkText>IUnknown::AddRef</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms691379</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> on it.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#96</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getcurrentmessage">
        <!--3427f95d-9472-488b-b4a0-4b2d750cee12-->
        <title>CWnd::GetCurrentMessage</title>
        <content>
            <para>Returns a pointer to the message this window is currently processing. Should only be called when in an <legacyBold>On</legacyBold>
                <legacyItalic>Message</legacyItalic> message-handler member function.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static const MSG* PASCAL GetCurrentMessage();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Returns a pointer to the <legacyLink xlink:href="dc166d27-9423-41f1-9599-5ba76d2f0138">MSG</legacyLink> structure that contains the message the window is currently processing. Should only be called when in an <legacyBold>On</legacyBold>
                        <legacyItalic>Message</legacyItalic> handler.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="fa8736e6-511b-4c51-8b4d-eba78378aeb9#cmdiframewnd__mdicascade">CMDIFrameWnd::MDICascade</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getdc">
        <!--fbace776-e0cf-4928-a057-6a2e739bd86c-->
        <title>CWnd::GetDC</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves a pointer to a common, class, or private device context for the client area depending on the class style specified for the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CDC* GetDC();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the device context for the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> client area if successful; otherwise, the return value is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>. The pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>For common device contexts, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetDC</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> assigns default attributes to the context each time it is retrieved. For class and private contexts, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetDC</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> leaves the previously assigned attributes unchanged. The device context can be used in subsequent graphics device interface (GDI) functions to draw in the client area.</para>
                    <para>Unless the device context belongs to a window class, the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__releasedc">ReleaseDC</legacyLink> member function must be called to release the context after painting.</para>
                    <para>A device context belonging to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> class is returned by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetDC</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function if <legacyBold>CS_CLASSDC</legacyBold>, <legacyBold>CS_OWNDC</legacyBold>, or <legacyBold>CS_PARENTDC</legacyBold> was specified as a style in the <legacyBold>WNDCLASS</legacyBold> structure when the class was registered.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getdcex">
        <!--efd6297e-086d-4e4b-89bf-b96f5e63191e-->
        <title>CWnd::GetDCEx</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the handle of a device context for the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CDC* GetDCEx(
    CRgn* prgnClip,
    DWORD flags );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>prgnClip</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies a clipping region that may be combined with the visible region of the client window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>flags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Can have one of the following preset values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DCX_CACHE</legacyBold>Returns a device context from the cache rather than the <legacyBold>OWNDC</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>CLASSDC</legacyBold> window. Overrides <legacyBold>CS_OWNDC</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>CS_CLASSDC</legacyBold>.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DCX_CLIPCHILDREN</legacyBold>Excludes the visible regions of all child windows below the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DCX_CLIPSIBLINGS</legacyBold>Excludes the visible regions of all sibling windows above the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DCX_EXCLUDERGN</legacyBold>Excludes the clipping region identified by <parameterReference>prgnClip</parameterReference> from the visible region of the returned device context.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DCX_INTERSECTRGN</legacyBold>Intersects the clipping region identified by <parameterReference>prgnClip</parameterReference> within the visible region of the returned device context.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DCX_LOCKWINDOWUPDATE</legacyBold>Allows drawing even if there is a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>LockWindowUpdate</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> call in effect that would otherwise exclude this window. This value is used for drawing during tracking.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DCX_PARENTCLIP</legacyBold>Uses the visible region of the parent window and ignores the parent window's <legacyBold>WS_CLIPCHILDREN</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>WS_PARENTDC</legacyBold> style bits. This value sets the device context's origin to the upper-left corner of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>DCX_WINDOW</legacyBold>Returns a device context that corresponds to the window rectangle rather than the client rectangle.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The device context for the specified window if the function is successful; otherwise <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The device context can be used in subsequent GDI functions to draw in the client area. </para>
                    <para>This function, which is an extension to the                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetDC</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd144871</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> function, gives an application more control over how and whether a device context for a window is clipped. </para>
                    <para>Unless the device context belongs to a window class, the                         <externalLink> <linkText>ReleaseDC</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd162920</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> function must be called to release the context after drawing. Since only five common device contexts are available at any given time, failure to release a device context can prevent other applications from gaining access to a device context.</para>
                    <para>To obtain a cached device context, an application must specify                         <externalLink> <linkText>DCX_CACHE</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd144873</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>. If <legacyBold>DCX_CACHE</legacyBold> is not specified and the window is neither <legacyBold>CS_OWNDC</legacyBold> nor                         <externalLink> <linkText>CS_CLASSDC</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633576</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, this function returns <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>. </para>
                    <para>A device context with special characteristics is returned by the                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetDCEx</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd144873</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> function if the <legacyBold>CS_CLASSDC</legacyBold>,                         <externalLink> <linkText>CS_OWNDC</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633576</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, or                         <externalLink> <linkText>CS_PARENTDC</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633576</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> style was specified in the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WNDCLASS</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633576</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> structure when the class was registered. </para>
                    <para>For more information about these characteristics, see the description of the <legacyBold>WNDCLASS</legacyBold> structure in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getdcrendertarget">
        <!--3d50fa45-a69c-4db4-aea5-ba86f8f39a70-->
        <title>CWnd::GetDCRenderTarget</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the device context (DC) render target for the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CDCRenderTarget* GetDCRenderTarget();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The device context render target for the specified window if the function is successful; otherwise <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para/>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getdescendantwindow">
        <!--ba024d0e-df6f-4a0e-a563-e799338abced-->
        <title>CWnd::GetDescendantWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to find the descendant window specified by the given ID.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetDescendantWindow(
    int nID,
    BOOL bOnlyPerm = FALSE  ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the identifier of the control or child window to be retrieved.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bOnlyPerm</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the window to be returned can be temporary. If <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, only a permanent window can be returned; if <legacyBold>FALSE,</legacyBold> the function can return a temporary window. For more information on temporary windows see <legacyLink xlink:href="fbea9f38-992c-4091-8dbc-f29e288617d6">Technical Note 3</legacyLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object, or <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if no child window is found.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function searches the entire tree of child windows, not only the windows that are immediate children.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getdesktopwindow">
        <!--796d6194-95c2-450a-997a-c510d900eba5-->
        <title>CWnd::GetDesktopWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Returns the Windows desktop window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* PASCAL GetDesktopWindow();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the Windows desktop window. This pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The desktop window covers the entire screen and is the area on top of which all icons and other windows are painted.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getdlgctrlid">
        <!--b699f911-9e4b-48f8-816c-4b3ff2d6b022-->
        <title>CWnd::GetDlgCtrlID</title>
        <content>
            <para>Returns the window or control ID value for any child window, not only that of a control in a dialog box.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int GetDlgCtrlID() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The numeric identifier of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> child window if the function is successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Since top-level windows do not have an ID value, the return value of this function is invalid if the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a top-level window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onctlcolor">CWnd::OnCtlColor</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getdlgitem">
        <!--64aa4c0a-6b25-4175-91a0-9957ca07eeab-->
        <title>CWnd::GetDlgItem</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves a pointer to the specified control or child window in a dialog box or other window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetDlgItem(
    int nID ) const;

void GetDlgItem(
    int nID,
    HWND* phWnd ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the identifier of the control or child window to be retrieved.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>phWnd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a child window.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to the given control or child window. If no control with the integer ID given by the <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference> parameter exists, the value is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>. </para>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The pointer returned is usually cast to the type of control identified by <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#97</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getdlgitemint">
        <!--3903b6c4-efbf-4ca6-a9c9-38bc58a7a460-->
        <title>CWnd::GetDlgItemInt</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the text of the control identified by <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>UINT GetDlgItemInt(
    int nID,
    BOOL* lpTrans = NULL,
    BOOL bSigned = TRUE ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the integer identifier of the dialog-box control to be translated.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpTrans</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to the Boolean variable that is to receive the translated flag.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bSigned</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the value to be retrieved is signed.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies the translated value of the dialog-box item text. Since 0 is a valid return value, <parameterReference>lpTrans</parameterReference> must be used to detect errors. If a signed return value is desired, cast it as an <languageKeyword>int</languageKeyword> type. </para>
                    <para>The function returns 0 if the translated number is greater than INT_MAX (for signed numbers) or UINT_MAX (for unsigned).</para>
                    <para>When errors occur, such as encountering nonnumeric characters and exceeding the above maximum, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetDlgItemInt</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> copies 0 to the location pointed to by <parameterReference>lpTrans</parameterReference>. If there are no errors, <parameterReference>lpTrans</parameterReference> receives a nonzero value. If <parameterReference>lpTrans</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetDlgItemInt</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> does not warn about errors.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>It translates the text of the specified control in the given dialog box into an integer value by stripping any extra spaces at the beginning of the text and converting decimal digits. It stops the translation when it reaches the end of the text or encounters any nonnumeric character.</para>
                    <para>If <parameterReference>bSigned</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetDlgItemInt</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> checks for a minus sign () at the beginning of the text and translates the text into a signed number. Otherwise, it creates an unsigned value. </para>
                    <para>It sends a                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_GETTEXT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632627</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message to the control.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getdlgitemtext">
        <!--c75ce07e-de4c-4d61-b458-69cac4a1af9b-->
        <title>CWnd::GetDlgItemText</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to retrieve the title or text associated with a control in a dialog box.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int GetDlgItemText(
    int nID,
    LPTSTR lpStr,
    int nMaxCount ) const;

int GetDlgItemText(
    int nID,
    CString&amp; rString ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the integer identifier of the control whose title is to be retrieved.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpStr</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to the buffer to receive the control's title or text.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nMaxCount</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the maximum length (in characters) of the string to be copied to <parameterReference>lpStr</parameterReference>. If the string is longer than <parameterReference>nMaxCount</parameterReference>, it is truncated.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>rString</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A reference to a <legacyLink xlink:href="7cacc59c-425f-40f1-8f5b-6db921318ec9">CString</legacyLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies the actual number of characters copied to the buffer, not including the terminating null character. The value is 0 if no text is copied.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetDlgItemText</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function copies the text to the location pointed to by <parameterReference>lpStr</parameterReference> and returns a count of the number of bytes it copies.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getdsccursor">
        <!--09403332-2418-4d72-b88f-67f6f3930cce-->
        <title>CWnd::GetDSCCursor</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to retrieve a pointer to the underlying cursor that is defined by the DataSource, UserName, Password, and SQL properties of the data-source control.</para>
            <legacySyntax>IUnknown * GetDSCCursor();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to a cursor that is defined by a data-source control. MFC takes care of calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>AddRef</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> for the pointer.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Use the returned pointer to set the ICursor property of a complex data-bound control, such as the data-bound grid control. A data-source control will not become active until the first bound control requests its cursor. This can happen either explicitly by a call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetDSCCursor</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> or implicitly by the MFC binding manager. In either case, you can force a data-source control to become active by calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetDSCCursor</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and then calling <legacyBold>Release</legacyBold> on the returned pointer to <legacyBold>IUnknown</legacyBold>. Activation will cause the data-source control to attempt to connect to the underlying data source. The returned pointer might be used in the following context:</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFC_AxDataBinding#1,5,3</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getdynamiclayout">
        <!--3bd0e1ab-ee0a-4b8d-9422-bec8745fd5cd-->
        <title>CWnd::GetDynamicLayout</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves a pointer to the dynamic layout manager object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CMFCDynamicLayout* GetDynamicLayout();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to the dynamic layout manager object, or NULL if dynamic layout is not enabled.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The window object owns and manages the lifetime of the returned pointer, so it should only be used to access the object; do not delete the pointer or store the pointer permanently.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getexstyle">
        <!--915d221d-88fd-4718-8f7b-4c1def9da3d2-->
        <title>CWnd::GetExStyle</title>
        <content>
            <para>Returns the window's extended style.</para>
            <legacySyntax>DWORD GetExStyle() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The window's extended style. For more information about the extended window styles used in MFC, see <link xlink:href="d18e6c69-0a01-49ed-b58a-55b3802b47c1">Extended Window Styles</link>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getfocus">
        <!--de5fe96e-deb6-41e8-8be6-bdc08ceb252f-->
        <title>CWnd::GetFocus</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves a pointer to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> that currently has the input focus.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* PASCAL GetFocus();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to the window that has the current focus, or <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if there is no focus window. </para>
                    <para>The pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getfont">
        <!--34f5b74e-3d8d-4ee1-9982-b3c0585e0abe-->
        <title>CWnd::GetFont</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sends the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_GETFONT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message to the window to retrieve the current font.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CFont* GetFont() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Pointer to a <legacyLink xlink:href="3fad6bfe-d6ce-4ab9-967a-5ce0aa102800">CFont</legacyLink> object that is attached to the current font for the window. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This method has no effect unless the window processes the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_GETFONT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message. Many MFC classes that derive from <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> process this message because they are attached to a predefined window class that includes a message handler for the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_GETFONT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message. To use this method, classes that you derive from <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> must define a method handler for the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_GETFONT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getforegroundwindow">
        <!--86b91e20-d7e9-4b8a-9dfc-743966c08caf-->
        <title>CWnd::GetForegroundWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Returns a pointer to the foreground window (the window with which the user is currently working).</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* PASCAL GetForegroundWindow();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to the foreground window. This may be a temporary <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The foreground window applies only to top-level windows (frame windows or dialog boxes).</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__geticon">
        <!--14ec8c64-2582-433d-82a4-3f3b7c8cad1d-->
        <title>CWnd::GetIcon</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to get the handle to either a big (32x32) or the handle to a small (16x16) icon, as indicated by <parameterReference>bBigIcon</parameterReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>HICON GetIcon( BOOL bBigIcon ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bBigIcon</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies a 32 pixel by 32 pixel icon if <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>; specifies a 16 pixel by 16 pixel icon if <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A handle to an icon. If unsuccessful, returns <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getlastactivepopup">
        <!--ab6f677d-2f44-4fd5-ac69-9ffcc40702c4-->
        <title>CWnd::GetLastActivePopup</title>
        <content>
            <para>Determines which pop-up window owned by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> was most recently active.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetLastActivePopup() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the most recently active pop-up window. The return value will be the window itself if any of the following conditions are met:  </para>
                    <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                            <para>The window itself was most recently active.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para>The window does not own any pop-up windows.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para>The window is not a top-level window or is owned by another window.</para>
                        </listItem>
                    </list>
                    <para>The pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__findwindow">CWnd::FindWindow</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getlayeredwindowattributes">
        <!--9bae4578-63d8-4869-ab19-94d6696b1612-->
        <title>CWnd::GetLayeredWindowAttributes</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the opacity and transparency color key of a layered window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL GetLayeredWindowAttributes(
    COLORREF * pcrKey,
    BYTE * pbAlpha,
    DWORD * pdwFlags ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pcrKey</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a <legacyBold>COLORREF</legacyBold> value that receives the transparency color key to be used when composing the layered window. All pixels painted by the window in this color will be transparent. This can be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if the argument is not needed.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pbAlpha</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a <legacyBold>BYTE</legacyBold> that receives the Alpha value used to describe the opacity of the layered window. When the variable referred to by <parameterReference>pbAlpha</parameterReference> is 0, the window is completely transparent. When the variable referred to by <parameterReference>pbAlpha</parameterReference> is 255, the window is opaque. This can be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if the argument is not needed.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pdwFlags</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DWORD</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> that receives a layering flag. This can be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if the argument is not needed. For a complete list of possible values, see                                 <externalLink> <linkText>GetLayeredWindowAttributes</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633508</linkUri>
                                </externalLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function succeeds; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetLayeredWindowAttributes</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633508</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getmenu">
        <!--b498b0d5-81f2-472c-8cae-ba263d73ec1e-->
        <title>CWnd::GetMenu</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves a pointer to the menu for this window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CMenu* GetMenu() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the menu. The value is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> has no menu. The return value is undefined if <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a child window. </para>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This function should not be used for child windows because they do not have a menu.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#98</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getmenubarinfo">
        <!--621fdb41-b2de-4c6e-be20-4774709025d8-->
        <title>CWnd::GetMenuBarInfo</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves information about the specified menu bar.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL GetMenuBarInfo(
    LONG idObject,
    LONG idItem,
    PMENUBARINFO pmbi ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>idObject</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the menu object. For a list of possible values, see                                 <externalLink> <linkText>GetMenuBarInfo</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms647833</linkUri>
                                </externalLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>idItem</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the item for which to retrieve information. If this parameter is zero, the function retrieves information about the menu itself. If this parameter is 1, the function retrieves information about the first item on the menu, and so on.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pmbi</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a                                 <externalLink> <linkText>MENUBARINFO</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms647564</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> structure that receives the information.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function succeeds; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetMenuBarInfo</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms647833</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getnextdlggroupitem">
        <!--16911d6f-4ed8-4a18-8763-3ef425a5532e-->
        <title>CWnd::GetNextDlgGroupItem</title>
        <content>
            <para>Searches for the previous or next control within a group of controls in a dialog box.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetNextDlgGroupItem(
    CWnd* pWndCtl,
    BOOL bPrevious = FALSE ) const;

COleControlSiteOrWnd* GetNextDlgGroupItem(
    COleControlSiteOrWnd * pCurSiteOrWnd = NULL ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pWndCtl</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the control to be used as the starting point for the search.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bPrevious</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies how the function is to search the group of controls in the dialog box. If <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the function searches for the previous control in the group; if <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, it searches for the next control in the group.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pCurSiteOrWnd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the <legacyBold>COleControlSiteOrWnd </legacyBold>control. For more information about <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>COleControlSiteOrWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, see <legacyBold>Remarks</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Pointer to the previous or next control in the group if the member function is successful. </para>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A group of controls begins with a control that was created with the <legacyLink xlink:href="c85ffbe4-f4ff-4227-917a-48ec4a411842">WS_GROUP</legacyLink> style and ends with the last control that was not created with the <legacyBold>WS_GROUP</legacyBold> style. </para>
                    <para>By default, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetNextDlgGroupItem</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function returns a pointer to the next control in the group. If <parameterReference>pWndCtl</parameterReference> identifies the first control in the group and <parameterReference>bPrevious</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetNextDlgGroupItem</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> returns a pointer to the last control in the group.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>Because MFC supports windowless ActiveX controls, standard ActiveX controls, and windows, referring to a control by only an HWND no longer suffices. The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>COleControlSiteOrWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object includes information that identifies the object as a windowed ActiveX control, a windowless ActiveX control, or a window, as follows:</para>
                    </alert>
                    <table xmlns:caps="http://schemas.microsoft.com/build/caps/2013/11">
                        <thead>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Control or window type</para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Identifying information</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                        </thead>
                        <tbody>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Windowed ActiveX control</para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Contains an HWND and associates a <legacyLink xlink:href="43970644-5eab-434a-8ba6-56d144ff1e3f">COleControlSite</legacyLink> object with it. The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>m_hWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>COleControlSiteOrWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is set to the HWND of the control, and the <legacyBold>m_pSite</legacyBold> member points to the control's <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>COleControlSite</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Windowless ActiveX control</para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Contains no <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>HWND</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. The <legacyBold>m_pSite</legacyBold> member of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>COleControlSiteOrWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> points to the control's <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>COleControlSite</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, and the <legacyBold>m_hWnd </legacyBold>member is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Standard window</para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Contains just an <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>HWND</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>m_hWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>COleControlSiteOrWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is set to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>HWND</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> of the window, and the <legacyBold>m_pSite</legacyBold> member is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                        </tbody>
                    </table>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getnextdlgtabitem">
        <!--a693ad27-f55f-4a81-b612-8052dafaf260-->
        <title>CWnd::GetNextDlgTabItem</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves a pointer to the first control that was created with the <legacyLink xlink:href="c85ffbe4-f4ff-4227-917a-48ec4a411842">WS_TABSTOP</legacyLink> style and that precedes or follows the specified control.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetNextDlgTabItem(
    CWnd* pWndCtl,
    BOOL bPrevious = FALSE ) const;

COleControlSiteOrWnd* GetNextDlgTabItem(
    COleControlSiteOrWnd * pCurSiteOrWnd,
     BOOL bPrevious ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pWndCtl</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the control to be used as the starting point for the search.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pCurSiteOrWnd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the <legacyBold>COleControlSiteOrWnd </legacyBold>control. For more information about <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>COleControlSiteOrWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, see <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__getnextdlggroupitem">CWnd::GetNextDlgGroupItem</legacyLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bPrevious</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies how the function is to search the dialog box. If <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the function searches for the previous control in the dialog box; if <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, it searches for the next control.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Pointer to the previous or next control that has the <legacyBold>WS_TABSTOP</legacyBold> style, if the member function is successful. </para>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                    <para>For more information about <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>COleControlSiteOrWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, see <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__getnextdlggroupitem">CWnd::GetNextDlgGroupItem</legacyLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getnextwindow">
        <!--2305b783-7ac4-4ea3-a476-d13f00f1afd1-->
        <title>CWnd::GetNextWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Searches for the next (or previous) window in the window manager's list.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetNextWindow( UINT nFlag = GW_HWNDNEXT ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nFlag</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the function returns a pointer to the next window or the previous window. It can be either <legacyBold>GW_HWNDNEXT</legacyBold>, which returns the window that follows the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object on the window manager's list, or <legacyBold>GW_HWNDPREV</legacyBold>, which returns the previous window on the window manager's list.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the next (or the previous) window in the window manager's list if the member function is successful. </para>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The window manager's list contains entries for all top-level windows, their associated child windows, and the child windows of any child windows. </para>
                    <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a top-level window, the function searches for the next (or previous) top-level window; if <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a child window, the function searches for the next (or previous) child window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>

                    <definitionTable>

    <section address="cwnd__getopenclipboardwindow">
        <!--ff74977b-dabc-4bd2-bb47-18fbf4ef170d-->
        <title>CWnd::GetOpenClipboardWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the handle of the window that currently has the Clipboard open.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* PASCAL GetOpenClipboardWindow();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>

    <section address="cwnd__getowner">
        <!--fcad7014-01ba-4e40-a944-034a7cd6d1cb-->
        <title>CWnd::GetOwner</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves a pointer to the owner of the window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetOwner() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the window has no owner, then a pointer to the parent window object is returned by default. Note that the relationship between the owner and the owned differs from the parent-child aspect in several important aspects. For example, a window with a parent is confined to its parent window's client area. Owned windows can be drawn at any location on the desktop. </para>
                    <para>The ownership concept of this function is different from the ownership concept of                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633515</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getparent">
        <!--fe43ff8c-f534-4c59-aedb-2481f4a7743a-->
        <title>CWnd::GetParent</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this function to get a pointer to a child window's parent window (if any).</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetParent() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>See the Return Values section in                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetParent</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633510</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetParent</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> function returns a pointer to the immediate parent (if it exists). In contrast, the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__getparentowner">GetParentOwner</legacyLink> function returns a pointer to the most immediate parent or owner window that is not a child window (does not have the <legacyBold>WS_CHILD</legacyBold> style). If you have a child window within a child window <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetParent</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetParentOwner</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> return different results. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getparentframe">
        <!--a7954102-95b0-4d5a-9901-e533f19a07bf-->
        <title>CWnd::GetParentFrame</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to retrieve the parent frame window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CFrameWnd* GetParentFrame() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to a frame window if successful; otherwise <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The member function searches up the parent chain until a <legacyLink xlink:href="e2220aba-5bf4-4002-b960-fbcafcad01f1">CFrameWnd</legacyLink> (or derived class) object is found.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getparentowner">
        <!--0b2e0834-6c82-4b12-b093-66ee08ee74f9-->
        <title>CWnd::GetParentOwner</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to get a pointer to a child window's parent window or owner window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetParentOwner() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object. If a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is not attached to the handle, a temporary <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is created and attached. The pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetParentOwner</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> returns a pointer to the most immediate parent or owner window that is not a child window (does not have the <legacyBold>WS_CHILD</legacyBold> style). The current owner window can be set with <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__setowner">SetOwner</legacyLink>. By default, the parent of a window is its owner.</para>
                    <para>In contrast, the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__getparent">GetParent</legacyLink> function returns a pointer to the immediate parent, whether it is a child window or not. If you have a child window within a child window <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetParent</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetParentOwner</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> return different results. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getproperty">
        <!--66e814bd-ee55-46a0-a385-927546df6268-->
        <title>CWnd::GetProperty</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to get the ActiveX control property specified by <parameterReference>dwDispID</parameterReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void GetProperty(
    DISPID dwDispID,
    VARTYPE vtProp,
    void* pvProp )const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwDispID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the property to be retrieved.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>vtProp</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the type of the property to be retrieved. For possible values, see the Remarks section for <legacyLink xlink:href="3ed98daf-cdc7-4374-8a0c-cf695a8d3657#coledispatchdriver__invokehelper">COleDispatchDriver::InvokeHelper</legacyLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pvProp</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Address of the variable that will that will receive the property value. It must match the type specified by <parameterReference>vtProp</parameterReference>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <legacyBold>GetProperty</legacyBold> returns the value through <parameterReference>pvProp</parameterReference>. </para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This function should be called only on a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object that represents an ActiveX control.</para>
                    </alert>
                    <para>For more information about using this member function with ActiveX Control Containers, see the article <legacyLink xlink:href="ef9b2480-92d6-4191-b16e-8055c4fd7b73">ActiveX Control Containers: Programming ActiveX Controls in an ActiveX Control Container</legacyLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>

        <title>CWnd::GetRenderTarget</title>

    <section address="cwnd__getsafehwnd">
        <!--0179bc13-81f7-4c96-97a9-cf15113407c6-->
        <title>CWnd::GetSafeHwnd</title>
        <content>
            <para>Returns <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>m_hWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, or <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if the <legacyBold>this</legacyBold> pointer is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>HWND GetSafeHwnd() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Returns the window handle for a window. Returns <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is not attached to a window or if it is used with a <legacyBold>NULL CWnd</legacyBold> pointer. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__subclasswindow">CWnd::SubclassWindow</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
