    <section address="cwnd__getsafeowner">
        <!--b90dd3af-dc98-48a3-838b-a563e993523f-->
        <title>CWnd::GetSafeOwner</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to retrieve the owner window that should be used for dialog boxes or other modal windows.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* GetSafeOwner(
    CWnd* pParent = NULL,
    HWND* pWndTop = NULL );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pParent</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a parent <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> window. May be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pWndTop</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to the window that is currently on top. May be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to the safe owner for the given window. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The safe owner is the first non-child parent window of <parameterReference>pParent</parameterReference>. If <parameterReference>pParent</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the thread's main window (retrieved via <legacyLink xlink:href="4977d098-13ea-4a47-863d-2f6e2fcd2a8f">AfxGetMainWnd</legacyLink>) is used to find an owner.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>The framework itself uses this function to determine the correct owner window for dialog boxes and property sheets where the owner is not specified.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getscrollbarctrl">
        <!--3d2269a8-3249-4774-85bc-30e6e0fcb30a-->
        <title>CWnd::GetScrollBarCtrl</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to obtain a pointer to the specified sibling scroll bar or splitter window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual CScrollBar* GetScrollBarCtrl( int nBar ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nBar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the type of scroll bar. The parameter can take one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_HORZ</legacyBold>Retrieves the position of the horizontal scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_VERT</legacyBold>Retrieves the position of the vertical scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A sibling scroll-bar control, or <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if none.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function does not operate on scroll bars created when the <legacyBold>WS_HSCROLL</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>WS_VSCROLL</legacyBold> bits are set during the creation of a window. The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> implementation of this function simply returns <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>. Derived classes, such as <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CView</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, implement the described functionality.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getscrollbarinfo">
        <!--0efd7519-ce11-4f14-8fc1-cb556ae26c88-->
        <title>CWnd::GetScrollBarInfo</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves information about the specified scroll bar.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL GetScrollBarInfo(
    LONG idObject,
    PSCROLLBARINFO psbi ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>idObject</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the menu object. For a list of possible values, see                                 <externalLink> <linkText>GetScrollBarInfo</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb787581</linkUri>
                                </externalLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>psbi</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a                                 <externalLink> <linkText>SCROLLBARINFO</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb787535</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> structure that receives the information.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function succeeds; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetScrollBarInfo</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb787581</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getscrollinfo">
        <!--805da1f8-662e-48e8-83b1-7d2c6996d06f-->
        <title>CWnd::GetScrollInfo</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to retrieve the information that the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SCROLLINFO</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> structure maintains about a scroll bar.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL GetScrollInfo(
    int nBar,
    LPSCROLLINFO lpScrollInfo,
    UINT nMask = SIF_ALL  );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nBar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the scroll bar is a control or part of a window's nonclient area. If it is part of the nonclient area, <parameterReference>nBar</parameterReference> also indicates whether the scroll bar is positioned horizontally, vertically, or both. It must be one of the following:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_CTL</legacyBold>Retrieves the parameters for a scroll bar control. The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>m_hWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> data member must be the handle of the scroll bar control.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_HORZ</legacyBold>Retrieves the parameters for the window's standard horizontal scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_VERT</legacyBold>Retrieves the parameters for the window's standard vertical scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpScrollInfo</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a                                 <externalLink> <linkText>SCROLLINFO</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb787537</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> structure. See the <token>winSDK</token> for more information about this structure.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nMask</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the scroll bar parameters to retrieve. The default specifies a combination of <legacyBold>SIF_PAGE</legacyBold>, <legacyBold>SIF_POS</legacyBold>, <legacyBold>SIF_TRACKPOS</legacyBold>, and <legacyBold>SIF_RANGE</legacyBold>. See <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SCROLLINFO</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> for more information on the                                 <legacyItalic>nMask </legacyItalic>values.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the message retrieved any values, the return is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>. Otherwise, it is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetScrollInfo</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> enables applications to use 32-bit scroll positions. </para>
                    <para>The                         <externalLink> <linkText>SCROLLINFO</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb787537</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> structure contains information about a scroll bar, including the minimum and maximum scrolling positions, the page size, and the position of the scroll box (the thumb). See the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SCROLLINFO</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> structure topic in the <token>winSDK</token> for more information about changing the structure defaults.</para>
                    <para>The MFC Windows message handlers that indicate scroll-bar position, <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onhscroll">CWnd::OnHScroll</legacyLink> and <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onvscroll">CWnd::OnVScroll</legacyLink>, provide only 16 bits of position data. <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetScrollInfo</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetScrollInfo</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> provide 32 bits of scroll-bar position data. Thus, an application can call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetScrollInfo</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> while processing either <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::OnHScroll</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::OnVScroll</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to obtain 32-bit scroll-bar position data.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getscrolllimit">
        <!--8d0e3d93-5088-46c6-a0cd-f805021fcb30-->
        <title>CWnd::GetScrollLimit</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to retrieve the maximum scrolling position of the scroll bar.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int GetScrollLimit( int nBar );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nBar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the type of scroll bar. The parameter can take one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_HORZ</legacyBold>Retrieves the scroll limit of the horizontal scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_VERT</legacyBold>Retrieves the scroll limit of the vertical scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies the maximum position of a scroll bar if successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getscrollpos">
        <!--f044c7b5-b1d0-4f57-9501-addee9e7eec3-->
        <title>CWnd::GetScrollPos</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the current position of the scroll box of a scroll bar.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int GetScrollPos( int nBar ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nBar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the scroll bar to examine. The parameter can take one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_HORZ</legacyBold>Retrieves the position of the horizontal scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_VERT</legacyBold>Retrieves the position of the vertical scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies the current position of the scroll box in the scroll bar if successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The current position is a relative value that depends on the current scrolling range. For example, if the scrolling range is 50 to 100 and the scroll box is in the middle of the bar, the current position is 75.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getscrollrange">
        <!--42959253-3813-4f7d-9a10-7e32a9729bff-->
        <title>CWnd::GetScrollRange</title>
        <content>
            <para>Copies the current minimum and maximum scroll-bar positions for the given scroll bar to the locations specified by <parameterReference>lpMinPos</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>lpMaxPos</parameterReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void GetScrollRange(
    int nBar,
    LPINT lpMinPos,
    LPINT lpMaxPos ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nBar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the scroll bar to examine. The parameter can take one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_HORZ</legacyBold>Retrieves the position of the horizontal scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_VERT</legacyBold>Retrieves the position of the vertical scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpMinPos</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to the integer variable that is to receive the minimum position.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpMaxPos</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to the integer variable that is to receive the maximum position.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> does not have a scroll bar, then the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetScrollRange</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function copies 0 to <parameterReference>lpMinPos</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>lpMaxPos</parameterReference>. </para>
                    <para>The default range for a standard scroll bar is 0 to 100. The default range for a scroll-bar control is empty (both values are 0).</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getstyle">
        <!--b07ee92f-cd4a-4eb7-9dc2-9736f12d5cdf-->
        <title>CWnd::GetStyle</title>
        <content>
            <para>Returns the current window style.</para>
            <legacySyntax>DWORD GetStyle() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The window's style. For more information about the window styles used in MFC, see <link xlink:href="c85ffbe4-f4ff-4227-917a-48ec4a411842">Window Styles</link>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getsystemmenu">
        <!--af5629b7-f6d2-4857-9620-f135850c1f2e-->
        <title>CWnd::GetSystemMenu</title>
        <content>
            <para>Allows the application to access the Control menu for copying and modification.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CMenu* GetSystemMenu( BOOL bRevert ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bRevert</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the action to be taken. If <parameterReference>bRevert</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetSystemMenu</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> returns a handle to a copy of the Control menu currently in use. This copy is initially identical to the Control menu but can be modified. If <parameterReference>bRevert</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetSystemMenu</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> resets the Control menu back to the default state. The previous, possibly modified, Control menu, if any, is destroyed. The return value is undefined in this case.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies a copy of the Control menu if <parameterReference>bRevert</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>. If <parameterReference>bRevert</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the return value is undefined. </para>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Any window that does not use <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetSystemMenu</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to make its own copy of the Control menu receives the standard Control menu. </para>
                    <para>The pointer returned by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetSystemMenu</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function can be used with the <legacyLink xlink:href="40cacfdc-d45c-4ec7-bf28-991c72812499#cmenu__appendmenu">CMenu::AppendMenu</legacyLink>, <legacyLink xlink:href="40cacfdc-d45c-4ec7-bf28-991c72812499#cmenu__insertmenu">CMenu::InsertMenu</legacyLink>, or <legacyLink xlink:href="40cacfdc-d45c-4ec7-bf28-991c72812499#cmenu__modifymenu">CMenu::ModifyMenu</legacyLink> functions to change the Control menu.</para>
                    <para>The Control menu initially contains items identified with various ID values such as <legacyBold>SC_CLOSE</legacyBold>, <legacyBold>SC_MOVE</legacyBold>, and <legacyBold>SC_SIZE</legacyBold>. Items on the Control menu generate <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onsyscommand">WM_SYSCOMMAND</legacyLink> messages. All predefined Control-menu items have ID numbers greater than 0xF000. If an application adds items to the Control menu, it should use ID numbers less than F000.</para>
                    <para>Windows may automatically make items unavailable on the standard Control menu. <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> can carry out its own selection or unavailability by responding to the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__oninitmenu">WM_INITMENU</legacyLink> messages, which are sent before any menu is displayed.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#99</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__gettitlebarinfo">
        <!--0a56f943-ddc9-49a5-a22b-db21a4b6b743-->
        <title>CWnd::GetTitleBarInfo</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves information about the specified title bar.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL GetTitleBarInfo( PTITLEBARINFO pti ) const;</legacySyntax>

                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>

            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetTitleBarInfo</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633513</linkUri>

    <section address="cwnd__gettoplevelframe">
        <!--c2646ce9-50d3-4806-8b6e-bab7220c9f7d-->
        <title>CWnd::GetTopLevelFrame</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to retrieve the window's top level frame window, if any.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CFrameWnd* GetTopLevelFrame() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the top-level frame window of the window.</para>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> has no attached window, or its top-level parent is not a <legacyLink xlink:href="e2220aba-5bf4-4002-b960-fbcafcad01f1">CFrameWnd</legacyLink>-derived object, this function returns <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__gettoplevelowner">
        <!--7a8e13aa-db3d-43cc-9065-adb05a0856b1-->
        <title>CWnd::GetTopLevelOwner</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to retrieve the top-level window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetTopLevelOwner() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the top-level window. The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The top-level window is the window that is a child of the desktop. If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> has no attached window, this function returns <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__gettoplevelparent">
        <!--3b5e5368-4614-4e6f-9bbd-8a0ae454265f-->
        <title>CWnd::GetTopLevelParent</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to retrieve the window's top-level parent.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetTopLevelParent() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the top-level parent window of the window.</para>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetTopLevelParent</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is similar to <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__gettoplevelframe">GetTopLevelFrame</legacyLink> and <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__gettoplevelowner">GetTopLevelOwner</legacyLink>; however, it ignores the value set as the current owner window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__gettopwindow">
        <!--25da4fe9-a8db-48fc-855e-42f9e52040b4-->
        <title>CWnd::GetTopWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Searches for the top-level child window that belongs to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetTopWindow() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the top-level child window in a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> linked list of child windows. If no child windows exist, the value is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>. </para>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> has no children, this function returns <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getupdaterect">
        <!--7c2d3bd8-9acd-44dc-b35c-2601f710444a-->
        <title>CWnd::GetUpdateRect</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the coordinates of the smallest rectangle that completely encloses the update region.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL GetUpdateRect(
    LPRECT lpRect,
    BOOL bErase = FALSE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object or <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure that is to receive the client coordinates of the update that encloses the update region.</para>
                            <para>Set this parameter to <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> to determine whether an update region exists within the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. If <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetUpdateRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function returns nonzero if an update region exists and 0 if one does not. This provides a way to determine whether a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_PAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message resulted from an invalid area. Do not set this parameter to <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> in Windows version 3.0 and earlier. </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the background in the update region is to be erased.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies the status of the update region. The value is nonzero if the update region is not empty; otherwise 0. </para>
                    <para>If the <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference> parameter is set to <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the return value is nonzero if an update region exists; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> was created with the <legacyBold>CS_OWNDC</legacyBold> style and the mapping mode is not <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>MM_TEXT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetUpdateRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function gives the rectangle in logical coordinates. Otherwise, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetUpdateRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> gives the rectangle in client coordinates. If there is no update region, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetUpdateRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> sets the rectangle to be empty (sets all coordinates to 0).</para>
                    <para>The <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> parameter specifies whether <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetUpdateRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> should erase the background of the update region. If <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> and the update region is not empty, the background is erased. To erase the background, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetUpdateRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> sends the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onerasebkgnd">WM_ERASEBKGND</legacyLink> message. </para>
                    <para>The update rectangle retrieved by the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__beginpaint">BeginPaint</legacyLink> member function is identical to that retrieved by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetUpdateRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function. </para>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BeginPaint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function automatically validates the update region, so any call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetUpdateRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> made immediately after a call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BeginPaint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> retrieves an empty update region.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getupdatergn">
        <!--97c76292-e274-46f2-9ba7-78264d0f9101-->
        <title>CWnd::GetUpdateRgn</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the update region into a region identified by <parameterReference>pRgn</parameterReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int GetUpdateRgn(
    CRgn* pRgn,
    BOOL bErase = FALSE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pRgn</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the update region.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the background will be erased and nonclient areas of child windows will be drawn. If the value is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, no drawing is done.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies a short-integer flag that indicates the type of resulting region. The value can take any one of the following:  </para>
                    <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <legacyBold>SIMPLEREGION</legacyBold>The region has no overlapping borders.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <legacyBold>COMPLEXREGION</legacyBold>The region has overlapping borders.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <legacyBold>NULLREGION</legacyBold>The region is empty.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <legacyBold>ERROR</legacyBold>No region was created.</para>
                        </listItem>
                    </list>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The coordinates of this region are relative to the upper-left corner (client coordinates). </para>
                    <para>The <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__beginpaint">BeginPaint</legacyLink> member function automatically validates the update region, so any call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetUpdateRgn</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> made immediately after a call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>BeginPaint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> retrieves an empty update region.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getwindow">
        <!--383982f3-3687-466b-a849-3b77a7245e1f-->
        <title>CWnd::GetWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Returns a pointer to the window requested, or <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if none. </para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* GetWindow( UINT nCmd ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nCmd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the relationship between <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and the returned window. It can take one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>GW_CHILD</legacyBold>Identifies the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> first child window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>GW_HWNDFIRST</legacyBold>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a child window, returns the first sibling window. Otherwise, it returns the first top-level window in the list.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>GW_HWNDLAST</legacyBold>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a child window, returns the last sibling window. Otherwise, it returns the last top-level window in the list.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>GW_HWNDNEXT</legacyBold>Returns the next window on the window manager's list.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>GW_HWNDPREV</legacyBold>Returns the previous window on the window manager's list.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>GW_OWNER</legacyBold>Identifies the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> owner.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getwindowcontexthelpid">
        <!--f7d399ce-398a-4274-861e-61ba61dac771-->
        <title>CWnd::GetWindowContextHelpId</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to retrieve the help context identifier, if any, associated with the window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>DWORD GetWindowContextHelpId() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>

    <section address="cwnd__getwindowedchildcount">
        <!--8e356465-9dd3-4386-8fdf-1dfdc9cd2677-->
        <title>CWnd::GetWindowedChildCount</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to retrieve the number of associated child windows.</para>
            <legacySyntax>long GetWindowedChildCount();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The number of child windows associated with the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getwindowdc">
        <!--5f27e471-7e81-4f72-bcda-d9cda846155f-->
        <title>CWnd::GetWindowDC</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the display context for the entire window, including caption bar, menus, and scroll bars.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CDC* GetWindowDC();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Identifies the display context for the given window if the function is successful; otherwise <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>. </para>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use. <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__releasedc">ReleaseDC</legacyLink> should be called once for each successful call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetWindowDC</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A window display context permits painting anywhere in <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, since the origin of the context is the upper-left corner of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> instead of the client area. </para>
                    <para>Default attributes are assigned to the display context each time it retrieves the context. Previous attributes are lost. </para>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetWindowDC</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is intended to be used for special painting effects within the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> nonclient area. Painting in nonclient areas of any window is not recommended.</para>
                    <para>The                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetSystemMetrics</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms724385</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows function can be used to retrieve the dimensions of various parts of the nonclient area, such as the caption bar, menu, and scroll bars. </para>
                    <para>After painting is complete, the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__releasedc">ReleaseDC</legacyLink> member function must be called to release the display context. Failure to release the display context will seriously affect painting requested by applications due to limitations on the number of device contexts that can be open at the same time.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getwindowinfo">
        <!--bf202a8d-5f0a-450d-92c4-46426aeef7e1-->
        <title>CWnd::GetWindowInfo</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves information about the window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL GetWindowInfo( PWINDOWINFO pwi ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pwi</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a                                 <externalLink> <linkText>WINDOWINFO</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632610</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> structure.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetWindowInfo</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633516</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getwindowlesschildcount">

        <title>CWnd::GetWindowlessChildCount</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the number of associated windowless child windows.</para>

        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The number of windowless child windows associated with the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
                </content>

    <section address="cwnd__getwindowplacement">
        <!--bffdfc1f-daea-46ca-b484-dc4fbd8caf07-->
        <title>CWnd::GetWindowPlacement</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the show state and the normal (restored), minimized, and maximized positions of a window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL GetWindowPlacement( WINDOWPLACEMENT* lpwndpl ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpwndpl</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WINDOWPLACEMENT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> structure that receives the show state and position information.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function is successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <legacyBold>flags</legacyBold> member of the <legacyLink xlink:href="ea7d61f6-eb57-478e-9b08-7c1d07091aa8">WINDOWPLACEMENT</legacyLink> structure retrieved by this function is always 0. If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is maximized, the <legacyBold>showCmd</legacyBold> member of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WINDOWPLACEMENT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is <legacyBold>SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED</legacyBold>. If the window is minimized, it is <legacyBold>SW_SHOWMINIMIZED.</legacyBold> It is <legacyBold>SW_SHOWNORMAL</legacyBold> otherwise.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getwindowrect">
        <!--4db98c6a-52da-48f9-b3fe-04592f99f12e-->
        <title>CWnd::GetWindowRect</title>
        <content>
            <para>Copies the dimensions of the bounding rectangle of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object to the structure pointed to by <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void GetWindowRect( LPRECT lpRect ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object or a <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure that will receive the screen coordinates of the upper-left and lower-right corners.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The dimensions are given in screen coordinates relative to the upper-left corner of the display screen. The dimensions of the caption, border, and scroll bars, if present, are included.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getwindowrgn">
        <!--b981d5ee-f1d1-4334-8c59-9ff37610f3e3-->
        <title>CWnd::GetWindowRgn</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to get the window region of a window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int GetWindowRgn( HRGN hRgn )const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>hRgn</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A handle to a window region.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The return value specifies the type of the region that the function obtains. It can be one of the following values:   </para>
                    <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <legacyBold>NULLREGION</legacyBold>The region is empty. </para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <legacyBold>SIMPLEREGION</legacyBold>The region is a single rectangle. </para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <legacyBold>COMPLEXREGION</legacyBold>The region is more than one rectangle. </para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <legacyBold>ERROR</legacyBold>An error occurred; the region is unaffected. </para>
                        </listItem>
                    </list>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The window region determines the area within the window where the operating system permits drawing. The operating system does not display any portion of a window that lies outside of the window region.</para>
                    <para>The coordinates of a window's window region are relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area of the window. </para>
                    <para>To set the window region of a window, call <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__setwindowrgn">CWnd::SetWindowRgn</legacyLink>. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getwindowtext">
        <!--22106e9d-9925-4a96-b2f9-e7d95c5cd2a3-->
        <title>CWnd::GetWindowText</title>
        <content>
            <para>Copies the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> caption title (if it has one) into the buffer pointed to by <parameterReference>lpszStringBuf</parameterReference> or into the destination string <parameterReference>rString</parameterReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int GetWindowText(
    LPTSTR lpszStringBuf,
    int nMaxCount ) const;

void GetWindowText(
    CString&amp; rString ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpszStringBuf</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to the buffer that is to receive the copied string of the window's title.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nMaxCount</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the maximum number of characters to be copied to the buffer, including the terminating null character. If the string is longer than the number of characters specified in <parameterReference>nMaxCount</parameterReference>, it is truncated.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>rString</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A <legacyLink xlink:href="7cacc59c-425f-40f1-8f5b-6db921318ec9">CString</legacyLink> object that is to receive the copied string of the window's title.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies the length, in characters, of the copied string, not including the terminating null character. It is 0 if <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> has no caption or if the caption is empty.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is a control, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetWindowText</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function copies the text within the control instead of copying the caption. </para>
                    <para>This member function causes the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_GETTEXT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632627</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message to be sent to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__setwindowtext">CWnd::SetWindowText</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__getwindowtextlength">
        <!--58bd832b-b1da-488b-9bd0-d9981970f2ca-->
        <title>CWnd::GetWindowTextLength</title>
        <content>
            <para>Returns the length of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object caption title.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int GetWindowTextLength() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies the text length in characters, not including any null-termination character. The value is 0 if no such text exists.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a control, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetWindowTextLength</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function returns the length of the text within the control instead of the caption. </para>
                    <para>This member function causes the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_GETTEXTLENGTH</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632628</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message to be sent to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__setwindowtext">CWnd::SetWindowText</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__hidecaret">
        <!--baf88432-59da-46d8-90fa-f20c715453d6-->
        <title>CWnd::HideCaret</title>
        <content>
            <para>Hides the caret by removing it from the display screen.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void HideCaret();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Although the caret is no longer visible, it can be displayed again by using the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__showcaret">ShowCaret</legacyLink> member function. Hiding the caret does not destroy its current shape. </para>
                    <para>Hiding is cumulative. If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>HideCaret</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> has been called five times in a row, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ShowCaret</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function must be called five times before the caret will be shown.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__hilitemenuitem">
        <!--a07411af-437a-4ecc-b578-b7fe164fe47f-->
        <title>CWnd::HiliteMenuItem</title>
        <content>
            <para>Highlights or removes the highlight from a top-level (menu-bar) menu item.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL HiliteMenuItem(
    CMenu* pMenu,
    UINT nIDHiliteItem,
    UINT nHilite );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pMenu</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the top-level menu that contains the item to be highlighted.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDHiliteItem</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the menu item to be highlighted, depending on the value of the <parameterReference>nHilite</parameterReference> parameter.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nHilite</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the menu item is highlighted or the highlight is removed. It can be a combination of <legacyBold>MF_HILITE</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>MF_UNHILITE</legacyBold> with <legacyBold>MF_BYCOMMAND</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>MF_BYPOSITION</legacyBold>. The values can be combined using the bitwise OR operator. These values have the following meanings:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>MF_BYCOMMAND</legacyBold>Interprets <parameterReference>nIDHiliteItem</parameterReference> as the menu-item ID (the default interpretation).</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>MF_BYPOSITION</legacyBold>Interprets <parameterReference>nIDHiliteItem</parameterReference> as the zero-based offset of the menu item.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>MF_HILITE</legacyBold>Highlights the item. If this value is not given, the highlight is removed from the item.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>MF_UNHILITE</legacyBold>Removes the highlight from the item.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies whether the menu item was highlighted. Nonzero if the item was highlighted; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <legacyBold>MF_HILITE</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>MF_UNHILITE</legacyBold> flags can be used only with this member function; they cannot be used with the <legacyLink xlink:href="40cacfdc-d45c-4ec7-bf28-991c72812499#cmenu__modifymenu">CMenu::ModifyMenu</legacyLink> member function.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__htmlhelp">
        <!--79f214fa-116b-43b8-adb4-a0fdfcb38ac5-->
        <title>CWnd::HtmlHelp</title>

                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwData</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>

                        <definition>

For a list of possible values and how they affect the <parameterReference>dwData</parameterReference> parameter, see the <parameterReference>uCommand</parameterReference> parameter described in the <legacyLink xlink:href="vsconovhtmlhelpapioverview">HTMLHelp API Reference</legacyLink> in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>

                    <para>See <legacyLink xlink:href="e426a3cd-0d15-40d6-bd55-beaa5feb2343#cwinapp__htmlhelp">CWinApp::HtmlHelp</legacyLink> for more information.</para>

    <section address="cwnd__initdynamiclayout">
