        <title>CWnd::InitDynamicLayout</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called by the framework to initialize dynamic layout for a window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void InitDynamicLayout();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Do not call this method directly.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__invalidate">
        <!--104a3e69-ef04-480f-bead-55617f284afb-->
        <title>CWnd::Invalidate</title>
        <content>
            <para>Invalidates the entire client area of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void Invalidate( BOOL bErase = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the background within the update region is to be erased.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The client area is marked for painting when the next <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onpaint">WM_PAINT</legacyLink> message occurs. The region can also be validated before a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_PAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message occurs by the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__validaterect">ValidateRect</legacyLink> or <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__validatergn">ValidateRgn</legacyLink> member function.</para>
                    <para>The <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> parameter specifies whether the background within the update area is to be erased when the update region is processed. If <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the background is erased when the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__beginpaint">BeginPaint</legacyLink> member function is called; if <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, the background remains unchanged. If <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> for any part of the update region, the background in the entire region, not just in the given part, is erased. </para>
                    <para>Windows sends a <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onpaint">WM_PAINT</legacyLink> message whenever the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> update region is not empty and there are no other messages in the application queue for that window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__updatewindow">CWnd::UpdateWindow</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__invalidaterect">
        <!--d7b0dec5-b92d-40f9-acc2-2455d747ea18-->
        <title>CWnd::InvalidateRect</title>
        <content>
            <para>Invalidates the client area within the given rectangle by adding that rectangle to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> update region.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void InvalidateRect(
    LPCRECT lpRect,
    BOOL bErase = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object or a <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure that contains the rectangle (in client coordinates) to be added to the update region. If <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the entire client area is added to the region.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the background within the update region is to be erased.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The invalidated rectangle, along with all other areas in the update region, is marked for painting when the next <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onpaint">WM_PAINT</legacyLink> message is sent. The invalidated areas accumulate in the update region until the region is processed when the next <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_PAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> call occurs, or until the region is validated by the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__validaterect">ValidateRect</legacyLink> or <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__validatergn">ValidateRgn</legacyLink> member function.</para>
                    <para>The <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> parameter specifies whether the background within the update area is to be erased when the update region is processed. If <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the background is erased when the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__beginpaint">BeginPaint</legacyLink> member function is called; if <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, the background remains unchanged. If <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> for any part of the update region, the background in the entire region is erased, not just in the given part. </para>
                    <para>Windows sends a <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onpaint">WM_PAINT</legacyLink> message whenever the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> update region is not empty and there are no other messages in the application queue for that window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__invalidatergn">
        <!--e71c7d35-d96c-4b66-bb45-8cdc68abba9d-->
        <title>CWnd::InvalidateRgn</title>
        <content>
            <para>Invalidates the client area within the given region by adding it to the current update region of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void InvalidateRgn(
    CRgn* pRgn,
    BOOL bErase = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pRgn</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a <legacyLink xlink:href="d904da84-76aa-481e-8780-b09485f49e64">CRgn</legacyLink> object that identifies the region to be added to the update region. The region is assumed to have client coordinates. If this parameter is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the entire client area is added to the update region.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the background within the update region is to be erased.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The invalidated region, along with all other areas in the update region, is marked for painting when the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onpaint">WM_PAINT</legacyLink> message is next sent. The invalidated areas accumulate in the update region until the region is processed when a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_PAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message is next sent, or until the region is validated by the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__validaterect">ValidateRect</legacyLink> or <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__validatergn">ValidateRgn</legacyLink> member function.</para>
                    <para>The <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> parameter specifies whether the background within the update area is to be erased when the update region is processed. If <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the background is erased when the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__beginpaint">BeginPaint</legacyLink> member function is called; if <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, the background remains unchanged. If <parameterReference>bErase</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> for any part of the update region, the background in the entire region, not just in the given part, is erased. </para>
                    <para>Windows sends a <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onpaint">WM_PAINT</legacyLink> message whenever the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> update region is not empty and there are no other messages in the application queue for that window. </para>
                    <para>The given region must have been previously created by one of the region functions.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__invokehelper">
        <!--1a4dcbfc-9e22-4c58-afc4-b46e425d4278-->
        <title>CWnd::InvokeHelper</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to invoke the ActiveX Control method or property specified by <parameterReference>dwDispID</parameterReference>, in the context specified by <parameterReference>wFlags</parameterReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void AFX_CDECL InvokeHelper(
    DISPID dwDispID,
    WORD wFlags,
    VARTYPE vtRet,
    void* pvRet,
    const BYTE* pbParamInfo,
    ...  );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwDispID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the method or property to be invoked.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>wFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Flags describing the context of the call to <legacyBold>IDispatch::Invoke</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>vtRet</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the type of the return value. For possible values, see the Remarks section for <legacyLink xlink:href="3ed98daf-cdc7-4374-8a0c-cf695a8d3657#coledispatchdriver__invokehelper">COleDispatchDriver::InvokeHelper</legacyLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pvRet</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Address of the variable that will that will receive the property value or return value. It must match the type specified by <parameterReference>vtRet</parameterReference>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pbParamInfo</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a null-terminated string of bytes specifying the types of the parameters following <parameterReference>pbParamInfo</parameterReference>. For possible values, see the Remarks section for <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>COleDispatchDriver::InvokeHelper</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>...</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Variable List of parameters, of types specified in <parameterReference>pbParamInfo</parameterReference>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <parameterReference>pbParamInfo</parameterReference> parameter specifies the types of the parameters passed to the method or property. The variable list of arguments is represented by                         <legacyItalic>...</legacyItalic> in the syntax declaration.</para>
                    <para>This function converts the parameters to <legacyBold>VARIANTARG</legacyBold> values, then invokes the <legacyBold>IDispatch::Invoke</legacyBold> method on the ActiveX control. If the call to <legacyBold>IDispatch::Invoke</legacyBold> fails, this function will throw an exception. If the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SCODE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> (status code) returned by <legacyBold>IDispatch::Invoke</legacyBold> is <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DISP_E_EXCEPTION</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, this function throws a <legacyLink xlink:href="2571e9fe-26cc-42f0-9ad9-8ad5b4311ec1">COleException</legacyLink> object, otherwise it throws a <legacyLink xlink:href="0e95c8be-e21a-490c-99ec-181c6a9a26d0">COleDispatchException</legacyLink>.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This function should be called only on a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object that represents an ActiveX control.</para>
                    </alert>
                    <para>For more information about using this member function with ActiveX Control Containers, see the article <legacyLink xlink:href="ef9b2480-92d6-4191-b16e-8055c4fd7b73">ActiveX Control Containers: Programming ActiveX Controls in an ActiveX Control Container</legacyLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__ischild">
        <!--c02e4a30-446d-433d-a03f-64239bf1f8cd-->
        <title>CWnd::IsChild</title>
        <content>
            <para>Indicates whether the window specified by <parameterReference>pWnd</parameterReference> is a child window or other direct descendant of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL IsChild( const CWnd* pWnd ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pWnd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the window to be tested.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies the outcome of the function. The value is nonzero if the window identified by <parameterReference>pWnd</parameterReference> is a child window of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A child window is the direct descendant of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> if the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is in the chain of parent windows that leads from the original pop-up window to the child window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>

    <section address="cwnd__isdialogmessage">
        <!--4f68f1eb-c727-4869-8cac-d19bcfa9a934-->
        <title>CWnd::IsDialogMessage</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to determine whether the given message is intended for a modeless dialog box; if it is, this function processes the message.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL IsDialogMessage( LPMSG lpMsg );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpMsg</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to an <legacyLink xlink:href="dc166d27-9423-41f1-9599-5ba76d2f0138">MSG</legacyLink> structure that contains the message to be checked.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies whether the member function has processed the given message. It is nonzero if the message has been processed; otherwise 0. If the return is 0, call the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__pretranslatemessage">CWnd::PreTranslateMessage</legacyLink> member function of the base class to process the message. In an override of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::PreTranslateMessage</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function the code looks like this :</para>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#100</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>When the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>IsDialogMessage</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> function processes a message, it checks for keyboard messages and converts them to selection commands for the corresponding dialog box. For example, the TAB key selects the next control or group of controls, and the DOWN ARROW key selects the next control in a group.</para>
                    <para>You must not pass a message processed by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>IsDialogMessage</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to the                         <externalLink> <linkText>TranslateMessage</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms644955</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> or                         <externalLink> <linkText>DispatchMessage</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms644934</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows functions, because it has already been processed.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__isdlgbuttonchecked">
        <!--fc050eae-2ca9-4be6-9a49-2f8dd3cbfde0-->
        <title>CWnd::IsDlgButtonChecked</title>
        <content>
            <para>Determines whether a button control has a check mark next to it.</para>
            <legacySyntax>UINT IsDlgButtonChecked( int nIDButton ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDButton</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the integer identifier of the button control.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the given control is checked, and 0 if it is not checked. Only radio buttons and check boxes can be checked. For three-state buttons, the return value can be 2 if the button is indeterminate. This member function returns 0 for a pushbutton.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the button is a three-state control, the member function determines whether it is dimmed, checked, or neither.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>

    <section address="cwnd__iswindowvisible">
        <!--5fdec4fd-ffcc-4c9f-b2c8-83c906b25385-->
        <title>CWnd::IsWindowVisible</title>
        <content>
            <para>Determines the visibility state of the given window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL IsWindowVisible() const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is visible (has the <legacyLink xlink:href="c85ffbe4-f4ff-4227-917a-48ec4a411842">WS_VISIBLE</legacyLink> style bit set, and parent window is visible). Because the return value reflects the state of the <legacyBold>WS_VISIBLE</legacyBold> style bit, the return value may be nonzero even though <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is totally obscured by other windows.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A window possesses a visibility state indicated by the <legacyBold>WS_VISIBLE</legacyBold> style bit. When this style bit is set with a call to the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__showwindow">ShowWindow</legacyLink> member function, the window is displayed and subsequent drawing to the window is displayed as long as the window has the style bit set.</para>
                    <para>Any drawing to a window that has the <legacyBold>WS_VISIBLE</legacyBold> style will not be displayed if the window is covered by other windows or is clipped by its parent window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#103</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>

        <title>CWnd::KillTimer</title>
        <content>
            <para>Kills the timer event identified by <parameterReference>nIDEvent</parameterReference> from the earlier call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetTimer</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL KillTimer( UINT_PTR nIDEvent );</legacySyntax>
        </content>

                <content>

                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies the outcome of the function. The value is nonzero if the event was killed. It is 0 if the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>KillTimer</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function could not find the specified timer event.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Pending <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__ontimer">WM_TIMER</legacyLink> messages associated with the timer are not removed from the message queue.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__settimer">CWnd::SetTimer</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>

            <legacySyntax>BOOL LoadDynamicLayoutResource( LPCTSTR lpszResourceName );</legacySyntax>

    <section address="cwnd__lockwindowupdate">
        <!--3aab9646-61b3-4702-902d-03a49db7cad3-->
        <title>CWnd::LockWindowUpdate</title>
        <content>
            <para>Disables drawing in the given window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL LockWindowUpdate();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function is successful. It is 0 if a failure occurs or if the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>LockWindowUpdate</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> function has been used to lock another window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A locked window cannot be moved. Only one window can be locked at a time. To unlock a window locked with <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>LockWindowUpdate</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, call <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__unlockwindowupdate">UnlockWindowUpdate</legacyLink>.</para>
                    <para>If an application with a locked window (or any locked child windows) calls the                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetDC,</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd144871</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>                        <externalLink> <linkText>GetDCEx,</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd144873</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> or                         <externalLink> <linkText>BeginPaint</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd183362</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows function, the called function returns a device context whose visible region is empty. This will occur until the application unlocks the window by calling the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>UnlockWindowUpdate</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function.</para>
                    <para>While window updates are locked, the system keeps track of the bounding rectangle of any drawing operations to device contexts associated with a locked window. When drawing is reenabled, this bounding rectangle is invalidated in the locked window and its child windows to force an eventual                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_PAINT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145213</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message to update the screen. If no drawing has occurred while the window updates were locked, no area is invalidated.</para>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>LockWindowUpdate</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function does not make the given window invisible and does not clear the <legacyLink xlink:href="c85ffbe4-f4ff-4227-917a-48ec4a411842">WS_VISIBLE</legacyLink> style bit. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
