    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__mapwindowpoints">
        <!--567c017e-1137-4773-aa67-5f82574ba72d-->
        <title>CWnd::MapWindowPoints</title>
        <content>
            <para>Converts (maps) a set of points from the coordinate space of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to the coordinate space of another window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void MapWindowPoints(
    CWnd* pwndTo,
    LPRECT lpRect ) const;

void MapWindowPoints(
    CWnd* pwndTo,
    LPPOINT lpPoint,
    UINT nCount ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pwndTo</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the window to which points are converted. If this parameter is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the points are converted to screen coordinates.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the rectangle whose points are to be converted. The first version of this function is available only for Windows 3.1 and later.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpPoint</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to an array of <legacyLink xlink:href="965736d8-4e53-41b6-9b8b-6961992dd21f">POINT</legacyLink> structures that contain the set of points to be converted.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nCount</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the number of <legacyBold>POINT</legacyBold> structures in the array pointed to by <parameterReference>lpPoint</parameterReference>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__messagebox">
        <!--b1da4bb3-6f44-44ff-ab72-50de84bfbf59-->
        <title>CWnd::MessageBox</title>
        <content>
            <para>Creates and displays a window that contains an application-supplied message and caption, plus a combination of the predefined icons and pushbuttons described in the <legacyLink xlink:href="d87014c5-4ea4-4950-a27e-7bcdda67be7d">Message-Box Styles</legacyLink> list.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int MessageBox(
    LPCTSTR lpszText,
    LPCTSTR lpszCaption = NULL,
    UINT nType = MB_OK );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpszText</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CString</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object or null-terminated string containing the message to be displayed.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpszCaption</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CString</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object or null-terminated string to be used for the message-box caption. If <parameterReference>lpszCaption</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the default caption "Error" is used.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nType</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the contents and behavior of the message box.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This method utilizes the                         <externalLink> <linkText>MessageBox</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms645505</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> function as defined in the <token>winSDK</token>. This method returns the result of calling this function.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Use the global function <legacyLink xlink:href="d66d0328-cdcc-48f6-96a4-badf089099c8">AfxMessageBox</legacyLink> instead of this member function to implement a message box in your application.</para>
                    <para>The following shows the various system icons that can be used in a message box:</para>
                    <table xmlns:caps="http://schemas.microsoft.com/build/caps/2013/11">
                        <tbody>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <mediaLink>
                                        <image xlink:href="8d3589a8-a074-48cb-ab39-90fd21c1d9c6"/>
                                    </mediaLink>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>MB_ICONHAND</legacyBold>, <legacyBold>MB_ICONSTOP</legacyBold>, and <legacyBold>MB_ICONERROR</legacyBold>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <mediaLink>
                                        <image xlink:href="a0115b6c-8665-4cbb-a238-f836258c0ae0"/>
                                    </mediaLink>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>MB_ICONQUESTION</legacyBold>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <mediaLink>
                                        <image xlink:href="647b265e-e43b-4ad5-8c8a-9dcfbe9619d0"/>
                                    </mediaLink>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>MB_ICONEXCLAMATION</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>MB_ICONWARNING</legacyBold>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <mediaLink>
                                        <image xlink:href="c521dacf-e82e-4d34-9915-9463be19394f"/>
                                    </mediaLink>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>MB_ICONASTERISK</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>MB_ICONINFORMATION</legacyBold>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                        </tbody>
                    </table>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#104</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__modifystyle">
        <!--5b6c28bd-ec51-45c4-b7fe-a8ae522f9ba8-->
        <title>CWnd::ModifyStyle</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to modify a window's style.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL ModifyStyle(
    DWORD dwRemove,
    DWORD dwAdd,
    UINT nFlags = 0  );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwRemove</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies window styles to be removed during style modification.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwAdd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies window styles to be added during style modification.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Flags to be passed to <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__setwindowpos">SetWindowPos</legacyLink>, or zero if <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetWindowPos</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> should not be called. The default is zero. See the Remarks section for a list of preset flags.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if style was successfully modified; otherwise, 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Styles to be added or removed can be combined by using the bitwise OR (|) operator. See the topics                         <externalLink> <linkText>Window Styles</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632600</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> and                         <externalLink> <linkText>CreateWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632679</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> in the <token>winSDK</token> for information about the available window styles.</para>
                    <para>If <parameterReference>nFlags</parameterReference> is nonzero, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ModifyStyle</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> calls the Windows API function                         <externalLink> <linkText>SetWindowPos</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633545</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> and redraws the window by combining <parameterReference>nFlags</parameterReference> with the following four preset flags:   </para>
                    <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOSIZE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Retains the current size.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOMOVE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Retains the current position.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOZORDER</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Retains the current Z order.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOACTIVATE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Does not activate the window.</para>
                        </listItem>
                    </list>
                    <para>To modify a window's extended styles, see <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__modifystyleex">ModifyStyleEx</legacyLink>.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>For some styles in certain controls (the <legacyBold>ES_READONLY </legacyBold>style in the edit control, for example), <legacyBold>ModifyStyle </legacyBold>may not properly change the style because the control may need to perform special internal processing. In these cases, a corresponding message to change the style will be available ( <legacyBold>EM_SETREADONLY </legacyBold>in the example mentioned).</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#105</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__modifystyleex">
        <!--24e7490e-80b0-45ee-b025-7335750f8085-->
        <title>CWnd::ModifyStyleEx</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to modify a window's extended style.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL ModifyStyleEx(
    DWORD dwRemove,
    DWORD dwAdd,
    UINT nFlags = 0  );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwRemove</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies extended styles to be removed during style modification.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwAdd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies extended styles to be added during style modification.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Flags to be passed to <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__setwindowpos">SetWindowPos</legacyLink>, or zero if <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetWindowPos</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> should not be called. The default is zero. See the Remarks section for a list of preset flags.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if style was successfully modified; otherwise, 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Styles to be added or removed can be combined by using the bitwise OR (|) operator. See the topics <legacyLink xlink:href="d18e6c69-0a01-49ed-b58a-55b3802b47c1">Extended Window Styles</legacyLink> in this book and                         <externalLink> <linkText>CreateWindowEx</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632680</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> in the <token>winSDK</token> for information about the available extended styles</para>
                    <para>If <parameterReference>nFlags</parameterReference> is nonzero, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ModifyStyleEx</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> calls the Windows API function                         <externalLink> <linkText>SetWindowPos</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633545</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> and redraws the window by combining <parameterReference>nFlags</parameterReference> with the following four preset flags:   </para>
                    <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOSIZE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Retains the current size.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOMOVE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Retains the current position.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOZORDER</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Retains the current Z order.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOACTIVATE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Does not activate the window.</para>
                        </listItem>
                    </list>
                    <para>To modify windows using regular window styles, see <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__modifystyle">ModifyStyle</legacyLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#106</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__movewindow">
        <!--1b644e6d-ed92-421f-b8e6-ab95d35f8e51-->
        <title>CWnd::MoveWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Changes the position and dimensions.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void MoveWindow(
    int x,
    int y,
    int nWidth,
    int nHeight,
    BOOL bRepaint = TRUE );

void MoveWindow(
    LPCRECT lpRect, BOOL bRepaint = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>x</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the new position of the left side of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>y</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the new position of the top of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nWidth</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the new width of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nHeight</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the new height of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bRepaint</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is to be repainted. If <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> receives a                                 <externalLink> <linkText>WM_PAINT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145213</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> message in its <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onpaint">OnPaint</legacyLink> message handler as usual. If this parameter is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, to the nonclient area (including the title and scroll bars), and to any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>'s move. When this parameter is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and parent window that must be redrawn.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The <legacyLink xlink:href="dee4e752-15d6-4db4-b68f-1ad65b2ed6ca">CRect</legacyLink> object or <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure that specifies the new size and position.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>For a top-level <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object, the                         <legacyItalic>x</legacyItalic> and                         <legacyItalic>y</legacyItalic> parameters are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen. For a child <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object, they are relative to the upper-left corner of the parent window's client area. </para>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>MoveWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> function sends the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__ongetminmaxinfo">WM_GETMINMAXINFO</legacyLink> message. Handling this message gives <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> the opportunity to modify the default values for the largest and smallest possible windows. If the parameters to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>MoveWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function exceed these values, the values can be replaced by the minimum or maximum values in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_GETMINMAXINFO</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> handler.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__clienttoscreen">CWnd::ClientToScreen</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__notifywinevent">
        <!--fa47b2dd-2705-43ce-90f7-9a6ea8a3290a-->
        <title>CWnd::NotifyWinEvent</title>
        <content>
            <para>Signals the system that a predefined event occurred. If any client applications have registered a hook function for the event, the system calls the client's hook function.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void NotifyWinEvent(
    DWORD event,
    LONG idObjectType,
    LONG idObject );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>event</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the event that occurred. This value must be one of the                                 <externalLink> <linkText>event constants</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd318066</linkUri>
                                </externalLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>idObjectType</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the kind of object that generated the event. This value is one of the predefined                                 <externalLink> <linkText>object identifiers</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd373606</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> or a custom object ID value.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>idObject</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies whether the event was generated by an object or a child element of the object. If this value is <legacyBold>CHILDID_SELF</legacyBold>, the event was generated by the object itself. If not, this value is the child ID of the element that generated the event.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>NotifyWinEvent</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd373603</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onactivate">
        <!--18191cc7-73c4-4546-b572-c3b280c9788d-->
        <title>CWnd::OnActivate</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function when a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is being activated or deactivated.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnActivate(
    UINT nState,
    CWnd* pWndOther,
    BOOL bMinimized );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nState</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is being activated or deactivated. It can be one of the following values: </para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>WA_INACTIVE</legacyBold>The window is being deactivated. </para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>WA_ACTIVE</legacyBold>The window is being activated through some method other than a mouse click (for example, by use of the keyboard interface to select the window). </para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>WA_CLICKACTIVE</legacyBold>The window is being activated by a mouse click. </para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pWndOther</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> being activated or deactivated. The pointer can be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, and it may be temporary.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>bMinimized</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the minimized state of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> being activated or deactivated. A value of <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> indicates the window is minimized. </para>
                            <para>If <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is being activated; otherwise deactivated. </para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is activated with a mouse click, it will also receive an <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onmouseactivate">OnMouseActivate</legacyLink> member function call.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onactivateapp">
        <!--ba569282-c3d7-48f3-9e34-5a8a7386fe10-->
        <title>CWnd::OnActivateApp</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function to all top-level windows of the task being activated and for all top-level windows of the task being deactivated.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnActivateApp(
    BOOL bActive,
    DWORD dwThreadID );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bActive</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is being activated or deactivated. <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> means the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is being activated. <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold> means the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is being deactivated.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>dwThreadID</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the value of the thread ID. If <parameterReference>bActive</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>,                                 <legacyItalic>dwThreadID</legacyItalic> identifies the thread that owns the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> being deactivated. If <parameterReference>bActive</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>,                                 <legacyItalic>dwThreadID</legacyItalic> identifies the thread that owns the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> being activated.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onambientproperty">
        <!--333ce640-167a-4bc9-bb75-9f35115490f4-->
        <title>CWnd::OnAmbientProperty</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function to obtain ambient property values from a window that contains OLE controls.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual BOOL OnAmbientProperty(
    COleControlSite* pSite,
    DISPID dispid,
    VARIANT* pvar );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pSite</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to the site of the control that requested the ambient property.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dispid</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The dispatch ID of the requested ambient property.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pvar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a caller-allocated <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>VARIANT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> structure, through which the ambient property's value will be returned.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> if the ambient property is supported; <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold> if not.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Override this function to alter the default ambient property values returned by an OLE control container to its controls. Any ambient property requests not handled by an overriding function should be forwarded to the base class implementation.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onappcommand">
        <!--d5a02b29-0baa-40d6-9f98-60117fe0e6c6-->
        <title>CWnd::OnAppCommand</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function when the user generates an application command event. Such an event occurs when the user clicks an application command button or types an application command key.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnAppCommand(
    CWnd* pWnd,
    UINT nCmd,
    UINT nDevice,
    UINT nKey );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <table xmlns:caps="http://schemas.microsoft.com/build/caps/2013/11">
                        <thead>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Parameter</para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Description</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                        </thead>
                        <tbody>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>[in] <parameterReference>pWnd</parameterReference>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Pointer to a <legacyLink xlink:href="49a832ee-bc34-4126-88b3-bc1d9974f6c4">CWnd</legacyLink> object that represents the window where the user clicked the comman button or pressed the command key. This window can be a child window of the window receiving the message. </para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>[in] <parameterReference>nCmd</parameterReference>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Indicates the application command. For a list of possible values, see the commands under the                                         <placeholder>cmd</placeholder> section of the <codeInline>lParam</codeInline> parameter of                                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_APPCOMMAND</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646275</linkUri>
                                        </externalLink>.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>[in] <parameterReference>nDevice</parameterReference>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>The input device that generated the input event. For a list of possible values, see the devices under the                                         <placeholder>uDevice</placeholder> section of the <codeInline>lParam</codeInline> parameter of                                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_APPCOMMAND</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646275</linkUri>
                                        </externalLink>.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>[in] <parameterReference>nKey</parameterReference>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Indicates any virtual keys that are down, such as the CTRL key or the left mouse button. For a list of possible values, see the keys under the                                         <placeholder>dwKeys</placeholder> section of the <codeInline>lParam</codeInline> parameter of                                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_APPCOMMAND</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646275</linkUri>
                                        </externalLink>. For more information, see the "Message Parameters" subheading in                                         <externalLink> <linkText>About Mouse Input</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms645601</linkUri>
                                        </externalLink>.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                        </tbody>
                    </table>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This method receives the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_APPCOMMAND</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646275</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> notification, which is described in the <token>winSDK</token>. </para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onaskcbformatname">
        <!--9185673a-3bb9-45c4-a6c9-9249ec5c230f-->
        <title>CWnd::OnAskCbFormatName</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function when the Clipboard contains a data handle for the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CF_OWNERDISPLAY</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> format (that is, when the Clipboard owner will display the Clipboard contents).</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnAskCbFormatName(
    UINT nMaxCount,
    LPTSTR lpszString );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nMaxCount</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the maximum number of bytes to copy.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpszString</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to the buffer where the copy of the format name is to be stored.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The Clipboard owner should provide a name for its format. </para>
                    <para>Override this member function and copy the name of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CF_OWNERDISPLAY</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> format into the specified buffer, not exceeding the maximum number of bytes specified.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__oncancelmode">
        <!--c2686960-7fa5-4ebc-af39-e76e8253a1fe-->
        <title>CWnd::OnCancelMode</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function to inform <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to cancel any internal mode.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnCancelMode();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object has the focus, its <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnCancelMode</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function is called when a dialog box or message box is displayed. This gives the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> the opportunity to cancel modes such as mouse capture.</para>
                    <para>The default implementation responds by calling the                         <externalLink> <linkText>ReleaseCapture</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646261</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows function. Override this member function in your derived class to handle other modes.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__oncapturechanged">
        <!--e968d2c8-d887-49d0-8245-3a335706511a-->
        <title>CWnd::OnCaptureChanged</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function to notify the window that is losing the mouse capture.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnCaptureChanged( CWnd* pWnd );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pWnd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to the window to gain mouse capture</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A window receives this message even if it calls                         <externalLink> <linkText>ReleaseCapture</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646261</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> itself. An application should not attempt to set the mouse capture in response to this message. When it receives this message, a window should redraw itself, if necessary, to reflect the new mouse-capture state. </para>
                    <para>See the <token>winSDK</token> for information on the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ReleaseCapture</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> Windows function.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onchangecbchain">
        <!--592f8b30-cddb-4619-9cec-fc322333383e-->
        <title>CWnd::OnChangeCbChain</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function for each window in the Clipboard-viewer chain to notify it that a window is being removed from the chain.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnChangeCbChain(
    HWND hWndRemove,
    HWND hWndAfter );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>hWndRemove</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the window handle that is being removed from the Clipboard-viewer chain.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>hWndAfter</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the window handle that follows the window being removed from the Clipboard-viewer chain.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Each <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object that receives an <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnChangeCbChain</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> call should use the                         <externalLink> <linkText>SendMessage</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms644950</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows function to send the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_CHANGECBCHAIN</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms649019</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message to the next window in the Clipboard-viewer chain (the handle returned by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetClipboardViewer</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>). If <parameterReference>hWndRemove</parameterReference> is the next window in the chain, the window specified by <parameterReference>hWndAfter</parameterReference> becomes the next window, and Clipboard messages are passed on to it.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onchangeuistate">
        <!--0de6ae0a-7f4b-417a-9591-5ea4e74817d0-->
        <title>CWnd::OnChangeUIState</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called when the user interface (UI) state should be changed.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnChangeUIState(
    UINT nAction,
    UINT nUIElement );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nAction</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the action to be taken. Can be one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>UIS_CLEAR</legacyBold>The UI state element (specified by <parameterReference>nUIElement</parameterReference>) should be hidden.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>UIS_INITIALIZE</legacyBold>The UI state element (specified by <parameterReference>nUIElement</parameterReference>) should be changed based on the last input event. For more information, see the <legacyBold>Remarks</legacyBold> section of                                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_CHANGEUISTATE</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646342</linkUri>
                                        </externalLink>.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>UIS_SET</legacyBold>The UI state element (specified by <parameterReference>nUIElement</parameterReference>) should be visible.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nUIElement</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies which UI state elements are affected or the style of the control. Can be one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>UISF_HIDEACCEL</legacyBold>Keyboard accelerators.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>UISF_HIDEFOCUS</legacyBold>Focus indicators.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>UISF_ACTIVE</legacyBold> <legacyBold>Windows XP:</legacyBold> A control should be drawn in the style used for active controls.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_CHANGEUISTATE</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646342</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onchar">
        <!--3d0df957-2d1e-4892-9ca4-cc36149ed45c-->
        <title>CWnd::OnChar</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function when a keystroke translates to a nonsystem character.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnChar(
    UINT nChar,
    UINT nRepCnt,
    UINT nFlags );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nChar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Contains the character code value of the key.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nRepCnt</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Contains the repeat count, the number of times the keystroke is repeated when user holds down the key.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Contains the scan code, key-transition code, previous key state, and context code, as shown in the following list:</para>
                            <table xmlns:caps="http://schemas.microsoft.com/build/caps/2013/11">
                                <thead>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Value</para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Meaning</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                </thead>
                                <tbody>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>0-15</para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Specifies the repeat count. The value is the number of times the keystroke is repeated as a result of the user holding down the key.</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>16-23</para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Specifies the scan code. The value depends on the original equipment manufacturer (OEM)</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>24</para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Specifies whether the key is an extended key, such as the right-hand ALT and CTRL keys that appear on an enhanced 101- or 102-key keyboard. The value is 1 if it is an extended key; otherwise, it is 0.</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>25-28</para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Used internally by Windows.</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>29</para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Specifies the context code. The value is 1 if the ALT key is held down while the key is pressed; otherwise, the value is 0.</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>30</para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Specifies the previous key state. The value is 1 if the key is down before the message is sent, or it is 0 if the key is up.</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                    <tr>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>31</para>
                                        </TD>
                                        <TD>
                                            <para>Specifies the transition state. The value is 1 if the key is being released, or it is 0 if the key is being pressed.</para>
                                        </TD>
                                    </tr>
                                </tbody>
                            </table>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This function is called before the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onkeyup">OnKeyUp</legacyLink> member function and after the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onkeydown">OnKeyDown</legacyLink> member function are called. <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnChar</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> contains the value of the keyboard key being pressed or released. </para>
                    <para>Because there is not necessarily a one-to-one correspondence between keys pressed and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnChar</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> calls generated, the information in <parameterReference>nFlags</parameterReference> is generally not useful to applications. The information in <parameterReference>nFlags</parameterReference> applies only to the most recent call to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnKeyUp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function or the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnKeyDown</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function that precedes the call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnChar</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                    <para>For IBM Enhanced 101- and 102-key keyboards, enhanced keys are the right ALT and the right CTRL keys on the main section of the keyboard; the INS, DEL, HOME, END, PAGE UP, PAGE DOWN, and arrow keys in the clusters to the left of the numeric keypad; and the slash (/) and ENTER keys in the numeric keypad. Some other keyboards may support the extended-key bit in <parameterReference>nFlags</parameterReference>.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onchartoitem">
        <!--91f0708c-396b-4944-b0ca-19952c1c5c43-->
        <title>CWnd::OnCharToItem</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called when a list box with the <legacyLink xlink:href="3f357b8d-9118-4f41-9e28-02ed92d1e88f">LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT</legacyLink> style sends its owner a                 <externalLink> <linkText>WM_CHARTOITEM</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb761358</linkUri>
                </externalLink> message in response to a <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onchar">WM_CHAR</legacyLink> message. </para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg int OnCharToItem(
    UINT nChar,
    CListBox* pListBox,
    UINT nIndex );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nChar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the value of the key pressed by the user.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pListBox</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies a pointer to the list box. It may be temporary.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIndex</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the current caret position.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The framework calls this member function to specify the action that the application performed in response to the call. A return value of 2 indicates that the application handled all aspects of selecting the item and wants no further action by the list box. A return value of 1 indicates that the list box should perform the default action in response to the keystroke. A return value of 0 or greater specifies the zero-based index of an item in the list box and indicates that the list box should perform the default action for the keystroke on the given item.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onchildactivate">
        <!--01b45104-46a0-440e-8a8a-1f07dd17f903-->
        <title>CWnd::OnChildActivate</title>
        <content>
            <para>If the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object is a multiple document interface (MDI) child window, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnChildActivate</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is called by the framework when the user clicks the window's title bar or when the window is activated, moved, or sized.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnChildActivate();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections/>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onchildnotify">
        <!--1d311d06-3a9b-411d-a697-f6a0b628f4c2-->
        <title>CWnd::OnChildNotify</title>
        <content>
            <para>This member function is called by this window's parent window when it receives a notification message that applies to this window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual BOOL OnChildNotify(
    UINT message,
    WPARAM wParam,
    LPARAM lParam,
    LRESULT* pResult );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>message</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A Windows message number sent to a parent window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>wParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The <legacyBold>wparam</legacyBold> associated with the message.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The <legacyBold>lparam</legacyBold> associated with the message.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pLResult</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a value to be returned from the parent's window procedure. This pointer will be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if no return value is expected.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if this window is responsible for handling the message sent to its parent; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Never call this member function directly.</para>
                    <para>The default implementation of this member function returns 0, which means that the parent should handle the message. </para>
                    <para>Override this member function to extend the manner in which a control responds to notification messages.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onclipboardupdate">
        <!--247bd741-2128-47c8-bc27-1f798fe9130e-->
        <title>CWnd::OnClipboardUpdate</title>
        <content>

    <section address="cwnd__onclose">
        <!--aeafcdae-f35e-4bb4-8cd3-3af1226decf7-->
        <title>CWnd::OnClose</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function as a signal that the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> or an application is to terminate.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnClose();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The default implementation calls <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DestroyWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
