                <content>
                    <table xmlns:caps="http://schemas.microsoft.com/build/caps/2013/11">
                        <thead>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Parameter</para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Description</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                        </thead>
                        <tbody>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>[in] <parameterReference>nChar</parameterReference>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Specifies the character code of the pressed key.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>[in] <parameterReference>nRepCnt</parameterReference>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Specifies the repeat count for the current message. The value is the number of times the keystroke is autorepeated as a result of the user holding down the key. If the keystroke is held long enough, multiple messages are sent. However, the repeat count is not cumulative.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>[in] <parameterReference>nFlags</parameterReference>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Flags that specify the scan code, extended key, context code, previous key state, and transition state, as shown in the following table: </para>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>0-7:</legacyBold> Specifies the scan code. The value depends on the original equipment manufacturer (OEM).</para>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>8:</legacyBold> Specifies an extended key, such as the right-hand ALT and CTRL keys that appear on an enhanced 101 or 102-key keyboard. The flag is 1 if the key is an extended key; otherwise, it is 0.</para>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>9-12: </legacyBold> Used internally by Windows.</para>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>13: </legacyBold> Specifies the context code. The flag is 1 if the ALT key is held down while the key is pressed; otherwise, the value is 0.</para>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>14: </legacyBold> Specifies the previous key state. The flag is 1 if the key is down before the message is sent, or 0 if the key is up.</para>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>15: </legacyBold> Specifies the transition state. The flag is 1 if the key is being released, or 0 if the key is being pressed.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                        </tbody>
                    </table>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This method receives the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_UNICHAR</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646288</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> notification, which is described in the <token>winSDK</token>. The                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_UNICHAR</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646288</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>message is designed to send or post Unicode characters to ANSI windows. It is equivalent to the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_CHAR</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646276</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message, but uses Unicode Transformation Format-32encoding (UTF-32), whereas the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_CHAR</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646276</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message uses UTF-16.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onuninitmenupopup">
        <!--64675739-8565-4334-88c7-c7c2a55429e0-->
        <title>CWnd::OnUnInitMenuPopup</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function when a drop-down menu or submenu has been destroyed.</para>

    CMenu* pPopupMenu, 
    UINT nFlags );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>

                        <thead>

                        </thead>

            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>

                    <para>This method receives the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_UNINITMENUPOPUP</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms647614</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> notification, which is described in the <token>winSDK</token>. </para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>

    <section address="cwnd__onupdateuistate">
        <!--ddefbefa-d00d-4b9f-b9e3-b4ccec023bd0-->
        <title>CWnd::OnUpdateUIState</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called to to change the user interface (UI) state for the specified window and all its child windows.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnUpdateUIState(
    UINT nAction,
    UINT nUIElement );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nAction</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the action to be performed. Can be one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>UIS_CLEAR</legacyBold>The UI state element (specified by <parameterReference>nUIElement</parameterReference>) should be hidden.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>UIS_INITIALIZE</legacyBold>The UI state element (specified by <parameterReference>nUIElement</parameterReference>) should be changed based on the last input event. For more information, see the <legacyBold>Remarks</legacyBold> section of                                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_UPDATEISTATE</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646361</linkUri>
                                        </externalLink>.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>UIS_SET</legacyBold>The UI state element (specified by <parameterReference>nUIElement</parameterReference>) should be visible.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nUIElement</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies which UI state elements are affected or the style of the control. Can be one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>UISF_HIDEACCEL</legacyBold>Keyboard accelerators.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>UISF_HIDEFOCUS</legacyBold>Focus indicators.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>UISF_ACTIVE</legacyBold> <legacyBold>Windows XP:</legacyBold> A control should be drawn in the style used for active controls.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_UPDATEUISTATE</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646361</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onuserchanged">
        <!--2b7afecf-7b76-4165-978c-b4aab16b657e-->
        <title>CWnd::OnUserChanged</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member for all windows after the user has logged on or off.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnUserChanged();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This method receives the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_USERCHANGED</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632651</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> notification message, which is described in the <token>winSDK</token>. When the user logs on or off, the operating system updates user-specific settings. The system sends this message immediately after updating the settings.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onvkeytoitem">
        <!--775623bb-394b-4384-b186-76a775364712-->
        <title>CWnd::OnVKeyToItem</title>
        <content>
            <para>If the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object owns a list box with the <legacyLink xlink:href="3f357b8d-9118-4f41-9e28-02ed92d1e88f">LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT</legacyLink> style, the list box will send the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_VKEYTOITEM</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message in response to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_KEYDOWN</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg int OnVKeyToItem(
    UINT nKey,
    CListBox* pListBox,
    UINT nIndex );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nKey</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the virtual key code of the key that the user pressed. For a list of of standard virtual key codes, see Winuser.h</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pListBox</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies a pointer to the list box. The pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIndex</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the current caret position.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies the action that the application performed in response to the message. A return value of 2 indicates that the application handled all aspects of selecting the item and requires no further action by the list box. A return value of 1 indicates that the list box should perform the default action in response to the keystroke. A return value of 0 or greater specifies the zero-based index of an item in the list box and indicates that the list box should perform the default action for the keystroke on the given item.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function is called by the framework only for list boxes that have the <legacyLink xlink:href="3f357b8d-9118-4f41-9e28-02ed92d1e88f">LBS_HASSTRINGS</legacyLink> style. </para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onvscroll">
        <!--23cf0af9-41c8-4987-996e-199db0c2b3d6-->
        <title>CWnd::OnVScroll</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function when the user clicks the window's vertical scroll bar.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnVScroll(
    UINT nSBCode,
    UINT nPos,
    CScrollBar* pScrollBar );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nSBCode</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies a scroll-bar code that indicates the user's scrolling request. This parameter can be one of the following:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_BOTTOM</legacyBold>Scroll to bottom.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_ENDSCROLL</legacyBold>End scroll.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_LINEDOWN</legacyBold>Scroll one line down.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_LINEUP</legacyBold>Scroll one line up.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_PAGEDOWN</legacyBold>Scroll one page down.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_PAGEUP</legacyBold>Scroll one page up.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_THUMBPOSITION</legacyBold>Scroll to the absolute position. The current position is provided in <parameterReference>nPos</parameterReference>.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_THUMBTRACK</legacyBold>Drag scroll box to specified position. The current position is provided in <parameterReference>nPos</parameterReference>.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_TOP</legacyBold>Scroll to top.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nPos</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Contains the current scroll-box position if the scroll-bar code is <legacyBold>SB_THUMBPOSITION</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>SB_THUMBTRACK</legacyBold>; otherwise not used. Depending on the initial scroll range, <parameterReference>nPos</parameterReference> may be negative and should be cast to an <languageKeyword>int</languageKeyword> if necessary.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pScrollBar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>If the scroll message came from a scroll-bar control, contains a pointer to the control. If the user clicked a window's scroll bar, this parameter is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>. The pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnVScroll</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> typically is used by applications that give some feedback while the scroll box is being dragged. </para>
                    <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnVScroll</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> scrolls the contents of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object, it must also reset the position of the scroll box with the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__setscrollpos">SetScrollPos</legacyLink> member function.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onvscrollclipboard">
        <!--f34fecea-b295-46fb-89ba-e638f726b05b-->
        <title>CWnd::OnVScrollClipboard</title>
        <content>
            <para>The Clipboard owner's <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnVScrollClipboard</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function is called by the Clipboard viewer when the Clipboard data has the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CF_OWNERDISPLAY</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> format and there is an event in the Clipboard viewer's vertical scroll bar.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnVScrollClipboard(
    CWnd* pClipAppWnd,
    UINT nSBCode,
    UINT nPos );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pClipAppWnd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies a pointer to a Clipboard-viewer window. The pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nSBCode</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies one of the following scroll-bar values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_BOTTOM</legacyBold>Scroll to bottom.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_ENDSCROLL</legacyBold>End scroll.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_LINEDOWN</legacyBold>Scroll one line down.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_LINEUP</legacyBold>Scroll one line up.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_PAGEDOWN</legacyBold>Scroll one page down.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_PAGEUP</legacyBold>Scroll one page up.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_THUMBPOSITION</legacyBold>Scroll to the absolute position. The current position is provided in <parameterReference>nPos</parameterReference>.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_TOP</legacyBold>Scroll to top.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nPos</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Contains the scroll-box position if the scroll-bar code is <legacyBold>SB_THUMBPOSITION</legacyBold>; otherwise <parameterReference>nPos</parameterReference> is not used.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The owner should scroll the Clipboard image, invalidate the appropriate section, and update the scroll-bar values.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onwindowmaximizedchanged">
        <!--a24b6757-1eb9-4c10-931a-eb18bc44e599-->
        <title>CWnd::OnWindowMaximizedChanged</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member when the current window is maximized, and the window is composed by the Desktop Window Manager (DWM).</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnWindowMaximizedChanged( BOOL bIsMaximized );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <table xmlns:caps="http://schemas.microsoft.com/build/caps/2013/11">
                        <thead>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Parameter</para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>Description</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                        </thead>
                        <tbody>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>[in] <parameterReference>bIsMaximized</parameterReference>
                                    </para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>
                                    <para> <codeInline>true</codeInline> if the current window is maximized, and <codeInline>false</codeInline> if it is not.</para>
                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                        </tbody>
                    </table>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This method receives the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_DWMWINDOWMAXIMIZEDCHANGE</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd388201</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> notification message, which is described in the <token>winSDK</token>. </para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onwindowposchanged">
        <!--0438c4d0-4e2f-4f5f-9efc-78ba7626fded-->
        <title>CWnd::OnWindowPosChanged</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function when the size, position, or Z-order has changed as a result of a call to the                 <externalLink> <linkText>SetWindowPos</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633545</linkUri>
                </externalLink> member function or another window-management function.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnWindowPosChanged( WINDOWPOS* lpwndpos );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpwndpos</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="a4ea7cd9-c4c2-4480-9c55-cbbff72195e1">WINDOWPOS</legacyLink> data structure that contains information about the window's new size and position.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The default implementation sends the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_SIZE</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632646</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> and                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_MOVE</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632631</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> messages to the window. These messages are not sent if an application handles the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnWindowPosChanged</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> call without calling its base class. It is more efficient to perform any move or size change processing during the call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnWindowPosChanged</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> without calling its base class.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__onwindowposchanging">
        <!--eaaccbe3-c00c-4836-b346-a96ac8ea4f40-->
        <title>CWnd::OnWindowPosChanging</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function when the size, position, or Z-order is about to change as a result of a call to the                 <externalLink> <linkText>SetWindowPos</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633545</linkUri>
                </externalLink> member function or another window-management function.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnWindowPosChanging( WINDOWPOS* lpwndpos );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpwndpos</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WINDOWPOS</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> data structure that contains information about the window's new size and position.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>An application can prevent changes to the window by setting or clearing the appropriate bits in the <legacyBold>flags</legacyBold> member of the <legacyLink xlink:href="a4ea7cd9-c4c2-4480-9c55-cbbff72195e1">WINDOWPOS</legacyLink> structure. </para>
                    <para>For a window with the <legacyLink xlink:href="c85ffbe4-f4ff-4227-917a-48ec4a411842">WS_OVERLAPPED</legacyLink> or <legacyLink xlink:href="c85ffbe4-f4ff-4227-917a-48ec4a411842">WS_THICKFRAME</legacyLink> style, the default implementation sends a                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_GETMINMAXINFO</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632626</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message to the window. This is done to validate the new size and position of the window and to enforce the <legacyBold>CS_BYTEALIGNCLIENT</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>CS_BYTEALIGN</legacyBold> client styles. An application can override this functionality by not calling its base class.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message.     <section address="cwnd__onwininichange">

        <title>CWnd::OnWinIniChange</title>
        <content>
            <para>The framework calls this member function after a change has been made to the Windows initialization file, WIN.INI.</para>
            <legacySyntax>afx_msg void OnWinIniChange( LPCTSTR lpszSection );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpszSection</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a string that specifies the name of the section that has changed. (The string does not include the square brackets that enclose the section name.)</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The                         <externalLink> <linkText>SystemParametersInfo</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms724947</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows function calls <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnWinIniChange</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> after an application uses the function to change a setting in the WIN.INI file. </para>
                    <para>To send the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_WININICHANGE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message to all top-level windows, an application can use the                         <externalLink> <linkText>SendMessage</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms644950</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows function with its                         <legacyItalic>hwnd</legacyItalic> parameter set to <legacyBold>HWND_BROADCAST</legacyBold>. </para>
                    <para>If an application changes many different sections in WIN.INI at the same time, the application should send one <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_WININICHANGE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message with <parameterReference>lpszSection</parameterReference> set to <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>. Otherwise, an application should send <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_WININICHANGE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> each time it makes a change to WIN.INI.</para>
                    <para>If an application receives an <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnWinIniChange</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> call with <parameterReference>lpszSection</parameterReference> set to <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the application should check all sections in WIN.INI that affect the application.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow your application to handle a Windows message. The parameters passed to your function reflect the parameters received by the framework when the message was received. If you call the base-class implementation of this function, that implementation will use the parameters originally passed with the message and not the parameters you supply to the function.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>

                                </TD>

                            </tr>

                            </tr>

                                </TD>
                                <TD>

                            </tr>
                            <tr>

                                </TD>
                                <TD>

                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                            <tr>
                                <TD>
                                    <para>MK_XBUTTON1</para>
                                </TD>
                                <TD>

                                </TD>
                            </tr>

                                </TD>
                            </tr>
                        </tbody>

    <section address="cwnd__openclipboard">
        <!--c4c22fa8-4683-48b5-bf3d-84ca981ac1b3-->
        <title>CWnd::OpenClipboard</title>
        <content>
            <para>Opens the Clipboard.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL OpenClipboard();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the Clipboard is opened via <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, or 0 if another application or window has the Clipboard open.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Other applications will not be able to modify the Clipboard until the                         <externalLink> <linkText>CloseClipboard</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms649035</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows function is called. </para>
                    <para>The current <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object will not become the owner of the Clipboard until the                         <externalLink> <linkText>EmptyClipboard</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms649037</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows function is called.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#111</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>

                    <para>Nonzero if equal; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__paintwindowlesscontrols">
        <!--c745af88-93d9-46a4-93ed-e29d24cad5d4-->
        <title>CWnd::PaintWindowlessControls</title>
        <content>
            <para>Draws windowless controls on the control container.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL PaintWindowlessControls( CDC * pDC );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pDC</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The device context on which to draw the windowless controls.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Returns TRUE if there is a control container and the windowless controls are drawn successfully, otherwise FALSE.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__postmessage">
        <!--3f7f2cd5-07ac-43a1-81cd-5ad39f3c8229-->
        <title>CWnd::PostMessage</title>
        <content>
            <para>Places a message in the window's message queue and then returns without waiting for the corresponding window to process the message.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL PostMessage(
    UINT message,
    WPARAM wParam = 0,
    LPARAM lParam = 0 );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>message</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the message to be posted.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>wParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message information. The content of this parameter depends on the message being posted.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message information. The content of this parameter depends on the message being posted.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the message is posted; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Messages in a message queue are retrieved by calls to the                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetMessage</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms644936</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> or                         <externalLink> <linkText>PeekMessage</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms644943</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows function. </para>
                    <para>The Windows                         <externalLink> <linkText>PostMessage</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms644944</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> function can be used to access another application.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="4977d098-13ea-4a47-863d-2f6e2fcd2a8f">AfxGetMainWnd</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__postncdestroy">
        <!--ecdb0263-0b5b-4ce6-8128-025f2fc6c54b-->
        <title>CWnd::PostNcDestroy</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called by the default <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onncdestroy">OnNcDestroy</legacyLink> member function after the window has been destroyed.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual void PostNcDestroy();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Derived classes can use this function for custom cleanup such as the deletion of the <legacyBold>this</legacyBold> pointer.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__precreatewindow">
        <!--d0b5d783-15dd-4047-a1d2-1252e7c2a73e-->
        <title>CWnd::PreCreateWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called by the framework before the creation of the Windows window attached to this <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual BOOL PreCreateWindow( CREATESTRUCT&amp; cs );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>cs</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A <legacyLink xlink:href="028c7b5e-4fdc-48da-a550-d3e4f9e6cc85">CREATESTRUCT</legacyLink> structure.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the window creation should continue; 0 to indicate creation failure.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <alert class="warning">
                        <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::PreCreateWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> now assigns the hMenu member of <parameterReference>cs</parameterReference> to the <languageKeyword>this</languageKeyword> pointer if the menu is <languageKeyword>NULL</languageKeyword> and the style contains <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WS_CHILD</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. For proper functionality, ensure that your dialog control has an ID that is not <languageKeyword>NULL</languageKeyword>.</para>
                        <para>This change fixes a crash in managed/native interop scenarios. A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>TRACE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> statement in <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::Create</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> alerts the developer of the problem.</para>
                    </alert>
                    <para>Never call this function directly.</para>
                    <para>The default implementation of this function checks for a <legacyBold>NULL </legacyBold>window class name and substitutes an appropriate default. Override this member function to modify the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CREATESTRUCT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> structure before the window is created. </para>
                    <para>Each class derived from <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> adds its own functionality to its override of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PreCreateWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. By design, these derivations of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PreCreateWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> are not documented. To determine the styles appropriate to each class and the interdependencies between the styles, you can examine the MFC source code for your application's base class. If you choose to override <legacyBold>PreCreateWindow,</legacyBold> you can determine whether the styles used in your application's base class provide the functionality you need by using information gathered from the MFC source code.</para>
                    <para>For more information on changing window styles, see the <legacyLink xlink:href="77fa4f03-96b4-4687-9ade-41e46f7e4b0a">Changing the Styles of a Window Created by MFC</legacyLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#112</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__presubclasswindow">
        <!--3a85e9a4-9276-4d41-aba7-26a1260a3051-->
        <title>CWnd::PreSubclassWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>This member function is called by the framework to allow other necessary subclassing to occur before the window is subclassed.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual void PreSubclassWindow();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Overriding this member function allows for dynamic subclassing of controls. It is an advanced overridable.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__pretranslatemessage">
        <!--b5c6f146-c053-405b-bb4e-20a4e4add31c-->
        <title>CWnd::PreTranslateMessage</title>
        <content>
            <para>Used by class <legacyLink xlink:href="e426a3cd-0d15-40d6-bd55-beaa5feb2343">CWinApp</legacyLink> to translate window messages before they are dispatched to the                 <externalLink> <linkText>TranslateMessage</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms644955</linkUri>
                </externalLink> and                 <externalLink> <linkText>DispatchMessage</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms644934</linkUri>
                </externalLink> Windows functions.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual BOOL PreTranslateMessage( MSG* pMsg );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pMsg</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="dc166d27-9423-41f1-9599-5ba76d2f0138">MSG</legacyLink> structure that contains the message to process.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the message was translated and should not be dispatched; 0 if the message was not translated and should be dispatched.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__print">
        <!--b2b11fa0-7d82-4119-892f-500772c923f7-->
        <title>CWnd::Print</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to draw the current window in the specified device context, which is most commonly in a printer device context.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void Print(
    CDC* pDC,
    DWORD dwFlags ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pDC</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a device context.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the drawing options. This parameter can be one or more of these flags:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_CHECKVISIBLE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Draw the window only if it is visible.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_CHILDREN</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Draw all visible children windows.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_CLIENT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Draw the client area of the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_ERASEBKGND</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Erase the background before drawing the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_NONCLIENT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Draw the nonclient area of the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_OWNED</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Draw all owned windows.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__defwindowproc">CWnd::DefWindowProc</legacyLink> function processes this message based on which drawing option is specified:  </para>
                    <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                            <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_CHECKVISIBLE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is specified and the window is not visible, do nothing.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_NONCLIENT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is specified, draw the nonclient area in the given device context.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_ERASEBKGND</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is specified, send the window a                                 <externalLink> <linkText>WM_ERASEBKGND</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms648055</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> message.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_CLIENT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is specified, send the window a                                 <externalLink> <linkText>WM_PRINTCLIENT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145217</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> message.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_CHILDREN</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is set, send each visible child window a                                 <externalLink> <linkText>WM_PRINT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145216</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> message.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_OWNED</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is set, send each visible owned window a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_PRINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message.</para>
                        </listItem>
                    </list>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__printclient">
        <!--016dd62f-bcd9-4de3-99b3-205855903175-->
        <title>CWnd::PrintClient</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to draw any window in the specified device context (usually a printer device context).</para>
            <legacySyntax>void PrintClient(
    CDC* pDC,
    DWORD dwFlags ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pDC</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a device context.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies drawing options. This parameter can be one or more of these flags:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_CHECKVISIBLE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Draw the window only if it is visible.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_CHILDREN</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Draw all visible children windows.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_CLIENT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Draw the client area of the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_ERASEBKGND</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Erase the background before drawing the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_NONCLIENT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Draw the nonclient area of the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PRF_OWNED</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Draw all owned windows.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__printwindow">
        <!--04e61fb8-5557-4697-8124-e6cf1803623e-->
        <title>CWnd::PrintWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Copies a visual window into the specified device context, typically a printer DC.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL PrintWindow(
    CDC* pDC,
    UINT nFlags ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pDC</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to the device context to be printed to.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the drawing options. For a list of possible values, see                                 <externalLink> <linkText>PrintWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd162869</linkUri>
                                </externalLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function succeeds; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>PrintWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd162869</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__redrawwindow">
        <!--fc4254f3-6564-4f18-b818-b2e011136d06-->
        <title>CWnd::RedrawWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Updates the specified rectangle or region in the given window's client area.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL RedrawWindow(
    LPCRECT lpRectUpdate = NULL,
    CRgn* prgnUpdate = NULL,
    UINT flags = RDW_INVALIDATE | RDW_UPDATENOW | RDW_ERASE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRectUpdate</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure containing the coordinates of the update rectangle. This parameter is ignored if                                 <legacyItalic>prgnUpdate</legacyItalic> contains a valid region handle.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>prgnUpdate</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the update region. If both                                 <legacyItalic>prgnUpdate</legacyItalic> and <parameterReference>lpRectUpdate</parameterReference> are <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the entire client area is added to the update region.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>flags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The following flags are used to invalidate the window:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>RDW_ERASE</legacyBold>Causes the window to receive a                                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_ERASEBKGND</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms648055</linkUri>
                                        </externalLink> message when the window is repainted. The <legacyBold>RDW_INVALIDATE</legacyBold> flag must also be specified; otherwise <legacyBold>RDW_ERASE</legacyBold> has no effect.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>RDW_FRAME</legacyBold>Causes any part of the nonclient area of the window that intersects the update region to receive a                                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_NCPAINT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145212</linkUri>
                                        </externalLink> message. The <legacyBold>RDW_INVALIDATE</legacyBold> flag must also be specified; otherwise <legacyBold>RDW_FRAME</legacyBold> has no effect.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>RDW_INTERNALPAINT</legacyBold>Causes a                                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_PAINT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145213</linkUri>
                                        </externalLink> message to be posted to the window regardless of whether the window contains an invalid region.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>RDW_INVALIDATE</legacyBold>Invalidate <parameterReference>lpRectUpdate</parameterReference> or                                         <legacyItalic>prgnUpdate</legacyItalic> (only one may be not <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>). If both are <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the entire window is invalidated.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                            <para>The following flags are used to validate the window:   </para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>RDW_NOERASE</legacyBold>Suppresses any pending <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_ERASEBKGND</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>RDW_NOFRAME</legacyBold>Suppresses any pending <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_NCPAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages. This flag must be used with <legacyBold>RDW_VALIDATE</legacyBold> and is typically used with <legacyBold>RDW_NOCHILDREN</legacyBold>. This option should be used with care, as it could prevent parts of a window from painting properly.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>RDW_NOINTERNALPAINT</legacyBold>Suppresses any pending internal <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_PAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages. This flag does not affect <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_PAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages resulting from invalid areas.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>RDW_VALIDATE</legacyBold>Validates <parameterReference>lpRectUpdate</parameterReference> or                                         <legacyItalic>prgnUpdate</legacyItalic> (only one may be not <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>). If both are <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the entire window is validated. This flag does not affect internal <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_PAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                            <para>The following flags control when repainting occurs. Painting is not performed by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RedrawWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> function unless one of these bits is specified.   </para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>RDW_ERASENOW</legacyBold>Causes the affected windows (as specified by the <legacyBold>RDW_ALLCHILDREN</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>RDW_NOCHILDREN</legacyBold> flags) to receive <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_NCPAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_ERASEBKGND</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages, if necessary, before the function returns. <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_PAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages are deferred.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>RDW_UPDATENOW</legacyBold>Causes the affected windows (as specified by the <legacyBold>RDW_ALLCHILDREN</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>RDW_NOCHILDREN</legacyBold> flags) to receive <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_NCPAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_ERASEBKGND</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_PAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages, if necessary, before the function returns.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                            <para>By default, the windows affected by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RedrawWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> function depend on whether the specified window has the <legacyBold>WS_CLIPCHILDREN</legacyBold> style. The child windows of <legacyBold>WS_CLIPCHILDREN</legacyBold> windows are not affected. However, those windows that are not <legacyBold>WS_CLIPCHILDREN</legacyBold> windows are recursively validated or invalidated until a <legacyBold>WS_CLIPCHILDREN</legacyBold> window is encountered. The following flags control which windows are affected by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RedrawWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> function:   </para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>RDW_ALLCHILDREN</legacyBold>Includes child windows, if any, in the repainting operation.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>RDW_NOCHILDREN</legacyBold>Excludes child windows, if any, from the repainting operation.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the window was redrawn successfully; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>When the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RedrawWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function is used to invalidate part of the desktop window, that window does not receive a                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_PAINT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145213</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message. To repaint the desktop, an application should use <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__validatergn">CWnd::ValidateRgn</legacyLink>, <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__invalidatergn">CWnd::InvalidateRgn</legacyLink>, <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__updatewindow">CWnd::UpdateWindow</legacyLink>, or                         <externalLink> <linkText>RedrawWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd162911</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>
                    </para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__reflectchildnotify">
        <!--9b7109ab-9201-4390-b23b-65a00f4ae91d-->
        <title>CWnd::ReflectChildNotify</title>
        <content>
            <para>This message function is called by the framework from <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onchildnotify">OnChildNotify</legacyLink>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL ReflectChildNotify(
    UINT message,
    WPARAM wParam,
    LPARAM lParam,
    LRESULT* pResult );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>message</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the message to be reflected.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>wParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message-dependent information.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message-dependent information.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pResult</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The result generated by the child window to be returned by the parent window. Can be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> if message was reflected; otherwise <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>It is a helper function which reflects <parameterReference>message</parameterReference> to its source.</para>
                    <para>Reflected messages are sent directly to <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onwndmsg">CWnd::OnWndMsg</legacyLink> or <legacyLink xlink:href="8883b132-2057-4ce0-a5f2-88979f8f2b13#ccmdtarget__oncmdmsg">CCmdTarget::OnCmdMsg</legacyLink>.</para>
                    <para>For more information about message reflection, see <legacyLink xlink:href="147a4e0c-51cc-4447-a8e1-c28b4cece578">Handling Reflected Messages</legacyLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__reflectlastmsg">
        <!--2a37475a-f0b4-4ce4-90f1-3655fea1da61-->
        <title>CWnd::ReflectLastMsg</title>
        <content>
            <para>This member function is called by the framework to reflect the last message to the child window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static BOOL PASCAL ReflectLastMsg(
    HWND hWndChild,
    LRESULT* pResult = NULL  );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>hWndChild</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A handle to a child window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pResult</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The result generated by the child window to be returned by the parent window. Can be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the message was handled; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function calls <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__sendchildnotifylastmsg">SendChildNotifyLastMsg</legacyLink> if the window identified by <parameterReference>hWndChild</parameterReference> is an OLE control or a window in the permanent map.</para>
                    <para>For more information about message reflection, see <legacyLink xlink:href="147a4e0c-51cc-4447-a8e1-c28b4cece578">Handling Reflected Messages</legacyLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__releasedc">
        <!--d5e52d65-c5a8-42bd-81d0-82443a5f8fe5-->
        <title>CWnd::ReleaseDC</title>
        <content>
            <para>Releases a device context, freeing it for use by other applications.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int ReleaseDC( CDC* pDC );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pDC</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the device context to be released.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The effect of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ReleaseDC</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function depends on the device-context type. </para>
