                    <para>The application must call the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ReleaseDC</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function for each call to the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__getwindowdc">GetWindowDC</legacyLink> member function and for each call to the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__getdc">GetDC</legacyLink> member function.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__repositionbars">
        <!--608f3740-1165-411a-b452-8c24b12be5bf-->
        <title>CWnd::RepositionBars</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called to reposition and resize control bars in the client area of a window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void RepositionBars( UINT nIDFirst,    UINT nIDLast,    UINT nIDLeftOver,    UINT nFlag = reposDefault,    LPRECT lpRectParam = NULL,    LPCRECT lpRectClient = NULL,    BOOL bStretch = TRUE 
) ;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDFirst</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The ID of the first in a range of control bars to reposition and resize.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDLast</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The ID of the last in a range of control bars to reposition and resize.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDLeftOver</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies ID of pane that fills the rest of the client area.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nFlag</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Can have one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>CWnd::reposDefault</legacyBold>Performs the layout of the control bars. <parameterReference>lpRectParam</parameterReference> is not used and can be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>CWnd::reposQuery</legacyBold>The layout of the control bars is not done; instead <parameterReference>lpRectParam</parameterReference> is initialized with the size of the client area, as if the layout had actually been done.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>CWnd::reposExtra</legacyBold>Adds the values of <parameterReference>lpRectParam</parameterReference> to the client area of <parameterReference>nIDLast</parameterReference> and also performs the layout                                        <legacyItalic>.</legacyItalic>
                                    </para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRectParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure; the usage of which depends on the value of <parameterReference>nFlag</parameterReference>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>lpRectClient</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure containing the available client area. If <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the window's client area will be used.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bStretch</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Indicates whether the bar should be stretched to the size of the frame.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <parameterReference>nIDFirst</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>nIDLast</parameterReference> parameters define a range of control-bar IDs to be repositioned in the client area. The <parameterReference>nIDLeftOver</parameterReference> parameter specifies the ID of the child window (normally the view) which is repositioned and resized to fill the rest of the client area not filled by control bars.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__runmodalloop">
        <!--20563fad-e9d3-4b35-9d70-65918f44c6e5-->
        <title>CWnd::RunModalLoop</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to retrieve, translate, or dispatch messages until <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__continuemodal">ContinueModal</legacyLink> returns <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int RunModalLoop( DWORD dwFlags = 0  );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the Windows message to be sent. Can be one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>MLF_NOIDLEMSG</legacyBold>Don't send                                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_ENTERIDLE</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms645422</linkUri>
                                        </externalLink> messages to the parent.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>MLF_NOKICKIDLE</legacyBold>Don't send <legacyBold>WM_KICKIDLE</legacyBold> messages to the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>MLF_SHOWONIDLE</legacyBold>Show the window when message queue goes idle.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies the value of the <parameterReference>nResult</parameterReference> parameter passed to the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__endmodalloop">EndModalLoop</legacyLink> member function, which is then used to end the modal loop.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>By default, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ContinueModal</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> returns <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold> after <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>EndModalLoop</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is called. Returns the value provided as <parameterReference>nResult</parameterReference> to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>EndModalLoop</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__screentoclient">
        <!--6461c98a-7a9d-4d6c-905f-23fc13251651-->
        <title>CWnd::ScreenToClient</title>
        <content>
            <para>Converts the screen coordinates of a given point or rectangle on the display to client coordinates.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void ScreenToClient( LPPOINT lpPoint ) const;

void ScreenToClient( LPRECT lpRect ) const;</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpPoint</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="a6d4db93-35cc-444d-9221-c3e160f6edaa">CPoint</legacyLink> object or <legacyLink xlink:href="965736d8-4e53-41b6-9b8b-6961992dd21f">POINT</legacyLink> structure that contains the screen coordinates to be converted.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="dee4e752-15d6-4db4-b68f-1ad65b2ed6ca">CRect</legacyLink> object or <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure that contains the screen coordinates to be converted.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ScreenToClient</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function replaces the screen coordinates given in <parameterReference>lpPoint</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference> with client coordinates. The new coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> client area.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="fe08a1ca-4b05-4ff7-a12a-ee4c765a2197#clistctrl__getitemrect">CListCtrl::GetItemRect</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__scrollwindow">
        <!--cab3c37d-5fc8-4472-9464-5ffe99b5bd8b-->
        <title>CWnd::ScrollWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Scrolls the contents of the client area of the current <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void ScrollWindow(
    int xAmount,
    int yAmount,
    LPCRECT lpRect = NULL,
    LPCRECT lpClipRect = NULL );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>xAmount</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the amount, in device units, of horizontal scrolling. This parameter must be a negative value to scroll to the left.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>yAmount</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the amount, in device units, of vertical scrolling. This parameter must be a negative value to scroll up.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="dee4e752-15d6-4db4-b68f-1ad65b2ed6ca">CRect</legacyLink> object or <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure that specifies the portion of the client area to be scrolled. If <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the entire client area is scrolled. The caret is repositioned if the cursor rectangle intersects the scroll rectangle.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpClipRect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RECT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> structure that specifies the clipping rectangle to scroll. Only bits inside this rectangle are scrolled. Bits outside this rectangle are not affected even if they are in the <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference> rectangle. If <parameterReference>lpClipRect</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, no clipping is performed on the scroll rectangle.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the caret is in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> being scrolled, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ScrollWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> automatically hides the caret to prevent it from being erased and then restores the caret after the scroll is finished. The caret position is adjusted accordingly.</para>
                    <para>The area uncovered by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ScrollWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function is not repainted but is combined into the current <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object's update region. The application will eventually receive a                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_PAINT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145213</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message notifying it that the region needs repainting. To repaint the uncovered area at the same time the scrolling is done, call the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__updatewindow">UpdateWindow</legacyLink> member function immediately after calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ScrollWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                    <para>If <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the positions of any child windows in the window are offset by the amount specified by <parameterReference>xAmount</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>yAmount</parameterReference>, and any invalid (unpainted) areas in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> are also offset. <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ScrollWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is faster when <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>. </para>
                    <para>If <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference> is not <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the positions of child windows are not changed, and invalid areas in <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> are not offset. To prevent updating problems when <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference> is not <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, call the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>UpdateWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function to repaint <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> before calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ScrollWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__scrollwindowex">
        <!--cec2c073-1051-41ff-bb2d-5a395d1fd61b-->
        <title>CWnd::ScrollWindowEx</title>
        <content>
            <para>Scrolls the contents of a window's client area.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int ScrollWindowEx(
    int dx,
    int dy,
    LPCRECT lpRectScroll,
    LPCRECT lpRectClip,
    CRgn* prgnUpdate,
    LPRECT lpRectUpdate,
    UINT flags );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dx</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the amount, in device units, of horizontal scrolling. This parameter must have a negative value to scroll to the left.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>dy</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the amount, in device units, of vertical scrolling. This parameter must have a negative value to scroll up.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRectScroll</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure that specifies the portion of the client area to be scrolled. If this parameter is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the entire client area is scrolled.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRectClip</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RECT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> structure that specifies the clipping rectangle to scroll. This structure takes precedence over the rectangle pointed to by <parameterReference>lpRectScroll</parameterReference>. Only bits inside this rectangle are scrolled. Bits outside this rectangle are not affected even if they are in the <parameterReference>lpRectScroll</parameterReference> rectangle. If this parameter is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, no clipping is performed on the scroll rectangle.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>prgnUpdate</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the region that is modified to hold the region invalidated by scrolling. This parameter may be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRectUpdate</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RECT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> structure that will receive the boundaries of the rectangle invalidated by scrolling. This parameter may be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>flags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Can have one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SW_ERASE</legacyBold>When specified with <legacyBold>SW_INVALIDATE</legacyBold>, erases the newly invalidated region by sending a                                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_ERASEBKGND</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms648055</linkUri>
                                        </externalLink> message to the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SW_INVALIDATE</legacyBold>Invalidates the region identified by                                         <legacyItalic>prgnUpdate</legacyItalic> after scrolling.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SW_SCROLLCHILDREN</legacyBold>Scrolls all child windows that intersect the rectangle pointed to by <parameterReference>lpRectScroll</parameterReference> by the number of pixels specified in <parameterReference>dx</parameterReference> and                                         <legacyItalic>dy</legacyItalic>. Windows sends a                                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_MOVE</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632631</linkUri>
                                        </externalLink> message to all child windows that intersect <parameterReference>lpRectScroll</parameterReference>, even if they do not move. The caret is repositioned when a child window is scrolled and the cursor rectangle intersects the scroll rectangle.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The return value is <legacyBold>SIMPLEREGION</legacyBold> (rectangular invalidated region), <legacyBold>COMPLEXREGION</legacyBold> (nonrectangular invalidated region; overlapping rectangles), or <legacyBold>NULLREGION</legacyBold> (no invalidated region), if the function is successful; otherwise the return value is <legacyBold>ERROR</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This function is similar to the                         <externalLink> <linkText>ScrollWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb787591</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> function, with some additional features. </para>
                    <para>If                         <externalLink> <linkText>SW_INVALIDATE</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb787593</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> and                         <externalLink> <linkText>SW_ERASE</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb787593</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> are not specified, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ScrollWindowEx</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function does not invalidate the area that is scrolled away from. If either of these flags is set, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ScrollWindowEx</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> invalidates this area. The area is not updated until the application calls the                         <externalLink> <linkText>UpdateWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145167</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> member function, calls the                         <externalLink> <linkText>RedrawWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd162911</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> member function (specifying                         <externalLink> <linkText>RDW_UPDATENOW</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd162911</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> or                         <externalLink> <linkText>RDW_ERASENOW</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd162911</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>), or retrieves the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_PAINT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145213</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message from the application queue.</para>
                    <para>If the window has the                         <externalLink> <linkText>WS_CLIPCHILDREN</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632679</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> style, the returned areas specified by                         <legacyItalic>prgnUpdate</legacyItalic> and <parameterReference>lpRectUpdate</parameterReference> represent the total area of the scrolled window that must be updated, including any areas in child windows that need updating. </para>
                    <para>If the                         <externalLink> <linkText>SW_SCROLLCHILDREN</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb787593</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> flag is specified, Windows will not properly update the screen if part of a child window is scrolled. The part of the scrolled child window that lies outside the source rectangle will not be erased and will not be redrawn properly in its new destination. Use the                         <externalLink> <linkText>DeferWindowPos</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632681</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows function to move child windows that do not lie completely within the <parameterReference>lpRectScroll</parameterReference> rectangle. The cursor is repositioned if the <legacyBold>SW_SCROLLCHILDREN</legacyBold> flag is set and the caret rectangle intersects the scroll rectangle.</para>
                    <para>All input and output coordinates (for <parameterReference>lpRectScroll</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>lpRectClip</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>lpRectUpdate</parameterReference>, and                         <legacyItalic>prgnUpdate</legacyItalic>) are assumed to be in client coordinates, regardless of whether the window has the <legacyBold>CS_OWNDC</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>CS_CLASSDC</legacyBold> class style. Use the                         <externalLink> <linkText>LPtoDP</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145042</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> and                         <externalLink> <linkText>DPtoLP</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd162474</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> Windows functions to convert to and from logical coordinates, if necessary.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__sendchildnotifylastmsg">
        <!--e22f3acc-f7e4-4431-a453-86ea70fa548b-->
        <title>CWnd::SendChildNotifyLastMsg</title>
        <content>
            <para>This member function is called by the framework to provide a notification message to a child window, from the parent window, so the child window can handle a task.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL SendChildNotifyLastMsg( LRESULT* pResult = NULL  );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pResult</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para> The result generated by the child window to be returned by the parent window.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the child window has handled the message sent to its parent; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SendChildNotifyLastMsg</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> send the current message to the source if it is a message that is reflected.</para>
                    <para>For more information about message reflection, see <legacyLink xlink:href="147a4e0c-51cc-4447-a8e1-c28b4cece578">Handling Reflected Messages</legacyLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__senddlgitemmessage">
        <!--b6f0c0da-2a12-4e25-b898-61d6d20fc03c-->
        <title>CWnd::SendDlgItemMessage</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sends a message to a control.</para>
            <legacySyntax>LRESULT SendDlgItemMessage(
    int nID,
    UINT message,
    WPARAM wParam = 0,
    LPARAM lParam = 0 );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the identifier of the dialog control that will receive the message.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>message</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the message to be sent.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>wParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message-dependent information. </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message-dependent information.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Specifies the value returned by the control's window procedure, or 0 if the control was not found.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SendDlgItemMessage</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function does not return until the message has been processed. </para>
                    <para>Using <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SendDlgItemMessage</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is identical to obtaining a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>* to the given control and calling the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__sendmessage">SendMessage</legacyLink> member function.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#113</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__sendmessage">
        <!--ba72b0bd-57ec-4ef5-bee4-f5dbb971f927-->
        <title>CWnd::SendMessage</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sends the specified message to this window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>LRESULT SendMessage(
    UINT message,
    WPARAM wParam = 0,
    LPARAM lParam = 0 );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>message</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the message to be sent.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>wParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message-dependent information.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message-dependent information.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The result of the message processing; its value depends on the message sent.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <legacyBold>SendMessage</legacyBold> member function calls the window procedure directly and does not return until that window procedure has processed the message. This is in contrast to the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__postmessage">PostMessage</legacyLink> member function, which places the message into the window's message queue and returns immediately. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#101</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__sendmessagetodescendants">
        <!--e1b1a63f-93ed-4fd0-84cf-245b716cb1d7-->
        <title>CWnd::SendMessageToDescendants</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to send the specified Windows message to all descendant windows.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void SendMessageToDescendants(
    UINT message,
    WPARAM wParam = 0,
    LPARAM lParam = 0,
    BOOL bDeep = TRUE,
    BOOL bOnlyPerm = FALSE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>message</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the message to be sent.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>wParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message-dependent information.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message-dependent information.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bDeep</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the level to which to search. If <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, recursively search all children; if <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, search only immediate children.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bOnlyPerm</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the message will be received by temporary windows. If <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, temporary windows can receive the message; if <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, only permanent windows receive the message. For more information on temporary windows see <legacyLink xlink:href="fbea9f38-992c-4091-8dbc-f29e288617d6">Technical Note 3</legacyLink>. </para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If <parameterReference>bDeep</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, the message is sent just to the immediate children of the window; otherwise the message is sent to all descendant windows.</para>
                    <para>If <parameterReference>bDeep</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>bOnlyPerm</parameterReference> are <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the search continues below temporary windows. In this case, only permanent windows encountered during the search receive the message. If <parameterReference>bDeep</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, the message is sent only to the immediate children of the window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#114</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__sendnotifymessage">
        <!--4955765a-162a-42be-8f35-b398d701b5b8-->
        <title>CWnd::SendNotifyMessage</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sends the specified message to the window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL SendNotifyMessage(
    UINT message,
    WPARAM wParam,
    LPARAM lParam );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>message</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the message to be sent.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>wParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message-dependent information.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional message-dependent information.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function is successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the window was created by the calling thread, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SendNotifyMessage</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> calls the window procedure for the window and does not return until the window procedure has processed the message. If the window was created by a different thread, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SendNotifyMessage</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> passes the message to the window procedure and returns immediately; it does not wait for the window procedure to finish processing the message.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setactivewindow">
        <!--0412ac71-cbb1-4f25-bade-56db1f92109a-->
        <title>CWnd::SetActiveWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Makes <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> the active window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* SetActiveWindow();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The window that was previously active. </para>
                    <para>The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetActiveWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function should be used with care since it allows an application to arbitrarily take over the active window and input focus. Normally, Windows takes care of all activation.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setcapture">
        <!--3bfbc59d-c061-4436-b584-0cef7630f7e2-->
        <title>CWnd::SetCapture</title>
        <content>
            <para>Causes all subsequent mouse input to be sent to the current <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object regardless of the position of the cursor.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* SetCapture();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to the window object that previously received all mouse input. It is <languageKeyword>NULL</languageKeyword> if there is no such window. The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>When <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> no longer requires all mouse input, the application should call the                         <externalLink> <linkText>ReleaseCapture</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646261</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> function so that other windows can receive mouse input.</para>
                    <para>While mouse input is captured, no <languageKeyword>WM_NCHITTEST</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>WM_SETCURSOR</languageKeyword> messages are sent to the active window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setcaretpos">
        <!--f85c4213-fa54-49a3-8aaf-6208b96a9765-->
        <title>CWnd::SetCaretPos</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sets the position of the caret.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static void PASCAL SetCaretPos( POINT point );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>point</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the new x and y coordinates (in client coordinates) of the caret.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetCaretPos</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function moves the caret only if it is owned by a window in the current task. <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetCaretPos</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> moves the caret whether or not the caret is hidden. </para>
                    <para>The caret is a shared resource. A window should not move the caret if it does not own the caret.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#115</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setclipboardviewer">
        <!--57ad2adb-b091-49e1-be58-b53ebd1b28a0-->
        <title>CWnd::SetClipboardViewer</title>
        <content>
            <para>Adds this window to the chain of windows that are notified (by means of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_DRAWCLIPBOARD</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message) whenever the content of the Clipboard is changed.</para>
            <legacySyntax>HWND SetClipboardViewer();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A handle to the next window in the Clipboard-viewer chain if successful. Applications should save this handle (it can be stored as a member variable) and use it when responding to Clipboard-viewer chain messages.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A window that is part of the Clipboard-viewer chain must respond to <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__ondrawclipboard">WM_DRAWCLIPBOARD</legacyLink>, <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onchangecbchain">WM_CHANGECBCHAIN</legacyLink>, and <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__ondestroy">WM_DESTROY</legacyLink> messages and pass the message to the next window in the chain. </para>
                    <para>This member function sends a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_DRAWCLIPBOARD</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message to the window. Since the handle to the next window in the Clipboard-viewer chain has not yet been returned, the application should not pass on the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_DRAWCLIPBOARD</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message that it receives during the call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetClipboardViewer</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. </para>
                    <para>To remove itself from the Clipboard-viewer chain, an application must call the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__changeclipboardchain">ChangeClipboardChain</legacyLink> member function.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setdlgctrlid">
        <!--3832a584-e88d-458c-96dc-d95e3a5a5c13-->
        <title>CWnd::SetDlgCtrlID</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sets the window ID or control ID for the window to a new value.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int SetDlgCtrlID( int nID );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The new value to set for the control's identifier.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The previous identifier of the window, if successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The window can be any child window, not only a control in a dialog box. The window cannot be a top-level window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setdlgitemint">
        <!--1c5d30e9-4722-41f5-8bd1-b2023c569379-->
        <title>CWnd::SetDlgItemInt</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sets the text of a given control in a dialog box to the string representation of a specified integer value.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void SetDlgItemInt(
    int nID,
    UINT nValue,
    BOOL bSigned = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the integer ID of the control to be changed.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nValue</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the integer value used to generate the item text.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bSigned</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the integer value is signed or unsigned. If this parameter is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, <parameterReference>nValue</parameterReference> is signed. If this parameter is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> and <parameterReference>nValue</parameterReference> is less than 0, a minus sign is placed before the first digit in the string. If this parameter is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, <parameterReference>nValue</parameterReference> is unsigned.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetDlgItemInt</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> sends a                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_SETTEXT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632644</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message to the given control.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__setdlgitemtext">CWnd::SetDlgItemText</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setdlgitemtext">
        <!--219c44dd-2386-4789-8225-dfd5522db4ec-->
        <title>CWnd::SetDlgItemText</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sets the caption or text of a control owned by a window or dialog box.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void SetDlgItemText(
    int nID,
    LPCTSTR lpszString );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the control whose text is to be set.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpszString</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="7cacc59c-425f-40f1-8f5b-6db921318ec9">CString</legacyLink> object or null-terminated string that contains the text to be copied to the control.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetDlgItemText</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> sends a                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_SETTEXT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632644</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message to the given control.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#116</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setforegroundwindow">
        <!--b757011a-4508-4b69-a44a-91b240b837a7-->
        <title>CWnd::SetForegroundWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Puts the thread that created the window into the foreground and activates the window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL SetForegroundWindow();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function is successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Keyboard input is directed to the window, and various visual cues are changed for the user. The foreground window is the window with which the user is currently working. The foreground window applies only to top-level windows (frame windows or dialogs boxes). </para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__findwindow">CWnd::FindWindow</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setfocus">
        <!--13db2a0d-120d-4d9a-92c1-f8c47844657e-->
        <title>CWnd::SetFocus</title>
        <content>
            <para>Claims the input focus.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* SetFocus();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to the window object that previously had the input focus. It is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if there is no such window. The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The input focus directs all subsequent keyboard input to this window. Any window that previously had the input focus loses it. </para>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetFocus</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function sends a                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_KILLFOCUS</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646282</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message to the window that loses the input focus and a                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_SETFOCUS</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms646283</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message to the window that receives the input focus. It also activates either the window or its parent. </para>
                    <para>If the current window is active but does not have the focus (that is, no window has the focus), any key pressed will produce the messages <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onsyschar">WM_SYSCHAR</legacyLink>, <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onsyskeydown">WM_SYSKEYDOWN</legacyLink>, or <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onsyskeyup">WM_SYSKEYUP</legacyLink>. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setfont">
        <!--fe7308ce-0f51-4f59-9197-f1478295e2ad-->
        <title>CWnd::SetFont</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sends the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_SETFONT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message to the window to use the specified font.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void SetFont(
    CFont* pFont,
    BOOL bRedraw = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pFont</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CFont</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bRedraw</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para> <languageKeyword>TRUE</languageKeyword> for the window to redraw immediately after it processes the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_SETFONT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message; otherwise <languageKeyword>FALSE</languageKeyword>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This method has no effect unless the window processes the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_SETFONT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message. Many MFC classes that derive from <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> process this message because they are attached to a predefined window class that includes a message handler for the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_SETFONT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message. To use this method, classes that you derive from <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> must define a method handler for the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_SETFONT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__seticon">
        <!--5bc2b1a0-a6b6-49f5-a976-a7e56152918e-->
        <title>CWnd::SetIcon</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to set the handle to a specific icon, as identified by <parameterReference>hIcon</parameterReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>HICON SetIcon(
    HICON hIcon,
    BOOL bBigIcon );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>hIcon</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A handle to a previous icon.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bBigIcon</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies a 32 pixel by 32 pixel icon if <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>; specifies a 16 pixel by 16 pixel icon if <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A handle to an icon.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>When the window class is registered, it selects an icon. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__getsystemmenu">CWnd::GetSystemMenu</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setlayeredwindowattributes">
        <!--5a8c8e9b-6533-4c04-bb32-1179898d1ba0-->
        <title>CWnd::SetLayeredWindowAttributes</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sets the opacity and transparency color key of a layered window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL SetLayeredWindowAttributes(
    COLORREF crKey,
    BYTE bAlpha,
    DWORD dwFlags );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>crKey</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a <legacyBold>COLORREF</legacyBold> value that specifies the transparency color key to be used when composing the layered window. All pixels painted by the window in this color will be transparent. To generate a <legacyBold>COLORREF</legacyBold>, use the RGB macro.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bAlpha</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Alpha value used to describe the opacity of the layered window. For more information, see the <legacyBold>SourceConstantAlpha</legacyBold> member of the                                 <externalLink> <linkText>BLENDFUNCTION</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd183393</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> structure. When <parameterReference>bAlpha</parameterReference> is 0, the window is completely transparent. When <parameterReference>bAlpha</parameterReference> is 255, the window is opaque.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies an action to take. This parameter can be one or more of the following values. For a list of possible values, see                                <externalLink> <linkText>SetLayeredWindowAttributes</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633540</linkUri>
                                </externalLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function succeeds; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>SetLayeredWindowAttributes</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633540</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setmenu">
        <!--548b9ec2-77f2-4127-8a46-ce96c4c269c9-->
        <title>CWnd::SetMenu</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sets the current menu to the specified menu.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL SetMenu( CMenu* pMenu );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pMenu</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the new menu. If this parameter is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the current menu is removed.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the menu is changed; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Causes the window to be redrawn to reflect the menu change. </para>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetMenu</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> will not destroy a previous menu. An application should call the <legacyLink xlink:href="40cacfdc-d45c-4ec7-bf28-991c72812499#cmenu__destroymenu">CMenu::DestroyMenu</legacyLink> member function to accomplish this task.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="40cacfdc-d45c-4ec7-bf28-991c72812499#cmenu__loadmenu">CMenu::LoadMenu</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setowner">
        <!--c15bc442-1957-4f12-bde1-9f07dabe18b9-->
        <title>CWnd::SetOwner</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sets the current window's owner to the specified window object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void SetOwner( CWnd* pOwnerWnd );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pOwnerWnd</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the new owner of the window object. If this parameter is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the window object has no owner.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This owner can then receive command messages from the current window object. By default, the parent of the current window is its owner.</para>
                    <para>It is often useful to establish connections between window objects that are unrelated to the window hierarchy. For example, <legacyLink xlink:href="e868da26-5e07-4607-9651-e2f863ad9059">CToolBar</legacyLink> sends notifications to its owner instead of to its parent. This allows the toolbar to become the child of one window (such as an OLE container application window) while sending notifications to another window (such as the in-place frame window). Furthermore, when a server window is deactivated or activated during in-place editing, any window owned by the frame window is hidden or shown. This ownership is explicitly set with a call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetOwner</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                    <para>The ownership concept of this function is different from the ownership concept of                         <externalLink> <linkText>GetWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633515</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setparent">
        <!--ffc43749-66ac-424b-8c26-92317384d9c4-->
        <title>CWnd::SetParent</title>
        <content>
            <para>Changes the parent window of a child window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>CWnd* SetParent( CWnd* pWndNewParent );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pWndNewParent</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the new parent window.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to the previous parent window object if successful. The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the child window is visible, Windows performs the appropriate redrawing and repainting.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setproperty">
        <!--9f42cb90-c27e-41a4-ad62-b3ead53a5aca-->
        <title>CWnd::SetProperty</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to set the OLE control property specified by <parameterReference>dwDispID</parameterReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void AFX_CDECL SetProperty(
    DISPID dwDispID,
    VARTYPE vtProp, ... );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwDispID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the property to be set.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>vtProp</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the type of the property to be set. For possible values, see the Remarks section for <legacyLink xlink:href="3ed98daf-cdc7-4374-8a0c-cf695a8d3657#coledispatchdriver__invokehelper">COleDispatchDriver::InvokeHelper</legacyLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>...</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A single parameter of the type specified by <parameterReference>vtProp</parameterReference>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>This function should be called only on a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object that represents an OLE control.</para>
                    </alert>
                    <para>For more information about using this member function with OLE Control Containers, see the article <legacyLink xlink:href="ef9b2480-92d6-4191-b16e-8055c4fd7b73">ActiveX Control Containers: Programming ActiveX Controls in an ActiveX Control Container</legacyLink>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setredraw">
        <!--f3bebab9-7787-44c4-b93f-62f91786e586-->
        <title>CWnd::SetRedraw</title>
        <content>
            <para>An application calls <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetRedraw</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to allow changes to be redrawn or to prevent changes from being redrawn.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void SetRedraw( BOOL bRedraw = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bRedraw</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the state of the redraw flag. If this parameter is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the redraw flag is set; if <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, the flag is cleared.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function sets or clears the redraw flag. While the redraw flag is cleared, the contents will not be updated after each change and will not be repainted until the redraw flag is set. For example, an application that needs to add several items to a list box can clear the redraw flag, add the items, and then set the redraw flag. Finally, the application can call the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__invalidate">Invalidate</legacyLink> or <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__invalidaterect">InvalidateRect</legacyLink> member function to cause the list box to be repainted.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#117</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setscrollinfo">
        <!--f994a9e8-5429-4808-be60-563fe6616fe8-->
        <title>CWnd::SetScrollInfo</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to set the information that the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SCROLLINFO</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> structure maintains about a scroll bar.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL SetScrollInfo(
    int nBar,
    LPSCROLLINFO lpScrollInfo,
    BOOL bRedraw = TRUE  );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nBar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the scroll bar is a control or part of a window's nonclient area. If it is part of the nonclient area, nBar also indicates whether the scroll bar is positioned horizontally, vertically, or both. It must be one of the following:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_CTL</legacyBold>Contains the parameters for a scroll bar control. The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>m_hWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> data member must be the handle of the scroll bar control.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_HORZ</legacyBold>Specifies that the window is a horizontal scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_VERT</legacyBold>Specifies that the window is a vertical scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpScrollInfo</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a                                 <externalLink> <linkText>SCROLLINFO</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb787537</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> structure. See the <token>winSDK</token> for more information about this structure.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bRedraw</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the scroll bar should be redrawn to reflect the new position.
