If <parameterReference>bRedraw</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the scroll bar is redrawn. If it is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, it is not redrawn. The scroll bar is redrawn by default.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If successful, the return is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>. Otherwise, it is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The                         <externalLink> <linkText>SCROLLINFO</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb787537</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> structure contains information about a scroll bar, including the minimum and maximum scrolling positions, the page size, and the position of the scroll box (the thumb). See the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SCROLLINFO</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> structure topic in the <token>winSDK</token> for more information about changing the structure defaults.</para>
                    <para>The MFC Windows message handlers that indicate scroll-bar position, <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onhscroll">CWnd::OnHScroll</legacyLink> and <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__onvscroll">CWnd::OnVScroll</legacyLink>, provide only 16 bits of position data. <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__getscrollinfo">GetScrollInfo</legacyLink> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetScrollInfo</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> provide 32 bits of scroll-bar position data. Thus, an application can call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetScrollInfo</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> while processing either <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::OnHScroll</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::OnVScroll</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to obtain 32-bit scroll-bar position data.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para> <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__getscrollinfo">CWnd::GetScrollInfo</legacyLink> enables applications to use 32-bit scroll-bar positions. </para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setscrollpos">
        <!--f52fb650-957c-4fea-b3fa-c51bacb47754-->
        <title>CWnd::SetScrollPos</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sets the current position of a scroll box and, if requested, redraws the scroll bar to reflect the new position of the scroll box.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int SetScrollPos(
    int nBar,
    int nPos,
    BOOL bRedraw = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nBar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the scroll bar to be set. This parameter can be either of the following:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_HORZ</legacyBold>Sets the position of the scroll box in the horizontal scroll bar of the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_VERT</legacyBold>Sets the position of the scroll box in the vertical scroll bar of the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nPos</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the new position of the scroll box. It must be within the scrolling range.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bRedraw</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the scroll bar should be repainted to reflect the new scroll-box position. If this parameter is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the scroll bar is repainted; if <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, the scroll bar is not repainted.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The previous position of the scroll box.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Setting <parameterReference>bRedraw</parameterReference> to <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold> is useful whenever the scroll bar will be redrawn by a subsequent call to another function.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setscrollrange">
        <!--fe1e818f-e4ac-4aa6-9673-6aaf7cc56ce7-->
        <title>CWnd::SetScrollRange</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sets minimum and maximum position values for the given scroll bar.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void SetScrollRange(
    int nBar,
    int nMinPos,
    int nMaxPos,
    BOOL bRedraw = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nBar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the scroll bar to be set. This parameter can be either of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_HORZ</legacyBold>Sets the range of the horizontal scroll bar of the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_VERT</legacyBold>Sets the range of the vertical scroll bar of the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nMinPos</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the minimum scrolling position.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nMaxPos</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the maximum scrolling position.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bRedraw</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the scroll bar should be redrawn to reflect the change. If <parameterReference>bRedraw</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the scroll bar is redrawn; if <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, the scroll bar is not redrawn.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>It can also be used to hide or show standard scroll bars. </para>
                    <para>An application should not call this function to hide a scroll bar while processing a scroll-bar notification message. </para>
                    <para>If the call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetScrollRange</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> immediately follows a call to the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__setscrollpos">SetScrollPos</legacyLink> member function, the <parameterReference>bRedraw</parameterReference> parameter in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetScrollPos</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function should be 0 to prevent the scroll bar from being drawn twice. </para>
                    <para>The default range for a standard scroll bar is 0 through 100. The default range for a scroll bar control is empty (both the <parameterReference>nMinPos</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>nMaxPos</parameterReference> values are 0). The difference between the values specified by <parameterReference>nMinPos</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>nMaxPos</parameterReference> must not be greater than <legacyBold>INT_MAX</legacyBold>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__settimer">
        <!--8f7d77c7-7f77-4270-8441-1c357649c1c2-->
        <title>CWnd::SetTimer</title>
        <content>
            <para>Installs a system timer.</para>
            <legacySyntax>UINT_PTR SetTimer(
    UINT_PTR nIDEvent,
    UINT nElapse,
    void (CALLBACK* lpfnTimer )(HWND,
    UINT,
    UINT_PTR,
    DWORD ) );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nIDEvent</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies a nonzero timer identifier. If the timer identifier is unique, this same value is returned by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetTimer</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. Otherwise, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetTimer</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> determines a new unique value and returns that. For a window timer (which has a NULL callback function), the value must be unique only for other windows timers that are associated with the current window. For a callback timer, the value must be unique for all timers in all processes. Therefore, when you create a callback timer, it is more likely that the returned value might differ from the value you specify.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nElapse</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the time-out value, or interval, in milliseconds.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpfnTimer</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the address of the application-supplied <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>TimerProc</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> callback function that processes the                                 <externalLink> <linkText>WM_TIMER</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms644902</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> messages. If this parameter is <languageKeyword>NULL</languageKeyword>, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_TIMER</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages are placed in the message queue of the application and handled by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The timer identifier of the new timer if the function is successful. This value may or may not be equal to the value passed in through the <parameterReference>nIDEvent</parameterReference> parameter. An application should always pass the return value to the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__killtimer">KillTimer</legacyLink> member function to kill the timer. Nonzero if successful; otherwise, 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>An interval value is specified, and every time the interval elapses, the system posts a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_TIMER</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message to the installing message queue of the installing application or passes the message to an application-defined <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>TimerProc</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> callback function. </para>
                    <para>The <parameterReference>lpfnTimer</parameterReference> callback function need not be named <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>TimerProc</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, but it must be declared as static and defined as follows.</para>
                    <code>void CALLBACK TimerProc(
   HWND hWnd,      // handle of CWnd that called SetTimer
   UINT nMsg,      // WM_TIMER
   UINT_PTR nIDEvent,   // timer identification
   DWORD dwTime    // system time
);</code>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This example uses <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::SetTimer</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::OnTimer</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::KillTimer</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to handle <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_TIMER</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages. The first timer is set up to send a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_TIMER</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message to the main frame window every 2 seconds in <codeInline>OnStartTimer</codeInline>. The <codeInline>OnTimer</codeInline> event handler handles <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_TIMER</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages for the main frame window. This method causes the PC speaker to beep every 2 seconds. The second timer sends a message to the callback function every 3.75 seconds. <codeInline>OnStopTimer</codeInline> will stop both timers by calling <codeInline>CWnd::KillTimer</codeInline> for each timer ID.</para>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#118</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setwindowcontexthelpid">
        <!--b7617f56-b5f5-4ca2-9629-0bf93cd17284-->
        <title>CWnd::SetWindowContextHelpId</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to associate a help context identifier with the specified window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL SetWindowContextHelpId( DWORD dwContextHelpId );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwContextHelpId</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The help context identifier.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function is successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If a child window does not have a help context identifier, it inherits the identifier of its parent window. Likewise, if an owned window does not have a help context identifier, it inherits the identifier of its owner window. This inheritance of help context identifiers allows an application to set just one identifier for a dialog box and all of its controls.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#119</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setwindowplacement">
        <!--4a37d32f-9d57-4f27-82bc-0f5f4c8b8a09-->
        <title>CWnd::SetWindowPlacement</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sets the show state and the normal (restored), minimized, and maximized positions for a window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL SetWindowPlacement( const WINDOWPLACEMENT* lpwndpl );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpwndpl</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="ea7d61f6-eb57-478e-9b08-7c1d07091aa8">WINDOWPLACEMENT</legacyLink> structure that specifies the new show state and positions.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function is successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setwindowpos">
        <!--ff6b37f3-9ebb-49d8-b81c-5114182bd35b-->
        <title>CWnd::SetWindowPos</title>
        <content>
            <para>Changes the size, position, and Z-order of child, pop-up, and top-level windows.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL SetWindowPos(
    const CWnd* pWndInsertAfter,
    int x,
    int y,
    int cx,
    int cy,
    UINT nFlags );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pWndInsertAfter</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Identifies the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object that will precede (be higher than) this <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object in the Z-order. This parameter can be a pointer to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> or a <legacyBold>Pointer</legacyBold> to one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>wndBottom</legacyBold>Places the window at the bottom of the Z-order. If this <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a topmost window, the window loses its topmost status; the system places the window at the bottom of all other windows.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>wndTop</legacyBold>Places the window at the top of the Z-order.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>wndTopMost</legacyBold>Places the window above all non-topmost windows. The window maintains its topmost position even when it is deactivated.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>wndNoTopMost</legacyBold>Repositions the window to the top of all non-topmost windows (that is, behind all topmost windows). This flag has no effect if the window is already a non-topmost window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                            <para>For rules about how to use this parameter, see the "Remarks" section of this topic. </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>x</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the new position of the left side of the window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>y</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the new position of the top of the window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>cx</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the new width of the window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>cy</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the new height of the window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies sizing and positioning options. This parameter can be a combination of the following flags:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SWP_DRAWFRAME</legacyBold>Draws a frame (defined when the window was created) around the window. </para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SWP_FRAMECHANGED</legacyBold>Sends a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_NCCALCSIZE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_NCCALCSIZE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is sent only when the window's size is being changed.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SWP_HIDEWINDOW</legacyBold>Hides the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOACTIVATE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or the non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the <parameterReference>pWndInsertAfter</parameterReference> parameter).</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SWP_NOCOPYBITS</legacyBold>Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOMOVE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Retains current position (ignores the                                         <legacyItalic>x</legacyItalic> and                                         <legacyItalic>y</legacyItalic> parameters).</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SWP_NOOWNERZORDER</legacyBold>Does not change the owner window's position in the Z-order.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SWP_NOREDRAW</legacyBold>Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the moved window. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that must be redrawn.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SWP_NOREPOSITION</legacyBold>Same as <legacyBold>SWP_NOOWNERZORDER</legacyBold>. </para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SWP_NOSENDCHANGING</legacyBold>Prevents the window from receiving the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOSIZE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Retains current size (ignores the <parameterReference>cx</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>cy</parameterReference> parameters).</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOZORDER</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Retains current ordering (ignores <parameterReference>pWndInsertAfter</parameterReference>).</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SWP_SHOWWINDOW</legacyBold>Displays the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function is successful; otherwise, 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Windows are ordered on the screen according to their Z-order; the window at the top of the Z-order appears on top of all other windows in the order.</para>
                    <para>All coordinates for child windows are client coordinates (relative to the upper-left corner of the parent window's client area).</para>
                    <para>A window can be moved to the top of the Z-order either by setting the <parameterReference>pWndInsertAfter</parameterReference> parameter to <legacyBold>&amp;wndTopMost</legacyBold> and ensuring that the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOZORDER</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> flag is not set or by setting a window's Z-order so that it is above any existing topmost windows. When a non-topmost window is made topmost, its owned windows are also made topmost. Its owners are not changed. </para>
                    <para>A topmost window is no longer topmost if it is repositioned to the bottom ( <legacyBold>&amp;wndBottom</legacyBold>) of the Z-order or after any non-topmost window. When a topmost window is made non-topmost, all of its owners and its owned windows are also made non-topmost windows.</para>
                    <para>If neither <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOACTIVATE</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> nor <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SWP_NOZORDER</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is specified (that is, when the application requests that a window be simultaneously activated and placed in the specified Z-order), the value specified in <parameterReference>pWndInsertAfter</parameterReference> is used only in the following circumstances:  </para>
                    <list class="bullet">
                        <listItem>
                            <para>Neither <legacyBold>&amp;wndTopMost</legacyBold> nor <legacyBold>&amp;wndNoTopMost</legacyBold> is specified in the <parameterReference>pWndInsertAfter</parameterReference> parameter.</para>
                        </listItem>
                        <listItem>
                            <para>This window is not the active window.</para>
                        </listItem>
                    </list>
                    <para>An application cannot activate an inactive window without also bringing it to the top of the Z-order. Applications can change the Z-order of an activated window without restrictions.</para>
                    <para>A non-topmost window may own a topmost window, but not vice versa. Any window (for example, a dialog box) owned by a topmost window is itself made a topmost window to ensure that all owned windows stay above their owner.</para>
                    <para>With Windows versions 3.1 and later, windows can be moved to the top of the Z-order and locked there by setting their <legacyBold>WS_EX_TOPMOST</legacyBold> styles. Such a topmost window maintains its topmost position even when deactivated. For example, selecting the WinHelp Always On Top command makes the Help window topmost, and it then remains visible when you return to your application.</para>
                    <para>To create a topmost window, call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetWindowPos</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with the <parameterReference>pWndInsertAfter</parameterReference> parameter equal to <legacyBold>&amp;wndTopMost</legacyBold>, or set the <legacyBold>WS_EX_TOPMOST</legacyBold> style when you create the window.</para>
                    <para>If the Z-order contains any windows with the <legacyBold>WS_EX_TOPMOST</legacyBold> style, a window moved with the <legacyBold>&amp;wndTopMost</legacyBold> value is placed at the top of all non-topmost windows, but below any topmost windows. When an application activates an inactive window without the <legacyBold>WS_EX_TOPMOST</legacyBold> bit, the window is moved above all non-topmost windows but below any topmost windows.</para>
                    <para>If <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetWindowPos</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is called when the <parameterReference>pWndInsertAfter</parameterReference> parameter is <legacyBold>&amp;wndBottom</legacyBold> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a topmost window, the window loses its topmost status ( <legacyBold>WS_EX_TOPMOST</legacyBold> is cleared), and the system places the window at the bottom of the Z-order.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#120</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setwindowrgn">
        <!--938930e2-f166-4b09-98ea-1757a6d58b9a-->
        <title>CWnd::SetWindowRgn</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to set a window's region.</para>
            <legacySyntax>int SetWindowRgn(
    HRGN hRgn,
    BOOL bRedraw );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>hRgn</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A handle to a region. </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bRedraw</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>If <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the operating system redraws the window after setting the region; otherwise, it does not. Typically, set <parameterReference>bRedraw</parameterReference> to <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> if the window is visible. If set to <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the system sends the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages to the window.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The coordinates of a window's window region are relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area of the window. </para>
                    <para>After a successful call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>SetWindowRgn</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, the operating system owns the region specified by the region handle <parameterReference>hRgn</parameterReference>. The operating system does not make a copy of the region, so do not make any further function calls with this region handle, and do not close this region handle. </para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__setwindowtext">
        <!--d31d7a10-d215-4e62-80aa-fba2a51effb3-->
        <title>CWnd::SetWindowText</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sets the window's title to the specified text.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void SetWindowText( LPCTSTR lpszString );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpszString</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="7cacc59c-425f-40f1-8f5b-6db921318ec9">CString</legacyLink> object or null-terminated string to be used as the new title or control text.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If the window is a control, the text within the control is set. </para>
                    <para>This function causes a                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_SETTEXT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms632644</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message to be sent to this window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#121</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__showcaret">
        <!--0fa9ffdb-e941-496f-ad0b-6a253c951e9f-->
        <title>CWnd::ShowCaret</title>
        <content>
            <para>Shows the caret on the screen at the caret's current position.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void ShowCaret();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Once shown, the caret begins flashing automatically. </para>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ShowCaret</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function shows the caret only if it has a current shape and has not been hidden two or more times consecutively. If the caret is not owned by this window, the caret is not shown.</para>
                    <para>Hiding the caret is cumulative. If the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__hidecaret">HideCaret</legacyLink> member function has been called five times consecutively, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ShowCaret</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> must be called five times to show the caret. </para>
                    <para>The caret is a shared resource. The window should show the caret only when it has the input focus or is active.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__createcaret">CWnd::CreateCaret</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__showownedpopups">
        <!--0f7c9a14-5bbc-4e1e-b368-5bf4cb82e73e-->
        <title>CWnd::ShowOwnedPopups</title>
        <content>
            <para>Shows or hides all pop-up windows owned by this window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void ShowOwnedPopups( BOOL bShow = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bShow</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether pop-up windows are to be shown or hidden. If this parameter is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, all hidden pop-up windows are shown. If this parameter is <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>, all visible pop-up windows are hidden.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__setwindowpos">CWnd::SetWindowPos</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__showscrollbar">
        <!--3c3c391b-672a-4ea6-a5d6-0bf84da54fc9-->
        <title>CWnd::ShowScrollBar</title>
        <content>
            <para>Shows or hides a scroll bar.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void ShowScrollBar(
    UINT nBar,
    BOOL bShow = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nBar</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether the scroll bar is a control or part of a window's nonclient area. If it is part of the nonclient area, <parameterReference>nBar</parameterReference> also indicates whether the scroll bar is positioned horizontally, vertically, or both. It must be one of the following:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_BOTH</legacyBold>Specifies the horizontal and vertical scroll bars of the window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_HORZ</legacyBold>Specifies that the window is a horizontal scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SB_VERT</legacyBold>Specifies that the window is a vertical scroll bar.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bShow</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies whether Windows shows or hides the scroll bar. If this parameter is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, the scroll bar is shown; otherwise the scroll bar is hidden.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>An application should not call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ShowScrollBar</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to hide a scroll bar while processing a scroll-bar notification message.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__showwindow">
        <!--2b2584c6-e6f6-46e1-ad6a-04ed49ab83e0-->
        <title>CWnd::ShowWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Sets the visibility state of the window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL ShowWindow( int nCmdShow );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nCmdShow</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies how the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is to be shown. It must be one of the following values:</para>
                            <list class="bullet">
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SW_HIDE</legacyBold>Hides this window and passes activation to another window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SW_MINIMIZE</legacyBold>Minimizes the window and activates the top-level window in the system's list.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SW_RESTORE</legacyBold>Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, Windows restores it to its original size and position.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SW_SHOW</legacyBold>Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED</legacyBold>Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SW_SHOWMINIMIZED</legacyBold>Activates the window and displays it as an icon.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE</legacyBold>Displays the window as an icon. The window that is currently active remains active.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SW_SHOWNA</legacyBold>Displays the window in its current state. The window that is currently active remains active.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE</legacyBold>Displays the window in its most recent size and position. The window that is currently active remains active.</para>
                                </listItem>
                                <listItem>
                                    <para> <legacyBold>SW_SHOWNORMAL</legacyBold>Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, Windows restores it to its original size and position.</para>
                                </listItem>
                            </list>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the window was previously visible; 0 if the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> was previously hidden.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ShowWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> must be called only once per application for the main window with <legacyLink xlink:href="e426a3cd-0d15-40d6-bd55-beaa5feb2343#cwinapp__m_ncmdshow">CWinApp::m_nCmdShow</legacyLink>. Subsequent calls to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ShowWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> must use one of the values listed above instead of the one specified by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWinApp::m_nCmdShow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__calcwindowrect">CWnd::CalcWindowRect</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__subclassdlgitem">
        <!--5a7564b9-310e-472a-8b6e-4e2f22d49b22-->
        <title>CWnd::SubclassDlgItem</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to "dynamically subclass" a control created from a dialog template and attach it to this <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL SubclassDlgItem(
    UINT nID,
    CWnd* pParent );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nID</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The control's ID.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pParent</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>The control's parent (usually a dialog box).</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function is successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>When a control is dynamically subclassed, windows messages will route through the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>'s message map and call message handlers in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>'s class first. Messages that are passed to the base class will be passed to the default message handler in the control.</para>
                    <para>This member function attaches the Windows control to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object and replaces the control's <legacyBold>WndProc</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>AfxWndProc</legacyBold> functions. The function stores the old <legacyBold>WndProc</legacyBold> in the location returned by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GetSuperWndProcAddr</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#122</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__subclasswindow">
        <!--f781f399-51af-4bf9-88bd-efe5cdaae344-->
        <title>CWnd::SubclassWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to "dynamically subclass" a window and attach it to this <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL SubclassWindow( HWND hWnd );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>hWnd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A handle to the window.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function is successful; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>When a window is dynamically subclassed, windows messages will route through the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>'s message map and call message handlers in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>'s class first. Messages that are passed to the base class will be passed to the default message handler in the window.</para>
                    <para>This member function attaches the Windows control to a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object and replaces the window's <legacyBold>WndProc</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>AfxWndProc</legacyBold> functions. The function stores a pointer to the old <legacyBold>WndProc</legacyBold> in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
                    <alert class="note">
                        <para>The window must not already be attached to an MFC object when this function is called.</para>
                    </alert>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#123</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__unlockwindowupdate">
        <!--a8bb5380-3d8b-465a-afde-5a8ca1b9def9-->
        <title>CWnd::UnlockWindowUpdate</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to unlock a window that was locked with <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd::LockWindowUpdate</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void UnlockWindowUpdate();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Only one window at a time can be locked using <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>LockWindowUpdate</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>. See <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__lockwindowupdate">CWnd::LockWindowUpdate</legacyLink> or the Win32 function                         <externalLink> <linkText>LockWindowUpdate</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145034</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> for more information on locking windows.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__unsubclasswindow">
        <!--efe988a1-40f0-4c1e-9145-b2e0fdf279fa-->
        <title>CWnd::UnsubclassWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to set <legacyBold>WndProc</legacyBold> back to its original value and detach the window identified by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>HWND</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> from the <legacyBold>CWnd </legacyBold>object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>HWND UnsubclassWindow();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A handle to the unsubclassed window.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <!--startsnip-->
                            <para>See the example for <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__subclasswindow">CWnd::SubclassWindow</legacyLink>.</para>
                        <!--endsnip-->
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__updatedata">
        <!--593893c2-7039-43fd-a165-f91329abd126-->
        <title>CWnd::UpdateData</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to initialize data in a dialog box, or to retrieve and validate dialog data.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL UpdateData( BOOL bSaveAndValidate = TRUE );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bSaveAndValidate</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Flag that indicates whether dialog box is being initialized ( <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold>) or data is being retrieved ( <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>).</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the operation is successful; otherwise 0. If                         <legacyItalic>bSaveAndValidat</legacyItalic>e is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, then a return value of nonzero means that the data is successfully validated.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The framework automatically calls <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>UpdateData</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with <parameterReference>bSaveAndValidate</parameterReference> set to <legacyBold>FALSE</legacyBold> when a modal dialog box is created in the default implementation of <legacyLink xlink:href="ca64b77e-2cd2-47e3-8eff-c2645ad578f9#cdialog__oninitdialog">CDialog::OnInitDialog</legacyLink>. The call occurs before the dialog box is visible. The default implementation of <legacyLink xlink:href="ca64b77e-2cd2-47e3-8eff-c2645ad578f9#cdialog__onok">CDialog::OnOK</legacyLink> calls this member function with <parameterReference>bSaveAndValidate</parameterReference> set to <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold> to retrieve the data, and if successful, will close the dialog box. (If the Cancel button is clicked in the dialog box, the dialog box is closed without the data being retrieved.)</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__updatedialogcontrols">
        <!--9418dac3-6e84-4355-ac06-661fa32f7e6e-->
        <title>CWnd::UpdateDialogControls</title>
        <content>
            <para>Call this member function to update the state of dialog buttons and other controls in a dialog box or window that uses the <legacyLink xlink:href="c4de3c21-2d2e-4b89-a4ce-d0c0e2d9edc4">ON_UPDATE_COMMAND_UI</legacyLink> callback mechanism.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void UpdateDialogControls(
    CCmdTarget* pTarget,
    BOOL bDisableIfNoHndler );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pTarget</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to the main frame window of the application, and is used for routing update messages                                <legacyItalic>.</legacyItalic>
                            </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bDisableIfNoHndler</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Flag that indicates whether a control that has no update handler should be automatically displayed as disabled.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>If a child control does not have a handler and <parameterReference>bDisableIfNoHndler</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>TRUE</legacyBold>, then the child control will be disabled.</para>
                    <para>The framework calls this member function for controls in dialog bars or toolbars as part of the application's idle processing.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__updatelayeredwindow">
        <!--9035dce1-8560-4ea4-94a8-f6e0ba2b2021-->
        <title>CWnd::UpdateLayeredWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Updates the position, size, shape, content, and translucency of a layered window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL UpdateLayeredWindow(
    CDC* pDCDst,
    POINT * pptDst,
    SIZE * psize,
    CDC * pDCSrc,
    POINT * pptSrc,
    COLORREF crKey,
    BLENDFUNCTION * pblend,
    DWORD dwFlags );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pDCDst</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a device context for the screen. It is used for palette color matching when the window contents are updated. If <parameterReference>pDCDst</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the default palette will be used.</para>
                            <para>If <parameterReference>pDCSrc</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, <parameterReference>pDCDst</parameterReference> must be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>. </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pptDst</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a <legacyBold>POINT</legacyBold> structure specifying the new screen position of the layered window. If the current position is not changing, <parameterReference>pptDst</parameterReference> can be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>psize</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a <legacyBold>SIZE</legacyBold> structure that specifies the new size of the layered window. If the size of the window is not changing,                                 <legacyItalic>psize</legacyItalic> can be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                            <para>If <parameterReference>pDCSrc</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>,                                 <legacyItalic>psize</legacyItalic> must be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>. </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pDCSrc</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a DC for the surface that defines the layered window. If the shape and visual context of the window are not changing, <parameterReference>pDCSrc</parameterReference> can be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pptSrc</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a <legacyBold>POINT</legacyBold> structure that specifies the location of the layer in the device context.</para>
                            <para>If <parameterReference>pDCSrc</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, <parameterReference>pptSrc</parameterReference> should be <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>. </para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>crKey</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a <legacyBold>COLORREF</legacyBold> value that specifies the transparency color key to be used when composing the layered window. All pixels painted by the window in this color will be transparent. To generate a <legacyBold>COLORREF</legacyBold>, use the RGB macro.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm>
                            <legacyItalic>pblend</legacyItalic>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Pointer to a                                 <externalLink> <linkText>BLENDFUNCTION</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd183393</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> structure that specifies the transparency value to be used when composing the layered window.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies an action to take. This parameter can be one or more of the following values. For a list of possible values, see                                <externalLink> <linkText>UpdateLayeredWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633556</linkUri>
                                </externalLink>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>Nonzero if the function succeeds; otherwise 0.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>This member function emulates the functionality of the function                         <externalLink> <linkText>UpdateLayeredWindow</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms633556</linkUri>
                        </externalLink>, as described in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__updatewindow">
        <!--8c15f847-c9ca-4cd0-8a89-5ece5eae80e6-->
        <title>CWnd::UpdateWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Updates the client area by sending a                 <externalLink> <linkText>WM_PAINT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145213</linkUri>
                </externalLink> message if the update region is not empty.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void UpdateWindow();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>UpdateWindow</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function sends a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_PAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> message directly, bypassing the application queue. If the update region is empty, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_PAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is not sent.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Example</title>
                <content>
                    <codeReference>NVC_MFCWindowing#124</codeReference>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__validaterect">
        <!--0d35b204-1d3f-4033-9415-c952c824e547-->
        <title>CWnd::ValidateRect</title>
        <content>
            <para>Validates the client area within the given rectangle by removing the rectangle from the update region of the window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void ValidateRect( LPCRECT lpRect );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Points to a <legacyLink xlink:href="dee4e752-15d6-4db4-b68f-1ad65b2ed6ca">CRect</legacyLink> object or <legacyLink xlink:href="1b3160de-64e9-40d1-89eb-af3e0fd6acf0">RECT</legacyLink> structure that contains client coordinates of the rectangle to be removed from the update region. If <parameterReference>lpRect</parameterReference> is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the entire window is validated.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__beginpaint">BeginPaint</legacyLink> member function automatically validates the entire client area. Neither the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ValidateRect</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> nor the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__validatergn">ValidateRgn</legacyLink> member function should be called if a portion of the update region needs to be validated before                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_PAINT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145213</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> is next generated. </para>
                    <para>Windows continues to generate <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WM_PAINT</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> messages until the current update region is validated.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__validatergn">
        <!--2955d3fc-ce8d-4807-b0cc-d3398b7b49b8-->
        <title>CWnd::ValidateRgn</title>
        <content>
            <para>Validates the client area within the given region by removing the region from the current update region of the window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>void ValidateRgn( CRgn* pRgn );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>pRgn</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A pointer to a <legacyLink xlink:href="d904da84-76aa-481e-8780-b09485f49e64">CRgn</legacyLink> object that identifies a region that defines the area to be removed from the update region. If this parameter is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold>, the entire client area is removed.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The given region must have been created previously by a region function. The region coordinates are assumed to be client coordinates. </para>
                    <para>The <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__beginpaint">BeginPaint</legacyLink> member function automatically validates the entire client area. Neither the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__validaterect">ValidateRect</legacyLink> nor the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>ValidateRgn</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> member function should be called if a portion of the update region must be validated before the next                         <externalLink> <linkText>WM_PAINT</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd145213</linkUri>
                        </externalLink> message is generated.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__windowfrompoint">
        <!--d2f7eae9-3895-40d0-9857-146fb24b1f08-->
        <title>CWnd::WindowFromPoint</title>
        <content>
            <para>Retrieves the window that contains the specified point; <parameterReference>point</parameterReference> must specify the screen coordinates of a point on the screen.</para>
            <legacySyntax>static CWnd* PASCAL WindowFromPoint( POINT point );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>point</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies a <legacyLink xlink:href="a6d4db93-35cc-444d-9221-c3e160f6edaa">CPoint</legacyLink> object or <legacyLink xlink:href="965736d8-4e53-41b6-9b8b-6961992dd21f">POINT</legacyLink> data structure that defines the point to be checked.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>A pointer to the window object in which the point lies. It is <legacyBold>NULL</legacyBold> if no window exists at the given point. The returned pointer may be temporary and should not be stored for later use.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WindowFromPoint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> does not retrieve a hidden or disabled window, even if the point is within the window. An application should use the <legacyLink xlink:href="#cwnd__childwindowfrompoint">ChildWindowFromPoint</legacyLink> member function for a nonrestrictive search.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__windowproc">
        <!--81390b70-464e-4289-898c-c1ab617e7662-->
        <title>CWnd::WindowProc</title>
        <content>
            <para>Provides a Windows procedure ( <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WindowProc</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>) for a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CWnd</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual LRESULT WindowProc(
    UINT message,
    WPARAM wParam,
    LPARAM lParam );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>message</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the Windows message to be processed.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>wParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Provides additional information used in processing the message. The parameter value depends on the message.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>lParam</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Provides additional information used in processing the message. The parameter value depends on the message.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para>The return value depends on the message.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>It dispatches messages through the window's message map.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__winhelp">
        <!--d09916e0-9fc0-4986-9a74-35e6c4a37fbc-->
        <title>CWnd::WinHelp</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called to initiate the WinHelp application.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual void WinHelp(
    DWORD_PTR dwData,
    UINT nCmd = HELP_CONTEXT  );</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>dwData</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies additional data. The value used depends on the value of the <parameterReference>nCmd</parameterReference> parameter.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>nCmd</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>Specifies the type of help requested. For a list of possible values and how they affect the <parameterReference>dwData</parameterReference> parameter, see the                                 <externalLink> <linkText>WinHelp</linkText> <linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb762267</linkUri>
                                </externalLink> Windows function in the <token>winSDK</token>.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content>
                    <para>See <legacyLink xlink:href="e426a3cd-0d15-40d6-bd55-beaa5feb2343#cwinapp__winhelp">CWinApp::WinHelp</legacyLink> for more information.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__registertouchwindow">
        <!--52d3ddc4-b2f1-4610-96c5-cbfadb78d5e2-->
        <title>CWnd::RegisterTouchWindow</title>
        <content>
            <para>Registers or unregisters Windows touch support.</para>
            <legacySyntax>BOOL RegisterTouchWindow(
    BOOL bRegister = TRUE,
    ULONG ulFlags = 0);</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Parameters</title>
                <content>
                    <definitionTable>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>bRegister</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para> <languageKeyword>TRUE</languageKeyword> indicates register Windows touch support; <languageKeyword>FALSE</languageKeyword> otherwise.</para>
                        </definition>
                        <definedTerm> <parameterReference>ulFlags</parameterReference>
                        </definedTerm>
                        <definition>
                            <para>A set of bit flags that specify optional modifications. This field may contain 0 or one of the following values: TWF_FINETOUCH, TWF_WANTPALM.</para>
                        </definition>
                    </definitionTable>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Return Value</title>
                <content>
                    <para> <languageKeyword>TRUE</languageKeyword> if successful; otherwise <languageKeyword>FALSE</languageKeyword>.</para>
                </content>
            </section>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content/>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
    <section address="cwnd__resizedynamiclayout">

        <title>CWnd::ResizeDynamicLayout</title>
        <content>
            <para>Called by the framework when the window size changes to adjust the layout of child windows, if dynamic layout is enabled for the window.</para>
            <legacySyntax>virtual void ResizeDynamicLayout();</legacySyntax>
        </content>
        <sections>
            <section>
                <title>Remarks</title>
                <content/>
            </section>
        </sections>
    </section>
